loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
At around 37, Madame A. Ama is mother of six children. She cares for all the children their unemployed father abandoned. Her principle source of income that allows her to feed and educate the children is the farming and production of "gari," the making of manioc into flour, which she sells at the local market. Currently, she wishes to dedicate her work entirely to the production of gari and other food-producing products, because of the large problem of cultivable land. The town is growing rapidly and the surrounding lands are sold to city-dwellers. It is because of this that she asks for a loan of $1000.00 which will be payed back in one year. She has already received small loans in the past and has re-paid them without difficulty, proof of her good organization and her expertise of her activity.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agée de 37 ans environs, Madame A. Ama est mère de six (06) enfants. Elle a à sa charge tous ses enfants abandonnés par son mari sans emploi. Sa principale source de revenue qui lui permet de nourrir et de scolariser ses enfants est l’agriculture et la production du « gari », transformation du manioc en farine, qu’elle vend au marché de sa localité. Aujourd’hui, elle veut se consacrer entièrement à la vente du gari et aux produits vivriers à cause du problème de terrain cultivable qui se pose avec acuité. La ville est entrain de s’étendre littéralement et les terrains sont entièrement vendus aux citadins. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 à rembourser en un an. Elle a déjà reçu des petits financements qu’elle a bien remboursés sans difficultés, preuve de sa capacité de gestion et de la maîtrise de son activité.

loans.use: Sales of gari and other food-producing products.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Born in 1973, Mr A. Kossi left school in order to begin his business of selling school supplies. A bachelor, he works to support his daily needs and those of his parents who are no longer able to work because of old age. Honest and hard working, he has made his business successful. He is currently asking for a loan of $1,000.00 which will help him to stock his store and to improve his profits. This loan will allow him to expand his business which will result in an improvement of living conditions for he and his family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Né en 1973 Monsieur A. Kossi a abandonné ses études pour se lancer dans le commerce d'articles scolaires. Célibataire, il exerce librement ses activités pour subvenir à ses besoins et celui de ses parents qui n'ont plus la force de travailler à cause de leurs âge. Honnête et très actif il arrive à bien rentabiliser ses activités. Il sollicite à présent un crédit de $1000 qui pourra l’aider à équiper d’avantage sa boutique et de multiplier ainsi ses sources de revenus. Ce crédit va lui permettre d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires ; ce qui aura pour conséquence une amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies and bakery goods.

loans.name: Abuwa

texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Tsévié, Togo, Madam Abuwa D., after having left her studies, started selling a local drink "Tchoukoutchou" (a drink made from sorghum base). Married to an elementary school principal, she contributes to the household with her business income. A very dynamic woman, she has mastered the preparation of this drink, which brings in a multitude of customers. As a result, she has been able to manage and successfully reimburse her loans.

She is now asking for a new credit of $450 that will help her purchase the sorghum as well as other necessary materials. This will help her increase her sales and consequently contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1975 à Tsévié, Madame D. Abuwa, après avoir abandonné ses études s'est lancée dans la vente de boisson locale « Tchoukoutchou » (une boisson fabriquée à base du sorgho). Mariée à un directeur d’école primaire, elle participe aux charges de leur foyer grâce aux revenus de ses ventes. Par son dynamisme et la maîtrise des techniques de préparation de sa boisson qui attire une multitude de clients, elle a fait preuve de capacité de gestion des crédits qu’elle a pu rembourser sans difficulté. Elle sollicite encore un nouveau crédit de $450 qui servira à l’achat de sorgho ainsi que les autres matériels nécessaires. Ceci va lui permettre d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et par conséquent contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of sorghum and materials

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor Julião M., born in Chokwe, Gaza Province, is a daughter of an agricultural family. Considering the social conditions of her family, few children have had the opportunity to attend school. Leonor finished primary school, and, after concluding her studies, Leonor moved to the city of Maputo where she resided with her oldest sister. In 1987, she started a business selling shellfish acquired from fishermen in the Catembe Municipal District. In 1992, she met a fisherman who in turn became her husband. Her and her husband continued to gamble on this business, having together acquired a boat; her husband had worked for a rented boat when they had first met. Right now, they hope to expand to 2 boats and 8 workers. This is a third loan; the first two were used for the purchase of a boat motor and fishing nets. With the current loan they intend to expand their business by increasing the number of new nets, consequently creating new jobs. Their business makes a great impact on: the couple’s life, the income brought about by fishing supports a family of six people; and, the community, more than create jobs, they supply the city of Maputo with shellfish. In the future they hope to invest in the improvement of their living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Leonor Julião M., nasceu em Chokwe, província de Gaza, filha de pai agricultores, dada a condição social da família poucos filhos tiveram possibilidades de estudar, tendo concluído apenas o ensino primário. A pois a conclusão do ensino primário veio Lourenço Marques a então cidade de Maputo onde residiu com a irmã mais velha. Em 1987, iniciou com o negócio de venda de Marisco, onde o produto era adquirido aos pescadores no Distrito Municipal da Catembe. Em 1992 conheceu um pescador o qual veio tornar-se seu marido. Ambos continuaram apostar neste negocio tendo juntos adquirido um barco, pois na altura em que se conheceram o marido trabalhava em barco emprestado. Actualmente contam com 2 (dois ) barcos e 8 trabalhadores Este crédito é o terceiro sendo os dois último foram aplicados na compra do motor de barco e redes de pesca. Com actual empréstimo pretende ampliar o seu negocio incrementando novas redes consequentemente criando novos postos de trabalho. A sua actividade tem um impacto bastante grande, na vida do casal que através da pesca conseguem rendimentos para suportar uma família com seis pessoas e na comunidade pois, para além de criar postos de trabalho, abastecem a cidade de Maputo com mariscos. Pelo estágio actual do negocio, no futuro pretende investir na melhoria das condições habitacionais.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Madam Yawa A. is a 42-year old married mother of five (05) children. After leaving her studies, she started her own business to share the household expenses with her husband, who was previoulsy an official. A very active woman, she manages her business well and brings in solid revenue. Her first two credits were reimbursed without problems.

She would once again like to ask for a $950 credit that would help her build her cloth business and equip her grocery store. She will then be able to increase her sales and contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 42 ans environs, Madame A. Yawa est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Abandonnant ses études, elle exerce ses activités commerciales et arrive à partager les dépenses du foyer avec son mari qui est un ancien préfet. Très active, elle maîtrise bien son commerce qui lui procure assez de revenus. Ses deux premier crédit ont été bien soldé sans incident. De nouveau, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 qui servira à renforcer son commerce de pagnes et à équiper plus sa boutique d’alimentation générale. Elle pourra alors augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of cloths and grocery store materials

loans.name: Cristelo

texts.en:
Cristelo A., a native of Catembe, grew up with his mother and attended school until the eighth grade. Due to increasing pressures he discontinued his studies and has since sought a profession that can help him in the support of his family, especially after his parents’ separation. In 1992, he began an apprenticeship as a mechanic. During these 3 years he also worked in the offices of Radio Mozambique. At the end of these 3 years, he began to work for himself, opening a small vehicle repair shop. In early 2006, he acquired a Land Rover from a friend and began to transport passengers from Catembe to Ponta de Ouro, 120 km from the city of Maputo. Right now, the Land Rover is disabled. With the loan Cristelo intends to repair his vehicle. His services are a positive contribution to the community. The route he operates lacks sufficient transport due to precarious road conditions. Only 4-wheel-drive vehicles like Cristelo’s are capable of traversing these roads. Cristelo also has to account for an increase in rent and securing another job. A family of five, including himself, his wife and three children, are dependent on this business. In the future, he intends to improve his transportation services by obtaining a vehicle with greater passenger accommodation.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristelo A., jovem natural da catembe, cresceu com a mãe, frequentou a escola até a 8ª classe, dada pressão da vida desistiu de estudar procurando desde então uma profissão a qual podia ajudar no sustento familiar uma vez que os pais estava separados. Em 1992, iniciou com aprendizagem da mecânica e tendo trabalhado durante 3 anos na oficina da Rádio Moçambique. Passado os três anos começou a trabalhar por conta própria onde abriu uma pequena oficina de reparação de veiculos. No inicio de 2006 adquiriu um viatura da marca Land Rover a um amigo e iniciou com o transporte de passageiro Catembe-Ponta de Ouro cerca de 120Km da cidade de Maputo. Actualmente a Viatura está avariada e com o crédito pretende reabilitá-la. A sua actividade tem um impacto positivo pois a via que opera tem carência de transporte dada as condições precária da estrada e apenas circulam viaturas com tracção as 4 rodas (4X4) como a dele é que são capazes de transitar. Por outro constitui um incremento da renda familiar e garante mais um posto de trabalho. Deste negocio depende uma família constituída por cinco membros incluindo o próprio a esposa e três filhos. No futuro pretende consolidar mais esta área em adquirir mais um meio de transporte que garante maior comodidade aos passageiros.

loans.use: To buy spares to repair his public transport car

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Tsévié, Mr. Antoine S. is married and a father of three (03) children. He left his studies because of a lack of funds, and subsequently learned to drive a vehicle. After getting his driver's license, he worked for an employer. Since his wife's business was not successful enough to cover the family's expenses, he opened a hardware and grocery shop with his income, in order to provide for his family.

He would like to once again ask for a credit of $800 to buy supplies to better equip his shop. He would like to increase his sales with this credit and contribute to the improvement of his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1965 à Tsévié, Monsieur S. Antoine est marié et père de trois (03) enfant. Par manque de moyens, il abandonna ses études et apprend la conduite de véhicule. Après son permis de conduire, il a eu à travailler pour une tierce personne. Avec ses économies, il a ouvert un boutique de quincaillerie, et d'allimantation afin de subvenir plus aux dépenses de sa famille car le commerce de sa femme n'est pas si florissant pour contribuer aux dépenses. Il solliciter de nouveau un crédit de $ 800 pour s’approvisionner d’autres articles afin de mieux équiper sa boutique. Il compte augmenter son chiffre d’affaire avec ce crédit et contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Restocking his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enable her purchase more energy-saving charcoal stocks

loans.name: Guilhermina

texts.en:
Guilhermina Nhanombe M., 39 years of age and daughter of parents native to the Gaza Province, was born in the city of Maputo, Mozambique’s capital. She was lucky to have studied and finished the 7th grade. An orphan, Guilhermina believes that the death of her mother made her grow up faster; she had small business that allowed her to grow up with her other three siblings. Right now, she has a small, rented commercial establishment where she sells grocery products. The neighborhood where she practices her commercial business has many difficulties in transportation. The people turn to her establishment for the purchase of groceries and other necessities. The number of customers has increased, which in turn necessitates an increase in stock and the diversification of products. This business employs two women, including Guilhermina who supports a family of five. She offers an indispensable service to nearly 60 families in the neighborhood. With this loan she is going to reinforce her stock and diversify the products in her commercial establishment, contributing to a service of quality to her community.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Guilhermina Nhanombe M., de 39 anos, filha de pais oriundos da província de gaza, nasceu na cidade do Maputo Capital de Moçambique, teve a sorte de estudar e quando concluí a 7@ classe. É órfão de mãe, conta que a falecida mãe lhe fez crescer fazendo pequenos negócios com os quais lhes fez crescer com outros três irmãos. Actualmente tem um pequeno estabelecimento comercial alugado, onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade e refrigerantes. O bairro onde ela exerce a actividade comercial têm muitas dificuldades de transporte, as pessoas recorrem ao estabelecimento para compra de produtos. O numero de clientes têm aumentado, dai a necessidade de aumentar stocks e diversificação de produtos. Este negocio emprega duas senhoras, incluindo ela própria que suporta um agregado familiar de cinco pessoas, oferece um serviço indispensável para cerca de sessenta famílias do bairro. Com este empréstimo vai reforçar o stock e diversificar os produtos no seu estabelecimento comercial, contribuindo para um serviço de qualidade para sua comunidade.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

payments.comment: Guilhermina has successfully decided to repay this loan in advance.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Married to two women and a father of six (06) children, Adam G. sells agricultural tools such as the matchet, the hoe and the "daba". He also prepares and sells salicylic creams and ointments, one of which became popular across borders due to its therapeutic properties.

He now sells his products in various communities and distributes to wholesalers that continue to increase the orders. Despite the well reimbursed financings received to date, he still has difficulty satisfying his customers' needs. Today he is asking for a $1000 loan in order to respond to the market needs.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Père de famille et marié à deux femmes et père de six (06) enfants, G. Adam est commerçant des outils agricoles tels que la houe, le daba, le coupe-coupe et se consacre aussi et surtout à la préparation et la vente des pommades salcilés. Une pommade dont la vertu thérapeutique a traversé les frontières. Il a créé des points de vente dans divers localités et a des grossistes qui continuent par multiplier les commandes. Malheureusement malgré les petits financements reçus et bien remboursés, il n’arrive pas à satisfaire à temps et en quantité ses clients. Il sollicite aujourd’hui un financement de $1000 afin de répondre au besoin du marché.

loans.use: Preparing and selling creams

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Born in 1943, Mrs. Beauty A. is married and a mother of three (03) children. Her main business activity is the sale of cosmetic products. With this income, she manages to contribute to the household needs. As a good business manager, she has reimbursed her loans several times without any problems.

At this time, she is asking for a credit of $700 to build her business and to increase her source of income. With this new credit, she will be able to make her business more profitable and to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1943 Madame A. Beauty est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente des produits cosmétiques ; avec ses revenus, elle arrive à contribuer aux dépenses de son foyer. Par sa bonne gestion, elle a plusieurs fois honoré ses engagements sans incidents. A présent, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 pour renforcer son commerce et multiplier ses sources de revenus. Avec ce nouveau crédit, elle pourra rentabiliser plus ses affaires et contribuer efficacement à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo Jossefa Z., 39 years of age and a son of livestock breeders, was born in Mugazine in the Catembe District. Being a father of 4 and having worked 10 years in South Africa, he obtained little understanding of his family’s business. He returned to Mozambique after the general peace agreement terminated a 16-year conflict and brought with him a truck allowing him to transport freight and passengers from Catembe to the South African border. He worked with this vehicle for many years, and it broke down at the end of 2000. Beginning in 2001 he worked as a driver, no longer self-employed. With the money earned as a driver we was able to purchase another smaller freight vehicle to transport freight from his small grocery store. At this time, he obtained a mini bus that necessitated repair to transport people with a degree of security. With the present loan he intends to repair the mini bus so that he can again transport passengers, a job he considers his forte. His transportation business has a positive impact on the community. There is a shortage of local transportation, and Alfredo hopes to minimize this problem while also guaranteeing two more jobs, including himself.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Alfredo Jossefa Z., de 39 anos de idade, nasceu em Mugazine Distrito de Catembe, filho de Criadores de gado. Tem pouco nível de escolaridade característica própria de família de criadores. É pai de 4 filhos tendo trabalhado durante 10 anos na Africa do Sul, regressou a Moçambique depois do acordo geral de paz que terminaram com o conflito que durou 16 anos, donde trouxe um camião pelo qual fazia transporte de carga e passageiros da Catembe até a fronteira com África do Sul. Trabalhou com esta viatura durante longos anos e veio avariar nos finas de 2000 e a partir de 2001 começou a trabalhar como motorista. Com os rendimentos conseguiu compra outra viatura pequena de carga para transporte de carga da sua lojinha de venda de produtos de 1ª necessidade. Neste momento adquiriu uma Mini bus que precisa de uma reparação para transporte de pessoas com certa segurança. Com o presente crédito pretende reparar a Mini-bus de forma a recomeçar com actividade de Transporte de Passageiro que é o seu forte. Este actividade tem um impacto positivo, pois há carência de transporte no local onde pretende desenvolver a actividade e com este meio irá minimizar os problema da falta de transporte que afecta a zona bem como garantir mais dois postos de trabalho contando com ele próprio.

loans.use: To buy spares to repair mini bus

loans.name: Doh

texts.en:
Mrs. Doh Y. is a 55 year-old mother of two (02) children. Even though she is exhausted by working in the field, she also remains very active as an entrepreneur. Today, she wants to exclusively work to purchase gari, store it and resell it along with other various products such as charcoal and other domestic products.

This is why she is asking for a credit of $400. We should make note that she has always reimbursed her financings and has enormous experience in the management of her business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Epuisée par le travail de la terre, Madame Y. Doh âgée de 55 ans et mère de deux (02) enfants, reste très active et entreprenante. Aujourd’hui, elle veut se limiter à l’achat de gari, en faire stockage pour le revendre en y associant les produits divers tels que la vente du charbon de bois et d’autres produits à usage domestique. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $400 . Signalons qu’elle a toujours fait preuve d’une bonne impression lors des financements antérieurs reçu et a une expérience énorme dans la gestion de son activité.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of gari (a traditional food)

loans.name: Essi

texts.en:
Mrs. Essi A. was born in 1962 in Tsévié. She is married and a mother of four (04) children. Once a public officer, her husband is now a teacher and is able to provide very little to the household. Having only completed primary education courses, she started selling "Kom" (a local food) very early in her life, in a local school but now also has a business of selling dried fish in Tsévié and in neighbouring markets.

Dynamic and honest, she loaned and reimbursed credits four times without any problems. She is now asking for a credit of $850 to build her dried fish commerce. Thanks to this income, she will be able to provide for her family and improve their living condition.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Essi est née en 1962 à Tsévié. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son époux enseignant retraité de la fonction publique investi très peu dans les dépenses domestiques. Ayant seulement fait le cours primaire, elle a commencé par vendre très tôt du « Kom » dans un établissement scolaire de la place mais aussi, elle fait le commerce des poissons séchés à Tsévié et dans les marchés voisins. Dynamique et honnête, elle a bénéficié quatre fois de suite de crédits qui sont tous remboursés sans difficulté. Pour renforcer, son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui sera consacré uniquement à la vente des poissons séchés. Grâce aux revenus elle pourra faire face aux nombreuses dépenses de la famille en vue d'une amélioration de leur condition de vie.

loans.use: Restocking dried fish

loans.name: Ami

texts.en:
21 years old, married and a mother of a child, but illiterate, Mrs. Ami G., is specialized in the sale of peppers and gari (a local food) because of her very limited financial means . Today, she wants to take advantage of her youth to launch greater scale initiatives. She is asking for a credit of $1000 in order to be able to build a business to sell rice, oil, sugar and charcoal.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 21 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant, Madame G. Ami, analphabète, est spécialisée dans la vente de piments et du gari à cause de ses moyens financiers très limités. Aujourd’hui, elle veut mettre à profit son jeune âge pour se lancer dans des initiatives de grande envergure. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour le commerce du riz, de l’huile, du sucre en poudre et du charbon de bois.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of rice, oil, sugar and charcoal

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.en:
Born in 1976 in Davédi, Mrs. Ayawavi A. lives in a union with a carpenter who does not manage to take care of the family's needs. She has learned some tailoring and now works with a girlfriend. However, taking into account her experience and the number of customers, she believes that she would profit more from working alone.

In order to accomplish this, she is asking for a credit of $950 which she will use for the renting a workshop space, purchasing a machine and selling her products. She will thus be able to take care of her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1976 à Davédi, Madame A. Ayawavi vit dans une union de fait avec un menuisier qui n’arrive pas à la prendre en charge. Elle se débrouille avec la couture qu’elle a apprise entre temps. Actuellement elle est associée à une copine pour le travail. Mais compte tenu de son expérience et du nombre de ses clients, elle pense s’installer seule pour bien profiter de son travail. Pour la réalisation de ce projet, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 qui va servir à la location de l’atelier, à l’achat de machine et à la vente des articles de mercerie. Ainsi donc, elle pourra se prendre convenablement en charge.

loans.use: Renting a space for making and selling drapery products

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
37 years old, Mrs. Abla G. is her husband's first wife. Together, they have five (05) children, out of the eight (08) who are part of the family. Conscious of the responsibilities she has for her children and the irresponsibility of her polygamous husband, she has decided not to remain in misery.

She is a semi-wholesaler and distributor of cereals on market days and on her free days. She also sells akassa balls with fried fish. She has always been appreciated by her customers. Today, she is asking for a loan of $1000 to supply her business with enough cereal during the production period.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 37 ans, Madame G. Abla est la première femme de son mari avec cinq (05) enfants sur huit (08) que compte la famille. Consciente des responsabilités qui l’attendent pour l’avenir de ses enfants et de l’irresponsabilité de son mari polygame, elle a pris les dispositions à temps pour ne pas demeurer dans la misère. Elle est semi grossiste et détaillante de céréales les jours de marché et les jours libres. Elle en profite également pour faire de la restauration en vendant des boules d’akassas accompagnées de poissons frits. Cette stratégie fait qu’elle a été toujours appréciée par ses clients. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite $1000 pour aller s’approvisionner en céréales dans les grandes zones de production.

loans.use: Purchase, storage and resale of cereals

loans.name: Paulin

texts.en:
Mr. Paulin A. was born in Tsévié on June 22, 1970. He is married and takes care of four children. When he gave up school, he studied to become a bricklayer. He had a difficult time finding work, so he began to sell gas on the side of the road. Because this was a fairly dangerous business, he decided to become a motorcycle taxi driver and has been one for quite some time now. His wife sells prepared beans and earns very little to help support their family.

Mr. A. is an energetic man with high moral standards who does all he can to meet his family's needs. To continue as a motorcycle taxi driver, he is requesting a loan of $1000, which will allow him to both buy his own motorcycle and pay for the registration fees. He could then increase his income and take better care of himself and his family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 22 juin 1970 à Tsévié, Monsieur A. Paulin est marié et a en charge quatre enfants. Abandonnant ses études, il se forme en maçonnerie. Ne trouvant pas de marché, il vend de l’essence au bord de la route. Compte tenu du risque de cette activité, il décida de conduire une moto taxi, ce qu’il fait il y a un bon moment. Sa femme revendeuse de haricot préparé, gagne très peu pour l’aider dans les charges de la famille.

Dynamique et de bonne moralité, il fait beaucoup d’effort pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Pour avoir sa propre moto, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui va lui permettre d’une part d’acheter la moto et d’autre part de faire les formalités pour l’immatriculation. Il pourra ainsi avoir plus de revenu et s’occuper plus de lui-même et de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for use as a taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase energy-saving charcoal stocks for her charcoal selling business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Ms. Marie V. has been selling traditional African cloth since a young age. She is now 54 but has not lost her talents as a saleswoman. She had been living with her four children in a polygamous household, which was very difficult for her, but she now lives far from her husband. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to ensure the success of her cloth-selling business, as she regularly has to renew her stock with new cloth as it becomes available in order to satisfy and keep her clients. She is a very experienced woman who deserves a loan in order to help her pull herself out of the hardship she has faced for so long.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Revendeuse de pagnes depuis son jeune âge, Madame V. Marie, a aujourd’hui 54 ans mais n’a pas perdu les anciennes habitudes de grande commerçante. Malheureusement elle a vécu dans un foyer polygame avec quatre (04) enfants où elle n’a connu que trop de difficulté. Aujourd’hui elle vit loin de son mari et sollicite juste un financement de $1000 pour les exigences de son métier de vendeuse de pagnes. Il faut renouveler régulièrement le stock à cause de nouveaux pagnes qui sortent tous les jours afin de maintenir et de fidéliser les clients. C’est une femme très expérimentée qui mérite un soutien financier pour l’aider à sortir des difficultés qu’elle traverse depuis.

loans.use: To buy and sell traditional cloth

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Ms. Akossiwa N. is a 36-year-old mother of three children living in a polygamous family. She has had to work hard to give her children a better life and to earn the respect of her husband and his other wives. She says that in order to do so, she has much work to do in developing her cloth-selling business. She needs enough capital to regularly renew her stock. This is why she is requesting a loan of $1200, which will allow her to renew her stock of traditional cloth in order to corner the market and satisfy her clients. In the past, she has always proven herself to be a trustworthy woman.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 36 ans et mère de trois (03) enfants dans une famille polygame, Madame N. Akossiwa a pour défi de travailler dur pour éviter la traîne à ses enfants et se faire respecter par son mari et ses coépouses. Ainsi, le commerce de pagne à des exigences nous a-t-elle confié. Il faut disposer de fonds de commerce conséquent afin de renouveler régulièrement le stock. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement de $1200, un montant qui lui permettra de renouveler son stock de pagnes pour conquérir le terrain et fidéliser les clients. Elle a toujours fait preuve d’une bonne conduite par le passé.

loans.use: To renew her stock of traditional cloth

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Ms. Abla S. is a 37-year-old, illiterate woman who is married to a man with no income. She is the mother of four children who also takes care of two of her sisters. Her business consists of selling fried fish and “gari” (cassava flour). There are periods when there is an abundance of gari (the rainy season) and prices fall and periods when there is very little gari (the dry season) and prices jump because the supply falls.

Ms. S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy barrels in order to stock gari in times of abundance and to earn a maximum profit from sales during the dry season. The loan will allow this courageous and enterprising woman to make her business profitable and get out of the vicious cycle of poverty in which she and her family are caught.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 37 ans, Mme S. Abla est une femme illettrée, mariée à un homme sans aucun moyen et mère de quatre (04) enfants avec deux (02) sœurs à charge. Elle a comme activité principale, la vente du poisson frit et du gari (la farine de manioc). Le gari à ses périodes d’abondance (période des pluies) où les prix chutes et les périodes de soudure (saison sèche) où les prix flambent car l’offre baisse.

Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour s’acheter des fûts afin de pouvoir faire le stockage de gari en période d’abondance et en tirer le maximum de profit lors de la vente en saison sèche. Ce financement permettra à cette femme courageuse et entreprenante de rentabiliser son commerce afin de sortir du cercle vicieux de la pauvreté dans lequel se trouvent elle-même et sa famille.

loans.use: To buy barrels to stock “gari”

loans.name: Assaba

texts.en:
Ms. Assaba B., born March 18, 1975 in Aného, is married with one child. After secondary school, she learned to sew. She has been living in Tsévié for four years with her husband, who is a framer. As the couple takes care of a niece in addition to their own child, her husband can barely meet the family's needs alone. So Ms. B. has begun to stock corn in order to help him with the household expenses. She is a good business manager who has already received and paid off two loans.

The loan of $1000 she is currently requesting will go toward stocking and selling corn. She will then be able to contribute to the household income and to improve her living conditions and those of her whole family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère d’un enfant, Madame B. Assaba est née le 18 mars 1975 à Aného. Après ses études secondaires, elle a appris la couture. Installé à Tsévié depuis quatre ans, son époux encadreur d'un groupement, arrivait à peine à satisfaire les besoins de la famille car en plus de leur propre enfant, elle a en charge une nièce. Afin d’aider son mari dans les dépenses de la maison, elle commence par stocker du maïs. Bonne gestionnaire, elle a bénéficié deux fois de crédit qu’elle a déjà soldé.

Ce crédit de $1000 qu’elle sollicite sera consacré au stockage et à la vente de maïs. Ainsi, elle pourra contribuer aux dépenses de la famille et par conséquent une amélioration de condition de sa vie et celle de la famille toute entière.

loans.use: To stock and sell corn

loans.name: Mawuto

texts.en:
Ms. Mawuto A. was born in 1964 in Gati. She is divorced and takes care of three children. After primary school she soon realized that her calling was in business, so from a young age until today, she has been selling cloth, prepared rice and other goods. She has already received and repaid four loans.

She is currently requesting a loan of $1000, which will allow her to continue running her cloth-selling business and her restaurant in addition to building a stock of palm oil. She hopes this loan will allow her to increase the profitability of her business and to better improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1964 à Gati, Madame A. Mawuto est divorcée et a à sa charge trois enfants. Après ses études primaires, elle a vite compris qu’elle serait plus à l’aise, si elle faisait du commerce. Ainsi depuis son jeune âge jusqu ‘à ce jour, elle vend des pagnes, du riz préparé et autres. Elle est à son quatrième de crédit qui a été bien soldé.

Elle sollicite aujourd'hui un montant de $1000 qui va lui permettre de continuer son commerce de pagne et son restaurant mais au même moment, elle va faire son stockage d’huile de palme. Avec ce crédit, elle espère rentabiliser son activité, et contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To buy traditional cloth and other items

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
At 46, Ms. Akossiwa K. is a widow with four children who also takes care of three other people. Since the death of her husband she has gone through much hardship. She has had to struggle, working small jobs to feed and educate her children. She has begun selling straw baskets, something used by all merchants in the region to transport their goods. This is a very simple yet prosperous business.

Straw baskets are produced in regions with large palm oil plantations, so Ms. K. is requesting a loan of $800 in order to go to production areas to build up her stock. She is a woman who has managed to get by despite facing poverty, and she needs a loan in order to finally allow her to live decently with her children, even without their father.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

A 46 ans, K. Akossiwa est veuve avec quatre (04) enfants et trois (03) autres personnes à sa charge. C’est une femme qui a connu les pires situations depuis le décès de son mari. Laissée à elle-même avec ses enfants, elle était obligée de se battre en faisant de petits commerces pour nourrir et scolariser ses enfants. Pour cela elle faisait le commerce de panier, un matériel utilisé par tous les commerçants pour le transport des marchandises. Un commerce très simple mais très florissant. Il est produit dans les régions à grande plantation de palmier à huile.

Pour atteindre la zone de production afin d’avoir un stocke énorme, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 . Cette femme qui, malgré le poids de la pauvreté, arrive à s’en sortir, nécessite un appui afin de lui permettre de vivre décemment avec ses enfants orphelins.

loans.use: To buy and sell straw baskets

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Ms. Afi A. was born in 1977 in Dalavé. Her family did not have enough money to continue sending her to school, so she began helping her mother to sell various items. Thus began her career in business. As she got older, she began selling traditional cloth thanks to loans that she received and paid off regularly. She is married and the mother of three children, and her husband, a motorcycle taxi driver, tries to help her with the household expenses.

She is an energetic and honest woman who has earned the trust of her customers and those around her. Ms. A. is requesting a loan of $1000 to strengthen her cloth-selling business. This will allow her to sell cloth even outside of her town. She will then be able to take care of her children in the way she would like.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Afi est née en 1977 à Dalavé. Abandonnant ses études faute de moyens, elle commence par aider sa maman dans la vente des objets divers d’où son expérience en commerce. Devenu âgée, elle initia la vente de pagne grâce aux crédits qu’elle a reçu et à payer normalement. Mariée, elle est mère de trois enfants. Son époux conducteur de taxi moto essaie de l’aider dans les dépenses de la maison.

Dynamique et de bonne foi, elle a la confiance de son entourage et de ses clients. Pour renforcer son commerce de pagnes, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui va lui permettre de faire le commerce même faire un commerce vers l’extérieur. Elle pourra ainsi s’occuper dignement de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy traditional cloth

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Ms. Abla A., 37, is a woman with little education who has one child. She is her husband's second wife and is a trained hairdresser with a beauty salon. She lives in a place where the lack of clean water is sharply felt, so she built a well and started collecting water reserves. This, however, was not enough, as everyone in the village is still badly in need of water. This is why she has decided to turn the well into a water drilling system. To do so, she is requesting a loan of $1200. She will pay it back by selling water to the people in the village, which will earn her enough income to improve her economic condition.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Deuxième femme de son mari, Madame A. Abla, âgée de 37 ans, est une femme d’un niveau d’étude moyen avec un enfant. Coiffeuse de formation avec un atelier à son actif, elle vit dans un milieu où le problème d’eau se pose avec acuité. Elle s’est fait un puits et des retenus d’eau. Mais cela reste insuffisant car toute la population en manque terriblement. C’est pourquoi elle a décidé de transformer le puit en un système de forage. Pour y arriver elle sollicite un financement de $1200. Son remboursement se fera par la vente d’eau à la population, une vente qui va générer des revenus susceptibles d’améliorer la situation économique de la dame.

loans.use: Water drilling

loans.name: Atsoupi

texts.en:
Ms. Atsoupi G. was born in 1976 in Kladjemé. At a young age, she began helping her parents with their work in the fields and around the house. When she came of age she had no professional training, so she requested her first loan to start selling earrings. Today she is no longer totally dependent on her husband, and she can contribute more to the household income. She is a married mother of five children who also takes care of two of her husband's children. She is energetic and honest and has regularly repaid her first loan and is now requesting another.

This new loan of $850 will allow her to sell jewelry, bracelets and other items at the markets in Cotonou and Accra. With her income she hopes to do more for her family and especially for her children.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1976 à Kladjemé, Madame G. Atsoupi n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter. A bas âge, elle aidait les parents dans les travaux champêtres et domestiques. Devenu majeure et n’ayant appris aucun métier. Elle sollicita un premier crédit pour la vente de boucles d’oreilles, et aujourd’hui elle ne dépend plus entièrement de son mari. D’ailleurs elle contribue plus aux charges de la famille. Mariée et mère de cinq enfants et deux enfants de son mari en charge, elle est dynamique et honnête, elle a pu remboursé normalement son crédit et sollicite un autre.

Cette nouvelle demande de $850 va permettre à faire le marché de Cotonou et d’Accra dans la vente des bijoux, bracelets et autres. Avec les revenus, elle espère faire plus à la famille surtout aux enfants.

loans.use: To buy a supply of earrings

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
At only 20 years of age, Ms. Yawa L. is a married mother of two children. She did not have the chance to attend primary school, nor to learn a craft, so she quickly became involved in business. She sells palm oil, gari [granulated cassava flour], coconuts and anything else that will earn her money. She is a hard worker who conducts her business with joy and dedication. In order to improve her sales figures and profits, she is asking for a loan of $400, which will be largely sufficient for reviving her current business.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 20 ans seulement, Madame L. Yawa est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Elle n’a pas eu la chance de poursuivre ses études primaires, ni d’apprendre un métier et s’est vite engagée dans le commerce. Elle vend de l’huile de palme, du gari, de la noix de coco et tout ce qui peut rapporter de l’argent. Très laborieuse, elle exerce cette activité avec joie et dévouement. Pour améliorer son chiffre d’affaires et ses bénéfices, elle sollicite un financement de $400 qui suffisent largement pour relancer ses activités actuelles.

loans.use: Strengthen sales of palm oil, gari [granulated cassava flour] and coconut

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Mr. Kossi A. is a 40-year-old trained carpenter and a married father of 2 children. He does not possess a strong basic education, but he has found his passion in carpentry. He has opened a small shop, which he manages with difficulty due to his lack of financial resources. His need for wood, the primary material for his work, as well as for modern tools represents the largest roadblock for the rapid growth of the shop and therefore his revenues. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase wood and tools. This will allow him to get his business back on the market. After the repayment of this loan, an additional loan will allow him to better equip himself.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Menuisier de formation, Monsieur A. Kossi, âgé de 40 ans, est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. C’est un monsieur qui n’a pas une formation de base solide et c’est dans la menuiserie qu’il a trouvée sa passion. Il a ouvert un petit atelier qu’il gère avec difficulté, faute de moyens financiers. Le bois comme matière première pour le travail et les outils de travail les plus modernes constituent les goulots d’étranglements de l’avancement rapide de l’atelier et donc de ses revenus. Il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour s’acheter du bois et quelques outils. Cela lui permettra de se relancer sur le marché. Après le remboursement de ce crédit, un autre crédit permettra de mieux équiper.

loans.use: Purchase wood and carpentry tools

loans.name: Komivi

texts.en:
Komivi D. is a 44-year-old polygamous father of seven children and guardian of 6 others. A surveyor/draftsman by training, he became involved in the raising of small farm animals due to the high cost of living and the lack of animal protein in the region. He is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase better breeds, conduct renovations to improve the animal enclosures, purchase feed and pay for veterinary assistance. He has a lot of experience in this domain and hopes to make it more profitable in order to improve the quality of life of the local people as well as his own family.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Polygame âgé de 44 ans, D. Komivi est père de sept (07) enfants et six (06) autres à charge. Géomètre dessinateur de formation, il s’est lancé dans l’élevage de petits ruminants, à cause de la cherté de la vie et du manque de protéine animale dans la zone. Il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour s’acheter des races améliorer, faire des réaménagements pour rendre plus conforme la clôture des animaux, s’acheter des aliments et payer les assistances des vétérinaires. C’est un homme qui a beaucoup d’expérience dans ce domaine et compte bien le rentabiliser pour améliorer la qualité de vie des populations et de sa propre famille.

loans.use: Renovate animal enclosures, acquire new breeds of animals

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Mr. Felix B., father of one child, was born on November 21, 1964, in Akoumapé in Vo prefecture, where he completed secondary school. After having abandoned his studies, he learned welding and works as a welder to this day. He has already borrowed, managed and repaid two consecutive loans.

He is a dynamic individual who wishes to strengthen his business. For this reason, he is seeking a loan of $800 for the purchase of new machines and sheet metal for the manufacture of objects for sale. This will allow him to increase his revenues, which will serve to improve the living conditions of his child as well as his entire family.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Père d’un enfant, Monsieur B. Félix est né le 21 novembre 1964 à Akoumapé dans la préfecture de VO, où il a fait ses études jusqu’au cours secondaire. Après avoir abandonné les études, il a appris la soudure. Un métier qu’il exerce jusqu’à ce jour. Il avait obtenu, géré et remboursé deux fois de suite de crédit. Dynamique, il veut renforcer son activité. Pour cette raison, il sollicite un crédit de $800 pour l’achat de nouvelles machines et des tôles pour la fabrication des objets destinés à la vente. Ainsi, il pourra avoir plus de revenus qui serviront à l’amélioration des conditions de son enfant et de toute la famille

loans.use: Purchase of sheet metal and new machinery

loans.name: Enyovi Angèle

texts.en:
Ms. Enyovi Angèle N., a 23-year-old mother of one daughter, is a trained seamstress. Without any help from her unemployed husband, she opened a dressmaking shop that has not been very successful. For this reason, she would like to combine the sale of traditional wrap dresses with that of sewing products. She is therefore asking for a loan of $1,000 for the purchase of sewing products and the sale of wrap dresses. Angèle hopes to make her shop profitable through this financial assistance.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 23 ans et mère d’une petite fille, Madame N. Enyovi Angèle est couturière de formation. Sans aucun appui de son mari chômeur, elle a ouvert un atelier de couture qui ne marche pas très bien auquel elle veut associer le commerce de pagne et la vente des produits de mercerie. Elle sollicite pour cette fin un crédit de $1000 pour l’achat des produits de mercerie et la vente de pagnes. Angèle compte sur ce financement pour rentabiliser son atelier.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of traditional wrap dresses and sewing products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase addiotional inventory for her pharmacy

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama F. is the wife of a monogamous husband and the mother of five children. She is illiterate and 39 years of age. Her primary business is the production and sale of palm oil. Her secondary activity is the sale of gari [granulated cassava]. Her husband, a farmer, does not make enough from his work to help his wife cover the family's expenses and the children's education. She must therefore fend for herself in her small business in order to meet the family's basic needs. The adequate supply of quality palm nuts remains her sole preoccupation. For this reason, to aid in this task she is requesting a loan of $800 in order to travel to the major production areas of the country in order to obtain better products at more reasonable and advantageous prices. This loan, which she plans to repay within 12 months, will have a significant impact on her business and above all her family’s financial situation.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Femme d’un mari monogame, F. Ama est mère de cinq (05) enfants, analphabète, et est âgée de 39 ans. Elle a pour activité principale la préparation et la vente d’huile de palme et comme activité secondaire la vente du gari. Son mari, agriculteur, ne tire pas grand-chose de son travail pour aider sa femme à supporter les dépenses de la famille et la scolarisation des enfants. Elle est obligée de se débrouiller seule par son petit commerce pour subvenir aux besoins primaires de sa famille. L’approvisionnement de la noix de palme en qualité et en quantité suffisante reste sa seule préoccupation C’est pourquoi pour l’aider dans cette tâche, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour se rendre dans les zones de grande production du pays afin de s’approvisionner des meilleures produits à des prix plutôt mesurés et avantageux. Ce crédit qu’elle se propose de rembourser en douze mois aura un impact significatif sur son activité et surtout sur la situation financière de sa famille.

loans.use: Production and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Mitsokéwo

texts.en:
Ms. Mitsokéwo D. was born on November 4, 1982, in Tsévié. She attended secondary school in the same town before training as a hair stylist, her current occupation. A married mother of two, her husband teaches at a private school located 15 km from town. His salary there is barely sufficient to cover his transportation and expenses. He therefore only comes home on the weekends. Not wanting to rely solely on her husband, in addition to her hair salon, she has started selling certain products. The requested loan of $850 will thus aid in the sale of cosmetics and products such as cloth, bags, shoes, etc., in the interior of the country. She will therefore be able to increase her contribution and improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Mitsokéwo, est née le 04 novembre 1982 à Tsévié. Elle a fait ses études secondaires dans la même localité avant de se former en coiffure qu’elle exerce actuellement. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, son mari enseigne dans une école privée située à quinze kilomètres de la ville, Le salaire de ce dernier suffit à peine pour assurer son déplacement et sa prise en charge donc, il ne revient que les fins de semaine. Ne voulant pas laisser toute la charge sur le mari, en plus de son atelier de coiffure, elle a installé la vente de certains produits et articles. Ainsi, ce crédit de $850 sollicité servira à vendre les produits cosmétiques et les produits de liquidation tels que tissus, sacs, chaussures etc. à l’intérieur du pays. Elle pourra ainsi augmenter sa contribution pour une amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cosmetic products, bags and shoes

loans.name: Afi Véronique

texts.en:
Ms. Afi Véronique S. is an illiterate woman with 4 children whose main business activity is the sale of gari [granulated cassava]. The work is difficult and exhausting, but it helps her meet the needs of her children. She has another project in mind for the near future: selling general food products. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of $1,200. No stranger to the rigors of business management, she is assuring repayment of this loan in 12 months. The loan will allow her to breathe new life into her business and improve her family’s financial and social situation.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Avec quatre (04) enfants, Madame S. Afi Véronique, femme illettrée, a pour activité principale, la vente du gari. Un travail difficile et épuisant qu’elle exerce pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Elle a d’autre projet pour un avenir proche : faire le commerce de l’alimentation générale. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $1200. N’étant pas étrangère à la rigueur dans la gestion de son activité commerciale, elle rassure rembourser ce crédit en douze (12) mois, crédit qui lui permettra de donner un nouveau souffle à son commerce et d’améliorer la situation économique et sociale de sa famille.

loans.use: Sale of gari [granulated cassava] and other food products

loans.name: Egnonam

texts.en:
Born October 23rd, 1958 in Gapé Kpédi, Mrs. Egnonam A. is married and the mother of five children. A seamstress by training, she lives in Tsévié where she opened her workshop and has been happily sewing for the last several years. Having only completed primary school, she does her best to get by to support the needs of her family. Her husband, who lives in Lomé, is unable to provide for the family because he doesn’t make enough money from his job as a cashier. In order to meet her costs of living, Egnonam applied for and was granted a loan, which she repaid on time.

In order to strengthen her business and make it more profitable, she is seeking a new loan of $800 to buy various traditional fabric and textiles to resell in nearby markets. She will then be able to improve the standard of living of all of her family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 23 octobre 1958 à Gapé Kpédi, Madame A. Egnonam est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Couturière de formation, elle s’est installée à Tsévié où elle a ouvert son atelier et exerce son métier avec joie depuis plusieurs années. Ayant seulement fait le cours primaire, elle se débrouille pour gérer au mieux son activité et supporter les charges de la famille. Son mari résidant à Lomé, n’arrive pas à s’occuper des besoins de la famille car sa profession de caissier ne lui permettait pas réellement de le faire. Pour faire face au coût de la vie, elle avait sollicité et obtenu un crédit qu’elle avait bien géré remboursé. Pour renforcer donc son activité et mieux la rentabiliser, elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $800 qui va consister à acheter différentes sortes de pagnes et des tissus à revendre dans les marchés environnants. Elle pourra ainsi contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de toute la famille.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of traditional cloth and textiles

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Kossi D., married and father of one child, is 30 years of age and currently works as a motorcycle-taxi driver for his cousin to whom he hands over all his receipts. The meager salary he receives in return does not allow him to provide adequately for the needs of his family. Kossi has no other formal training and no other career skills. Having already acquired ample experience driving a motorcycle-taxi, he hopes to become self-employed by purchasing a small motorcycle. He is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy a motorcycle so that he can keep the proceeds of his work himself in order to provide a higher quality of life for himself and his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Marié et père d’un enfant, Monsieur D. Kossi, âgée de 30 ans est un conducteur de taxi moto appartenant à un cousin à qui il verse toutes les recettes. Le maigre salaire qu’il perçoit ne lui permet pas de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Lui-même n’a reçu aucune formation et n’a appris aucun métier. Ayant déjà acquis une grande expérience dans la conduite de taxi moto, il compte maintenant travailler pour son propre compte en achetant une moto lui appartenant personnellement. Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 afin de s’acheter une moto lui permettant de disposer de ses recettes lui-même afin de mener une vie de qualité avec sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle for use as a taxi   (Achat d'une moto pour le taxi)

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Madame A. Kossiwa was born April 19, 1950 in Tsevie. Her husband has left her with the care of five children. Even though she never attended school, she is a master of her work. Her dynamism has allowed her to begin sales of "Kom" that, today, is what allows the survival of her family. She is asking for a loan of $750.00 to stock corn which will be used to make "Kom." She will also be able to sell during the "stopping season." With her profits, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame A. Kossiwa est née le 19 avril 1950 à Tsévié. Son mari décédé à laissé à sa charge cinq enfants. Quand bien même qu’elle n’a pas été à l’école, elle a une maîtrise de son activité. Son dynamisme lui a permis d’initier la vente de « Kom » qui aujourd’hui, fait survivre la famille. Elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour faire un stock de maïs qui doit lui servir dans la préparation du met. Elle pourra aussi en vendre en période de soudure. Avec ces revenus, elle pense améliorer les conditions d’existence de toute la famille.

loans.use: Stock and sales of corn.

loans.name: Kofi Zakari

texts.en:
A 24 year-old young man, Mr. S. Kofi Zakari specializes in selling food products such as various brands of rice, cooking oil, and other basic necessities. Despite his best efforts, he hasn’t managed to establish a good base for his business, especially considering the financial problems he’s facing at the moment. For this reason he’s seeking a $1200 loan to purchase inventory and add sugar and other products to his merchandise stock. He is a very ambitious young man without means who deserves to be supported.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase, stocking and resale of rice, sugar and other food products

loans.name: Kodjo Jean

texts.en:
Married and the father of two children, Mr. A. Kodjo Jean was born in 1968 in Tsevie. After high school, he learned to be a barber, and has been working in Tsevie for the last ten years. His wife is a retailer of vegetables in the Tsevie market but canft significantly contribute to supporting the family because her income is so meager. Thus Kodjo Jean is the familyfs sole provider. In order to attract customers and increase his income, he needs to renovate his barber shop. He has already received one loan which allowed him to open the shop, and which he repaid before the due date.

He is now seeking a new $700 loan to repair the roof of his shop, as well as to buy new clippers and other equipment. He will thus be able to increase his business and better provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

MariEet père de deux enfants, Monsieur A. Kodjo Jean est nEen 1968 ETséviE Après ses études secondaires, il a appris la coiffure, métier qu’il exerce actuellement ETséviEil y a dix ans. Son épouse revendeuse de légumes au marchEde TséviEne contribue pas réellement Ela satisfaction des besoins de la famille car son revenu est trop maigre. Ce qui fait qu’il supporte seul la famille. Pour attirer la clientèle afin d’augmenter son revenu, il a besoin de rénover son atelier d’oEcette demande. Précisons qu’il avait eu un crédit pour l’ouverture de l’atelier et qui a étEremboursEavant l’échéance. Il sollicite donc une somme de $700 pour la réfection du toit, l’achat de nouvelles tondeuses et d’autres outils de travail. Il pourra ainsi faire plus d’affaires et subvenir mieux aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Barber shop renovation

loans.name: Cyrille

texts.en:
Twenty-five years old and single, B. Cyrille is a computer technician and seller of computer equipment. He’s a young man who really applies himself in his technical field, but who lacks financial means. To re-energize his activities and possess capital would give him greater bargaining leverage with his suppliers, so he’s seeking a loan of $1200 for the purchase and resale of computer equipment and also to open a small word processing and photocopy service. This is a young man with lots of experience and courage who deserves assistance that will help him really go far.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Jeune célibataire de 25 ans, B. Cyrille est un technicien en informatique et vendeur des consommables informatiques. C’est un jeune homme qui exerce réellement dans son domaine de formation avec une très grande expérience mais les moyens financiers lui font défaut. Pour redynamiser son activités et avoir un fonds de commerce conséquent lui permettant de disposer d’une force de négociation avec ses fournisseurs, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour l’achat et la vente de consommables informatiques et ouvrir à côté un petit service de traitement de texte et de photocopie. C’est un jeune pétri d’expérience et courageux qui mérite d’être propulsé loin.

loans.use: purchase and sale of computer equipment

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Kossi D., aged 50, is married to two wives and father of six children. Trained as an auto body painter, he is presently working at that trade but with great difficulty due to lack of financial resources. His great worry is how to come by a new compressor pump to replace his old one that makes him lose a lot of customers.

He is asking for a loan of $1000 for the purchase of a new compressor pump which will permit him to regain his clientele and save on labor time.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Agé de 50 ans, monsieur D. Kossi est marié à deux femmes et père de six (06) enfants. Il a reçu une formation de Peintre auto, métier qu’il exerce en ce moment avec beaucoup de difficultés parce que les moyens financiers lui font défauts. Il n’a qu’un souci, l’achat d’une nouvelle pompe compresseur afin de changer rapidement la vielle qui lui fait perdre beaucoup de clients.

Il sollicite à cet effet un financement de $1000 pour acheter une nouvelle pompe compresseur lui permettant de gagner en clientèle et en temps.

loans.use: purchase of a new compressor pump (acheter une nouvelle pompe compresseur)

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Komi A. was born into an impoverished family in Tsevie in 1977. After a few years of schooling, he decided to become an apprentice cobbler and learn shoe repair. His apprenticeship completed, he has become one of the best cobblers in his area. His work is of excellent quality, but since he lacks the necessary materials he is not really able to satisfy his clientele. Earning very little from his work, he is having a hard time supporting his family, his wife having neither job skills nor money to open a small retail business.

In order to increase his earnings, he is asking for a loan of $950 which will permit him to restock his shoe business in such materials as leather, soles, buckles, and even to buy some machines to make his work easier. With the increased earnings, he hopes to be able to help his wife start up a small retail business and thus improve living conditions for the whole family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Monsieur A. Komi est né à Tsévié en 1977 dans une famille pauvre. Après quelques années d’études, il a décidé d’apprendre un métier. Devenu cordonnier, il fait de très bon travail et se positionne comme l’un des meilleurs cordonniers de la place. Ses produits sont de très bonnes qualités, mais faute de moyens, il n’arrive pas à satisfaire ses clients. Avec son revenu faible, il lui est difficile de faire face aux charges de la famille car son épouse n’a pas de métier, ni de moyens pour faire un quelconque commerce.

Pour renforcer son activité et son revenu, il sollicite un crédit de $ 950 qui va lui permettre de se ravitailler en matériel de travail tels que le cuir, semelle, boucles et même certaines machines pour faciliter le travail. Ainsi avec le revenu il pourra aider son épouse à faire de petit commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie de toute la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of material necessary for his work  (S'approvisionner en matériels de travail)

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en:
Born in 1974 in Tsevie (in the Zio Prefecture), Mr. A. Koffi is married and has three children. His wife is a waitress in a bar-restaurant but makes very little income to contribute to their household expenses. Mr. A. Koffi has been working as a carpenter for about the last ten years. His income isn’t enough though to meet his responsabilities. His customers have confidence and hold him in high regard because of the quality of his work. He is very good at what he does and is always honest in the repayment of his loans. In order to expand his activities, he is seeking a $950 loan to buy boards and logs. Some of the wood will be used to make furniture to sell. With this loan, he can enlarge his business which will allow him to invest more in the education and health of his family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1974 à Tsévié (P/Zio), Monsieur A. Koffi est marié et à trois (03) personnes à charge. Son épouse est serveuse dans un bar restaurant et gagne très peu pour pouvoir contribuer aux charges du ménage. Monsieur A. Koffi exerce comme activité, la menuiserie il y a environs 10 ans. Son revenu ne lui permet pas de couvrir toutes les charges. Il a la confiance et l’estime des clients à cause de la qualité de son travail. Il gère de façon correcte son activité et est toujours honnête dans le remboursement des crédits obtenus. En vue d’accroître ses activités, il sollicite un crédit de $950 pour faire le commerce des planches et de grumes. Une partie va servir à la réalisation des meubles destinés à la vente. Avec ce crédit, son chiffre d’affaire pourra augmenter et il pourra investir plus dans l’éducation et la santé de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of wood

loans.name: N'défa

texts.en:
Born in Lome (Golfe Prefecture) in 1985, Ms. A. N’Defa is single. She left her studies during high school to pursue training in clothing design. Because she didn’t have financing, her mother helped support her start in the fabric business. Dynamic and determined, she has gained a lot of experience and is very good at her business activities. She has already successfully managed two loans. She is an exemplary woman and worthy of trust. She currently is an active contributor to her parents’ and siblings’ expenses. She is seeking a $950 loan which will allow her to strengthen her fabric business. Carrying out this project will allow her to increase her income to improve her family’s standard of living, especially that of her brothers and sisters.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1985 à Lomé (P/Golfe), Mlle A. N’Défa est célibataire. Volontairement elle a abandonné les études en classe de 3ème pour se former en haute couture. N’ayant pas des moyens, sa maman l’a aidé en finançant au début son commerce de pagnes. Dynamique et déterminante, elle acquis une grande expérience qui lui a permis de maîtriser son activité commerciale. Elle a su bien gérer et rembourser les deux crédits obtenus. Elle est une femme exemplaire et digne de confiance. Actuellement, elle participe activement aux besoins de ses parents et de ses frères. Elle sollicite un crédit de $950 qui va servir à renforcer son commerce de pagnes. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus pour une amélioration des conditions d’existence de la famille surtout de ses frères et sœurs.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of traditional fabric

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.en:
Born April 26th, 1968 in Evou-Apegame (d’Amou Prefecture), Mr. E. Yaovi is married with eight people in his household, five of whom are his own children. After his training, he got a job as a laboratory technician at the Tsevie General Hospital. His salary is barely enough to cover his family expenses, which forces him to work as a moto-taxi driver sometimes. Working for a third party who is very exploitative, he has decided to buy his own motorcycle which will give him financial stability for the needs of his family. His wife’s restaurant brings in very little profit so she isn’t often able to help with the household spending. This energetic man is seeking a $1000 loan to buy a motorcycle so that he can work independently. This project will allow him to increase his income so that he can improve his family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 26 avril 1968 à Evou-Apégamé (P/d’Amou), Monsieur E. Yaovi est marié et a en charges huit (08) personnes dont ses cinq (05) enfants. Après sa formation, il est employé comme technicien de laboratoire à la Polyclinique de Tsévié. Son salaire suffit à peine à couvrir les dépenses de la famille ce qui l’a poussé à faire de temps en temps le taxi moto. Travaillant pour une tierce personne qui ne fait que l’exploiter, il décide d’acquérir sa propre moto qui lui permettra d’avoir une stabilité financière pour les besoins de la famille. La cafétéria de son épouse est peu rentable ce qui fait qu’elle ne l’aide pas souvent dans les dépenses du ménage. Dynamique, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter une moto et travailler en son propre compte. Ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour une amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: purchase of a motorcycle to drive as a moto-taxi

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en:
Mr. A. Koffi was born in 1980 in Tsevie (Zio Prefecture). He is married and the father of three children. After a short year of studying, he learned his current business, motor repair. His wife isn’t educated but runs a small grocery shop but her income isn’t enough to significantly contribute to the household spending. That’s why Mr. A. Koffi is responsible for all the expenses. In order to increase his income, he wants to expand his business to include making audio equipment to sell. He is seeking a $950 loan to buy speakers and other equipment. He would also like to buy equipment for a sound system to rent out to events. He will then be able to improve his family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Koffi est né en 1980 à Tsévié (P/Zio). Marié, il est père de trois (03) enfants. Après une coutre année d’étude, il a appris le rebobinage, métier qu’il exerce actuellement. Sa femme sans formation gère une boutique d’alimentation générale mais son revenu ne lui permet pas de contribuer aux dépenses du ménage. Ce qui fait que toutes les dépenses sont faites par Monsieur A. Koffi. Pour augmenter les revenus, il ne se contente pas seulement de reboniner, mais il fabrique des baffles pour la vente. Il sollicite un crédit de $950 pour l’achat de matériel de travail tels que les hauts parleurs et autres. En plus il souhaite acquérir des emplies et autres pour assurer la sonorisation lors des évènements. Il pourra ainsi contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of work equipment

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en:
Dorice is married and has 3 children who are going to school. She started her business in 2000 with funds from her husband. Since then, she received a loan which enabled her to expand her business. She is educated to level 7.

Given the funds, she wants to buy materials to stock her shop and sell both retail and wholesale.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Mawunya Akouwa

texts.en:
Mrs. E. Akouwa Mawunya was born in 1962 in Gape (Zio Prefecture). She almost finished high school but left her studies to work in trade. Her husband, whose professional career is almost over, doesn’t earn enough to meet the needs of their family. The couple is responsible for four people, two of whom are their own children. A good manager, she successfully managed and repaid her previous two loans. Energetic and enthusiastic, she really outdoes herself to help her husband with the household expenses. To strengthen her business, she is seeking a $950 loan for the sale of “sodabi” (a local palm wine drink), corn, and other goods. With this assistance she will be able to help her husband to improve the standard of living of their family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame E. Akouwa Mawunya est née en 1962 à Gapé (P/Zio). Elle a abandonné ses études en classe de 1ère et s’est lancée dans le commerce. Son mari, un enseignant pratiquement en fin de carrière professionnelle, ne gagne pas assez pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Le couple a en charge quatre (04) personnes dont deux (02) de leurs enfants. Bonne gestionnaire, elle a su bien gérer et rembourser les 2 précédents crédits. Dynamique, elle se surpasse pour aider son mari dans les dépenses de la maison. Pour renforcer son commerce, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 pour la vente de sodabi (une boisson locale extrait du palmier), du maïs et autres. Ainsi pourra-t-elle aider son époux dans l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: Drink sales

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Yawa A. is the second wife of her husband and the mother of five children. Her husband abandoned her over six years ago. Faced with this situation, she had to return to the home of her parents, with her children in tow, in order to pursue various business activities. She could then address the primary needs of her children and their schooling. With small loans that were repaid on time, she was able to get by as best she could.

She is presently requesting a loan of $600 to be repaid in 12 months. The loan will revitalize her business selling various items including snacks and finger food. Despite the difficult everyday realities she encounters, she has always demonstrated great promptness in her payments.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Deuxième femme de son mari et mère de cinq (05) enfants, Madame A. Yawa est abandonnée par son mari depuis plus de six ans. Face à cette situation, elle a du retourner chez ses parents avec ses enfants sous le bras pour entreprendre divers activités commerciales afin de faire face aux besoins primaires et à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Avec de petits financements bien remboursés, elle s’en est sortie tant bien que mal.

Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $600 remboursable en douze mois pour relancer son activité commerciale. Malgré les réalités quotidiennes difficiles qu’elle traverse, elle a toujours fait preuve d’une grande promptitude dans ses remboursements.

loans.use: Selling various items (snacks)

loans.name: Akouvi Happy Vinolia

texts.en:
Akouvi Vinolia S. was born in Lomé on March 15, 1972. She is married and is the guardian of her niece. Her husband, a pastor in a Protestant church, earns very little, which causes her to contribute more towards family expenses. As a seamstress by training, she opened a shop in the city of Tsévié since her husband was assigned there.

To have more income for meeting the needs of the family, she is requesting a loan of $950 to acquire a freezer. She can then sell ice cubes, juice, yoghurt, etc. And so, she will be able to help in some manner to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 15 mars 1972 à Lomé, Madame S. Akouvi Vinolia est mariée et a à sa charge sa nièce. Son mari, un Pasteur d’une église Protestante gagne très peu ce qui fait qu’elle investit plus dans les dépenses de la famille. Couturière de formation, elle a ouvert un atelier à Tsévié depuis l’affectation de son mari dans cette ville.

Afin d’avoir plus de revenus pour satisfaire les besoins de la famille, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 qui doit lui permettre d’acheter un congélateur pour commercialiser du glaçon, du jus, du yaourt etc. Ainsi, d’une certaine manière, pourra-t-elle contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de la famille.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for her shop to sell juice

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Massan D. is 38, married, and the mother of six. She is also responsible for three other persons. Her polygamous husband has a total of five wives with more than 19 children. All the children are left under the care of their mothers. Thus, each wife must struggle on a daily basis for the survival of their children. This struggle is what leads Ms. D., day in and day out, to sell groceries and basic necessities. To do this, she had gotten small loans that she furthermore repaid on time. She has a well-developed interest in entrepreneurship and has always demonstrated unfailing honesty in her loan payments. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to be repaid in 12 months. The loan will go towards consolidating her business and making it profitable. She can then improve the economic and social situation at home and for her children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 38 ans, madame D. Massan est marié et mère de six (06) enfants avec à sa charge trois (03) personnes. Son mari polygame a au total cinq (05) femmes avec plus de dix neuf (19) enfants. Tous les enfants sont laissés à la charge de leur maman. Il revient donc à chaque femme de mener une lutte quotidienne pour la survie de ses enfants. C’est cette lutte que mène madame D. Massan tous les jours à travers son commerce de vente de produits d’alimentation générale et de produits de première nécessité. Pour cela, elle avait reçu de petits financements bien remboursés d’ailleurs. Elle a un goût très poussé pour l’entreprenariat et a toujours fait preuve d’une honnêteté sans faille dans ses remboursements. Elle sollicite un financement $1200 qu’elle compte rembourser en douze mois pour consolider et rentabiliser son commerce afin d’améliorer la situation économique et sociale de sa famille et celle de ses enfants

loans.use: Commerce in grocery items

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga D. was born in Aného in 1970. She is married and the mother of four. Aside from her children, she also is responsible for two sisters in apprenticeships.
