The income from her business did not allow her to cover all household and family expenses. So to make ends meet, she traded a little in various items. Since setting up her hair salon, she has been refining her art of hairdressing, something that draws in the customers. Today, her 15 years of experience in this business has earned her the title of greatest hairdresser in her neighborhood.

Ms. D. is requesting a loan of $800 to acquire hair dryers and to better meet the needs of her customers. Then she will be able to win their loyalty, to gain other customers, and thus augment her bottom line. And that all adds up to financial independence for her.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1970 à Aného, Madame D. Olga est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Outre ces derniers, elle a à sa charge deux (02) sœurs en apprentissage. Les revenus de son activité ne lui permettent pas d’assumer toutes les dépenses du foyer. Pour joindre alors les deux bouts, il fait de petits commerces de divers. Depuis l’installation de son salon, elle développe un art de faire ses coiffures, qui attire sa clientèle. Aujourd’hui, elle possède une expérience de 15 ans d’activités qui lui confèrent le titre de la plus grande coiffeuse de son quartier.

Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour acheter des séchoirs et satisfaire plus les besoins de sa clientèle. Ainsi, elle pourra fidéliser sa clientèle, en gagner d’autres qui feront augmenter son chiffre d’affaires synonyme d’autonomie financière de Madame D..

loans.use: To buy hair dryers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Born in 1968 at Anfoin in the Lakes Prefecture, Rose G. is married and responsible for 12 children. Having had the good fortune to inherit her mother's business, she adores baking bread. With experience in this trade that dates back to her childhood, Rose remains the principle baker for her area. She has over eight salespeople working for her. The lack of a mill to grind wheat is a serious handicap for her, in spite of having plenty of demand for her bread.

She is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase and install a wheat-grinding mill which will make her work easier and allow her to increase production. This in turn will lead to increased profits and improve living conditions for the whole family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Née en 1968 à Anfoin dans la préfecture des Lacs, Madame Rose G. est mariée et compte un total de douze (12) enfants à sa charge. Héritière bien heureuse de l’activité de sa mère, elle a fait de la production du pain, son métier adoré. Dotée d’une expérience de sa vie depuis l’enfance, Madame Rose G. demeure la principale boulangère du pain dans toute sa localité. Elle possède plus de huit vendeurs sur sa cour. Mais le manque de moulin à blé constitue un handicap sérieux à son activité malgré les nombreuses demandes sur le marché.

Aujourd’hui, le besoin se faisant sentir, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter et installer un moulin à blé afin d’alléger ses peines et produire plus. La satisfaction de ce besoin amènera Madame Rose à augmenter sa production et ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and installation of a wheat grinding mill (Achat et installation d'un moulin à blé)

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin Y. was born in 1971 in Aklakou, where he currently resides. He is disabled and is an electronics repairman by profession. He is well-known by all in this profession. His wife is a saleswoman, and together they have three children. Lacking the money, he has been working out of his house since 1995. After 12 years already, his work experience is such that he succeeds where others have failed. But family and household expenses, as well as his own needs, leave him without a penny for his efforts.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to open a shop. Then he can do commerce in sound equipment (electronics) that he will acquire at good prices from young people in his town. The income from this business will allow Mr. Y. to meet the basic need of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1971 à Aklakou où il réside actuellement, Monsieur Martin Y. est handicapé et est électronicien réparateur de profession. Cette activité fait de lui un homme bien connu de tous. Marié à une revendeuse avec qui il a trois (03) enfants, Monsieur Martin YEMEH, faute de moyens travaille à la maison depuis 1995. Déjà 12 ans d’activité, il possède une expérience qui lui fait réussir là où les autres ont échoué. Mais les charges du foyer et ses propres besoins ne lui permettent pas de tirer son épingle du jeu.

Aujourd’hui, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour ouvrir un atelier, acheter et revendre des appareils de sonorisation bien achetés par les jeunes de sa localité. Les revenus de cette activité permettront à Monsieur Martin YEMEH et satisfaire les besoins les élémentaires de sa famille.

loans.use: To open a shop and buy electronics to sell

loans.name: Hélène

texts.en:
Hélène S. was born in Aklakou in 1958. She has three children and is unmarried since her husband abandoned her. What generates income for her is commerce in generic pharmaceuticals. With the help of micro-loans, she has gained 20 years of work experience in her field and has mastered all of the ins and outs of the business. The micro-loans have furthermore helped to keep her children in school.

Ms. S. is presently requesting a loan of $950 to enlarge her display of goods in order to meet the level of demand of her customers. The realization of her project will help her to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame S. Hélène est née en 1958 à Aklakou. Célibataire avec trois (03) enfants, son mari l’ayant abandonné, elle exerce une activité génératrice de revenus : le commerce des produits génériques. Elle possède une expérience en la matière puisque ayant maîtrisé tous les rouages de cette activité qu’elle fait depuis 20 ans à partir de micro crédit. C’est d’ailleurs grâce à ses bénéfices qu’elle s’occupe de ses enfants en scolarité.

Elle sollicite à présent un crédit de $950 pour agrandir son étalage afin d’être à la hauteur de la demande de sa clientèle. La réalisation de ce projet aidera Madame S. Hélène à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To enlarge her display of goods for sale

loans.name: Essi Sanno

texts.en:
Essi Sanno A. was born in Lomé on August 1, 1976. She is single with no children, and she has not had the opportunity to finish her secondary education. Neither did she learn a trade, so she had to go live with her aunt, who is a merchant with a boutique where Essi worked. That is where she developed an interest in the business of building and construction materials. She decided on her own to start her own business. But with her very limited financial means, this has not been easy at all. So she got an initial loan to get things started. This very energetic young woman now manages her own shop with a discipline worthy of a highly experience business woman.

Having an ever-increasing and demanding customer base, she is requesting a new loan of $1,200. This new financing will allow her to establish a stock of hardware in order to meet the expectations of her customers on a timely basis. Given her experience in this field of endeavor, this young woman deserves financial support, which will make her business even more worthwhile.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mademoiselle Essi Sanno A. est née le 1er août 1976 à Lomé. Célibataire sans enfant, elle n’a pas eu la chance de terminer ses études secondaires. N’ayant également appris aucun métier, elle a dû se réfugier auprès de sa tante commerçante pour l’aider dans sa boutique. C’est là où elle prit goût du commerce de matériaux de construction et décida elle-même de monter son propre affaire. Cela n’a pas été du tout facile compte tenu de ses moyens financiers très limités. Elle a donc sollicité un premier crédit pour démarrer. Cette jeune femme très dynamique gère aujourd’hui sa propre boutique avec une rigueur digne d’une femme d’entreprise très expérimentée.

La clientèle devenant de plus en plus nombreuse et exigeante, elle sollicite encore un nouveau crédit de $1200. Ce nouveau financement va lui permettre de constituer un stock en matériaux de quincaillerie en vue de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle à temps. Avec l’expérience qu’elle acquis dans ce domaine, cette jeune femme mérite d’être soutenue financièrement afin de lui permettre de rentabiliser au mieux son activité.

loans.use: Selling hardware goods

loans.name: Kanlé

texts.en:
Kanlé T. was born in Aného in 1972. She is married and the mother of four. Making caramel sauce, locally called «LIHA», is now her main work. A very devoted woman, she is now the head of household. From her business, she derives an income that provides for her family, who depends on her entirely. She gets up very early in the morning to make a fire, toasts the sugar, and produces the sauce that she sells a lot of, especially when the weather is hot. And this has earned her the nickname of «AFRICA MALTA». The orders for her caramel sauce now surpass what she can offer, and she does not have the financial resources needed to meet the demand.

Ms. T. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy sacks of sugar and a freezer for making ice cubes. The loan will thus help to increase her production capacity. The income gained will allow her to improve the living conditions of her family and to acquire a degree of financial independence.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née à Aného en 1972, Madame T. Kanlé est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. La production du jus de caramel communément appelé « LIHA », reste son activité principale. De cette activité, sort un bénéfice avec lequel Madame T. Kanlé subvient aux besoins de sa famille qui est à sa seule charge. Très dévouée, elle reste le chef de la famille. Elle se réveille très tôt pour faire le feu, griller le sucre et produit son jus qu’elle vend bien surtout en période de chaleur. Cela lui donna le surnom de « AFRICA MALTA ». Les demandes dépassent désormais l’offre et elle n’est pas en mesure de les couvrir faute de moyens.

Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter des sacs de sucre, un congélateur pour faire du glaçon et augmenter sa capacité de production. Les revenus une fois accrus, permettront à Madame T. Kanlé d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et d’acquérir une autonomie financière.

loans.use: To buy sugar and a freezer for making ice cubes

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine E. was born in Aného on September 20, 1963. She is married, has a child, and is also responsible for another person. She is a charcoal merchant, and her husband is a part-time mason. They both provide for the needs of the family. Although illiterate, she is energetic, and she has the ability to manager a loan and to repay it in a regular manner.

And so she is requesting a loan of $800 to build an inventory of charcoal from areas that produce it. Through buying wholesale, she can then make a better profit. She also needs to lease a store to stock the charcoal. The loan will be repaid in 12 months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 20 septembre 1963 à Aného, Madame E. Catherine est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a à sa charge une personne. Commerçante de charbon et son mari un maçon à temps partielle, ils subviennent tous deux aux besoins de la famille. Analphabète mais dynamique, elle à la capacité de gérer un crédit et de le rembourser normalement.

Ainsi donc, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour pouvoir s’approvisionner en gros en charbon de bois depuis les zones de production afin de réaliser un meilleur bénéfice. Elle a aussi besoin de louer un magasin pour stocker les charbons. Ce crédit sera remboursé en 12 mois.

loans.use: To do commerce in charcoal

loans.name: Ayaba Lonlonyon

texts.en:
Ayaba Lonlonyon S. was born in Agbétiko, Togo, on August 27, 1955. She is married and the mother of four. After finishing secondary school, she decided to do business selling beauty products. At first, she went door-to-door. She eventually opened up her own store that she now manages with discipline and dedication. But lacking the money, she is always short of stock, which compels some of her customers to resort to her competitors.

To alleviate her financial situation, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 as capital for a large enough inventory of the goods demanded by her customers. Her sales figures and her socio-economic conditions will certainly improve.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 27 Août 1955 à Agbétiko au Togo, Madame S. Ayaba Lonlonyon, est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Après ses études secondaires, elle décida de mener les activités commerciales dans le domaine de la vente de produits de beauté. Au départ ambulante, elle finit par ouvrir un magasin qu’elle gère actuellement avec rigueur et dévouement. Mais faute de moyen, elle est toujours en rupture de stock obligeant certaines de ses clientes à se tourner vers ses concurrentes.

C’est pour palier à ce manque de moyens financiers qu’elle sollicite un financement de $1000. Ce financement servira à s’approvisionner suffisamment en articles demandés par sa clientèle. Son chiffre d’affaires et ses conditions socio économiques s’amélioreront certainement

loans.use: Selling beauty products

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Anfoin, where he learned his craft, Mr. Kodjo M. currently lives in Aklakou with his wife and two (02) children. There, he opened a mechanic shop which he has been running for more than 10 years. A courageous and hard-working man blessed with a strong sense of morality, his strength has made him a mechanic loved by all, and one many clients go to. Mr. Kodjo, despite his bravery, is unable to meet the needs of his family, who are mired in absolute misery.

Today, he is asking for a loan of $1000 to open a place next to his mechanic shop to sell spare parts for bicycles, in order to more efficiently satisfy the demands of his clientele on the spot. The realization of this dream will lead Mr. Kodjo M. to a better life with his family, thanks to the income obtained from this business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1980 à Anfoin, où il a appris son métier, Monsieur Kodjo M. réside actuellement à Aklakou avec sa femme et ses deux (02) enfants. Là, il a ouvert son atelier de mécanique qu’il exerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Homme vaillant, travailleur, doté d’une bonne moralité, sa force fait de lui un mécanicien aimé de tous et vers qui se dirige tout client. Monsieur Kodjo malgré sa bravoure est incapable de subvenir aux besoins de famille qui végète dans la misère absolue.

Aujourd’hui, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour ouvrir à côté de son atelier de mécanique un point de vente de pièces de rechange des motos afin de satisfaire surplace et plus vite la demande de sa clientèle. La réalisation de ce rêve amènera Monsieur Kodjo M. à une vie meilleure dans sa famille grâce aux revenus dégagés de ses activités.

loans.use: To open a store selling spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Démého

texts.en:
Mrs. Démého A. was born in 1944 in Aklakou in the prefecture of Lacs. A married mother of two (02) children, she has a business activity which generates income : the sale of "bouillie" (an African cereal-based breakfast). Along with a primary education, she now has 15 years of experience in this business. Her husband, a joiner who lost his ability to work, has left her to deal the many household expenses. However, Mrs. A. is not discouraged. Every morning, she gets up very early to prepare her bouillie, which she sells near the road. She has already benefited from a first loan well paid off.

Today, she is asking for $950 in financial support to buy bags of maize, sugar, and wood to satisfy the demands of her clientele. The satisfaction of this need will help her improve her family's living conditions and her savings.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Démého est née en 1944 à Aklakou dans la préfecture des Lacs. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle a une activité génératrice de revenus : la vente de la bouillie. Instruite de niveau primaire, elle possède aujourd’hui une expérience de 15 ans dans cette activité. Son mari menuisier, ayant perdu sa force de travail, la laisse seule devant les nombreuses charges du ménage. Pourtant, Madame A. ne se décourage pas. Le matin, elle se réveille très tôt pour préparer sa bouillie qu’elle vend aux abords des routes. Elle a bénéficié déjà d’un premier crédit bien soldé.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite appui financier de $950 pour acheter des sacs de maïs, des sacs de sucre et du bois pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. La satisfaction de ce besoin l’aidera à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille de même que son épargne.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, sugar, and wood, in order to prepare her "bouillie" (an African breakfast)

loans.name: Milé San

texts.en:
Father of three (03) children and with two brothers in his care, Mr. Milé San K. was born in 1951 in Aného in Lacs in Southwest Togo. After his secondary studies, he started at a public works company. Unfortunately, he lost his job following the bankruptcy of the company. Finding himself unemployed with no financial means, he opened, with a loan of $800, a small store selling various general food products.

He managed this first loan without incident, and is now asking for a new loan of $1200 to build up a sizeable stock of merchandise.

He is a man who is very rigorous in the management of his store. Thus, this loan will come to strengthen his management capability, increase his sales, and contribute to the improvement of his very precarious economic situation.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Père de trois (03) enfants avec deux frères à charge, Monsieur K. Milé San est né en 1951 à Aného dans les Lacs au sud-est du Togo. Après ses études secondaires, il est engagé dans une entreprise de travaux publics. Malheureusement, il a perdu son emploi à la suite de la faillite de l’entreprise. Se retrouvant au chômage sans aucun moyen financier, il se lança avec un financement de $800 dans le commerce par l’ouverture d’une petite boutique d’alimentation générale et de divers.

Ce premier financement, il l’a géré sans incident et sollicite encore un nouveau financement de $1200 pour constituer un stock important de marchandises.

C’est un monsieur qui est très rigoureux dans la gestion de sa boutique. Aussi ce financement viendra renforcer sa capacité de gestion, augmentera son chiffre d’affaires et contribuera à l’amélioration de sa situation économique très précaire.

loans.use: To buy and sell general food products

loans.name: Davi

texts.en:
Born in 1952 in Aklakou, where she currently lives, Mrs. Davi F. is widowed with three (03) children. Having become the head of her household by circumstance, she meets with difficulty her many needs using the profits from the sale of condiments and canned goods. She has been in this business since her youth. Today, Mrs. Davi F. has much experience in the sale of condiments. She has benefited twice in succession from loans which she repaid without incident.

Today, she is asking for a loan of $650 to buy baskets of condiments and cartons of canned goods to stay on top of the demands of her clientele. From this business will follow the profits which will allow her to be the mother of a happy family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1952 à Aklakou où elle vit actuellement, Madame F. Davi est veuve avec trois (03) enfants. Devenue chef de famille par la force des choses, elle subvient difficilement aux nombreux besoins à partir des bénéfices tirés de la vente des condiments et des boîtes de conserve. Ce commerce, elle le fait depuis son jeune âge. Aujourd’hui, Madame Davi F. possède une grande expérience dans la vente des condiments. Elle a bénéficié deux fois de suite, des crédits qu’elle a bien soldés.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour acheter des paniers de condiments et des cartons de boites de conserve afin d’être à la hauteur de la demande de sa clientèle. De cette activité, découleront des bénéfices qui lui permettront d’être la mère d’une famille heureuse.

loans.use: To buy baskets of condiments and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.en:
Born in 1984 in Anfoin in Lacs, Mrs. Afiwa M. has one (01) child. She abandoned her studies in primary school due to a lack of means. Very intelligent and entrepreneurial, she began her business activities by selling eggs to meet the needs of her family, her husband being an unemployed accountant.

To perfect her business, she is asking for a loan of $600 to stock and sell fresh eggs, in order to realize maximum profit so as to better meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1984 à Anfoin dans les Lacs, Mme M. Afiwa est mère d’un enfant. Elle a abandonné les études au cours primaire par manque de moyens. Très intélligeante et entreprenante, elle commence ses activités commerciales par la vente des œufs pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, son mari étant un comptable en chômage. Pour parfaire son commerce, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour le stockage et la vente des œufs frais afin de réaliser un profit maximum pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell fresh eggs

loans.name: Sessou

texts.en:
Sessou A. was born in 1957 in Anfoin. Widowed mother of four children, she is presently living in Aklakou where she has been in business for some twenty years. The sale of balls of cornmeal porridge is greatly appreciated by the people of her town. For that reason, they call her Mama Akumeto. She has plenty of experience in her work, but she became a widow at a young age and is solely responsible for her family.

She is asking for a loan of $950 so that she can maintain a constant stock of corn and be able to satisfy the demands of her clientele. This will allow her to increase her savings and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Madame A. Sessou est née en 1957 a Anfoin. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle vit actuellement à Aklakou où elle fait ses activités depuis une vingtaine d’années. La vente des boules de pâte est appréciée par la population locale. C’est pour cela que Madame A. Sessou porte le nom de maman « AKUMETO ». Elle possède assez d’expériences en la matière et cernent tous les rouages de son activité. Très tôt, elle est devenue veuve et tout le poids de la famille repose sur elle seule.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite ce crédit de $950 pour faire un stockage consistant de maïs afin de pouvoir satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Ainsi, pourra t-elle augmenter sa capacité d’épargne et améliorer les conditions de vie de toute sa famille.

loans.use: purchase and warehousing of corn  (Achat et stockage de maïs)

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Born in 1961 in Kpalimé, Mrs. Anne T. is married and has two (02) children. Having neither had the chance to go to school nor to learn a profession, she quickly initiated herself in the charcoal business through her uncle's wife. As soon as she was married, she took up this business, which is very profitable for her and has helped her greatly in meeting the needs of her family, since her husband is unemployed and unable to deal with these responsibilities.

She has received two loans of $150 which she paid off without difficulty.

She is asking now for a loan of $800 which will allow her to stock charcoal in times of abundance and re-sell it at a slightly higher price when it is needed.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1961 à Kpalimé, Madame T. Anne est mariée et est mère de deux enfants. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et n’ayant appris aucun métier, elle s’est vite initier au commerce du charbon de bois par la femme de son oncle. Aussitôt mariée, elle s’est lancée dans ce commerce qui lui est très rentable et qui l’a beaucoup aidé à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, car elle a un mari sans emploi et incapable de faire face à ses responsabilités.

Elle a reçu deux crédits de $150 qu’elle avait bien remboursés et sans difficulté.

Elle sollicite encore un financement de $800 qui lui permettra de stocker du charbon de bois au temps d’abondance et de les revendre un peu plus cher en temps de soudure.

loans.use: To buy, stock, and re-sell charcoal

loans.name: Assouhawou

texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Tchamba, Mrs. Assouhawouè T. is married and has one (01) child. Having abandoned her studies in primary school, she took up business. With a husband in retirement, she meets the needs of her family by herself, because it is difficult for her husband to collect his pension.

To give her business a second wind, she is asking for a loan of $800 to increase her capital and and to achieve higher profits. This loan will help her rent a store to stock her merchandise, mainly comprising plastic utensils which she will buy at the factories and sell at wholesale and at retail in her shop.

This will contribute to the blossoming of her family and the profitability of her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1965 à Tchamba, Madame T. Assouhawouè est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Ayant abandonné ses études au cours primaire, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce. Avec un mari retraité, elle subvient seule aux besoins de la famille, car c’est difficilement que son mari perçoit sa pension de retraite.

Pour redonner un autre souffle à son commerce, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et réaliser un profit un peu plus élevé. Ce fond l’aidera à louer un magasin pour stocker ses marchandises essentiellement composées d’ustensiles en plastiques qu’elle ira acheter dans les usines de production et qu’elle revendra en gros et en détails dans son magasin.

Cela contribuera à l’épanouissement de la famille et à la rentabilité de son commerce.

loans.use: To buy and sell kitchen utensils

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.en:
Born in 1979 in Aklakou where he presently resides, Yaovi S. is a young barber, married and the father of four children. After secondary school, he began as an apprentice barber and did brilliantly. In the 15 years since he opened his own barbershop, he has never disappointed his clientele. This amount of experience raises him above other barbers in his area. Having lost their parents at a young age, his brothers and sisters also live off of the revenue of his business, which is meager due to his lacking the means to purchase adequate supplies for his work.

He is now asking for a loan (his first one) of $1000 to permit him to move his shop to a better area and modernize his business by buying a new stock of barbering supplies such as electric clippers, etc. This will allow him to satisfy a maximum of clientele and increase his profits in order to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: Re-opening of a barbershop and purchase of new stock

loans.name: Immiélé Afiavi

texts.en:
Mrs. Immiélé Afiavi A. was born in 1946 in Aného. She is a retired public servant, married with three (03) children. After her retirement, she started a small business and opened a store selling basic need goods in Nukafu. She had the misfortunte of losing her husband, which forced her to face the household expenses by herself. She managed only because of her business, since her pension was not paid regularly.

Thus, to expand her business, she is asking for a loan of $600, which she will use to buy basic need goods (soap, detergent, milk, food, and canned goods...).

She is a very experienced woman and a very good manager who deserves to be supported.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Immiélé Afiavi A. est née en 1946 à Aného. Elle est une retraitée de la fonction publique, mariée et mère de trois enfants. Après sa retraite, elle entreprit un petit commerce et ouvrit une boutique de vente de produits de première nécessité à Nukafu. Elle eut le malheur de perdre son mari l’obligeant à faire face seule aux charges familiale. Elle n’eut son salut qu’à son commerce, les pensions n’étant pas payées régulièrement.

Ainsi pour accroître son activité commerciale, elle sollicite un financement de $600 qu’elle compte utiliser pour l’achat des marchandises de premières nécessités (savon, détergent, lait, les aliments en boîtes de conserve…).

C’est une femme très expérimentée et une très bonne gestionnaire qui a besoin d’être appuyée.

loans.use: To sell basic need goods

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Born in 1961 in Aklakou, Mr. Abraham H. is married and has nine (09) children, some of whom are students while others are apprentices. A tailor by profession, he set up his shop in the aforementioned village and works with what he has on hand. Having only two machines, he is unable to train his six (06) apprentices. In addition, the new models require an embroidery machine; this will limit the expenses incurred by his travelling to Aného to have the embroidery done.

To achieve this, he is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy sewing and embroidering machines. This loan will allow him to satisfy all of his clients, thereby increasing his income and meeting the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1961 à Aklakou, Monsieur H. Abraham est marié et père de neuf (09) enfants dont certains sont des élèves alors que d’autres sont apprentis. Tailleurs de profession, il a installé son atelier dans ledit village et travaille avec les moyens de bord. Avec six (06) apprentis, les deux machines dont il dispose ne lui permettent pas d’encadrer ces derniers. En plus, les nouveaux modèles exigent de lui une machine à broder pour limiter ses dépenses dues aux déplacements d’Aného pour faire les broderies.

Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour l’achat des machines à coudre et à broder. Ce crédit lui permettra de satisfaire tous ses clients afin d’augmenter ses revenus et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy sewing and embroidering machines

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Lomé, Mrs. Monique A. is married with one (01) child and two (02) brothers in her care. Having become a seller of general food and other products after her primary education, she has dealt with the needs of her family by herself for more than 13 years, her husband being unemployed.

With an entrepreneurial spirit and tremendous experience, she is asking for a credit of $600 to build up a sizeable stock of merchandise and to open a telephone booth in her store, given that there is no means of communication in the area. This loan will allow Mrs. Monique A. to raise the level of her business and her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1975 à Lomé, Madame A. Monique est mariée et mère d’un enfant avec deux (02) frères à charge. Devenue commerçante d’alimentation générale et des divers après les études primaires, elle a fait face seule aux besoins de la famille depuis plus de treize (13) ans, son mari étant un chômeur.

Ayant un esprit d’entreprenariat et une très grande expérience, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour constituer un stock de marchandises très important et ouvrir une cabine téléphonique dans sa boutique, étant donné qu’il n’y a aucun moyen de communication dans leur secteur. Ce crédit permettra à Mme A. Monique de relever le niveau de son activité et la qualité de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell general food products

loans.name: Kokou

texts.en:
Mr. Kokou S. was born in 1948 in Aklakou in the Lacs Prefecture. Married and the father of nine children, he is a retired teacher. His pension being too meager and irregular for the needs of his family, he took the initiative when he was still working to install a mill, which permits him to pay for family expenses. He hired a miller who he paid at the end of every month. Now retired, he works the mill himself. Honest and a good manager, he has easily reimbursed his previous credits.

Today, his clients being more and more numerous, he wishes to install another mill in the neighboring area that will bring him much more income for the good of his family. For this purpose, he is asking for a loan of $1200.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Kokou est né en 1948 à Aklakou dans la préfecture des Lacs. Marié et père de neuf (09) enfants, il est enseignant à la retraite. Sa pension étant très maigre et irrégulière pour tous les besoins de la famille, il prit l’initiative depuis qu’il est encore en fonction d’installer un moulin qui lui permet de subvenir aux dépenses familiales. C’est ainsi qu’il prit un meunier qu’il paie à chaque fin du mois. Maintenant à la retraite, il s’en occupe lui-même. Honnête et bon gestionnaire, il a su rembourser facilement les précédents crédits.

Aujourd’hui, ses clients étant de plus en plus nombreux, il souhaite installer un autre moulin dans le quartier voisin qui lui procurera beaucoup plus de revenu pour le bien de la famille. A cet effet, il sollicite un crédit de $1200.

loans.use: Purchase of another mill

loans.name: Tanti Kossiwa

texts.en:
Tanti Kossiwa A. is a woman with a low level of education, born on July 12, 1961 in Kétao. Married and mother of three children, she took control of her destiny very early on by taking on various jobs and then working in the restaurant business. It’s in this last activity that she excels and today has her own restaurant in Hédjranawoé, a popular neighborhood in Lomé.

After receiving two loans of $300 then $500, she has managed to gain a large clientele, which is becoming more and more demanding. It is for this reason that she is asking for a new loan of $1200 that will serve to refurbish her bar and to build a large stock of corn and rice, the primary goods used in the preparation of her dishes that are much enjoyed by her clients.

In the past this woman has proved her dynamism and above all her ability in loan management. She fully merits being financed again, which will permit her to increase her sales and improve her economic and social conditions.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Tanti Kossiwa A. est une femme d’un niveau de scolarisation très faible, née le 12 juillet 1961 à Kétao. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle a très tôt pris en main son destin en s’adonnant au commerce de divers puis à la restauration. C’est dans cette dernière activité qu’elle excelle et tient aujourd’hui elle-même son restaurant à Hédjranawoé, un quartier populaire de Lomé.

Après deux crédits de $300 puis $500 reçus, elle est arrivée à gagner une clientèle très importante qui se fait de plus en plus exigeante. C’est pourquoi, elle sollicite un nouveau financement de $1200 qui servira au réaménagement de son bar et à la constitution d’un stock importante de maïs et de riz, les produits de base entrant dans la préparation de ses mets très appréciés par ses clients.

Cette femme a fait preuve dans le passé de son dynamisme et surtout de sa capacité de gestion du crédit. Elle mérite pleinement d’être encore financé pour lui permettre d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et d’améliorer ses conditions économiques et sociales.

loans.use: To refurbish her restaurant and build a stock of primary goods for her meals

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Aklakou Fondomé in the Lacs Prefecture, Michel G., mechanic, is married and the father of four children. His wife being unemployed, he finds himself alone paying all of the bills. Michel G., experienced and popular, is solicited by a growing clientele.

He is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy an electric air pump so that his business can be more competitive in the area. The realization of this project will help his entire family to flourish.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1972 à Aklakou Fonkomé dans la préfecture des Lacs, Monsieur G. Michel, mécanicien de profession, est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Sa femme sans activité, l’oblige à se trouver seul devant toutes les charges. Monsieur G. Michel, vulgarisateur très expérimenté, est sollicité par une clientèle de plus en plus grande.

Aussi sollicite- il un crédit de $1000 pour acheter une machine de pompage d’air électrique afin d’être plus compétitif dans la localité. La réalisation de ce projet amènera toute sa famille à un épanouissement total.

loans.use: Purchase of an electric air pump

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Akossiwa A. is a widow with three children and cares for one brother. Born in 1955 in Tsévié in Zio, she did not get the chance to go to school. She married very young and helped her husband in his work distilling alcohol. Unfortunately her husband died very early leaving her with three children on her hands.

Faced with this situation, she was forced to open a small business to pay family expenses and for her children’s schooling. For this she received a small loan of $200 that she managed well and now hopes to build her coal business by selling wholesale at the market in Atsanvé in Agoè-Nyivé in the northern suburb of Lomé. She is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy wholesale sacks of charcoal.

This courageous, dynamic and enterprising woman needs backing. In the past she has proved her ability to manage a loan and has made her business profitable.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Akossiwa A. est une veuve de trois enfants avec un frère à charge. Née en 1955 à Tsévié dans le Zio, elle n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. Elle se maria très jeune et aidait son mari dans ses activités de distillation d’alcool. Malheureusement son mari décéda très tôt laissant sur son bras leurs trois enfants.

Face à cette situation, elle était obligée de faire de petit commerce pour supporter les charges familiales et la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle reçut pour cela un petit crédit de $200 qu’elle a bien géré et compte actuellement agrandir son commerce de charbon par la vente en gros dans le marché d’Atsanvé à Agoè-Nyivé dans la banlieue nord de lomé. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour l’achat en gros des sacs de charbon de bois.

Cette femme très courageuse, dynamique et entreprenante nécessite d’être soutenue. Elle a fait preuve dans le passé de sa capacité à gérer un financement et à rentabiliser son activité commerciale.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase and resale of sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Dévémé where she currently lives, Mrs. Tchotcho M. is married and the mother of six children. In addition to a little food cultivation, she farms poultry. In the 20 years since she started this work, she has had trouble providing for her family’s needs. She now has much experience that helps her to raise hens that are good for egg production. It is for this purpose that she is asking for a loan of $1200 with which she will build a fence, troughs and a feed mill.

The execution of this project will help Mrs. M. improve her whole family’s quality of life and increase her savings.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1966 à Dévémé où elle réside actuellement, Madame M. Tchotcho est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Outre sa petite agriculture, elle fait l’élevage des volailles. Depuis 20 ans qu’elle est dans cette activité, elle arrive difficilement à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Aujourd’hui, elle possède une grande expérience qui la rassure à élever les pondeuses en vue de la production des œufs. C’est d’ailleurs pour cela qu’elle sollicite ce crédit de $1200 avec lequel elle fera la clôture, les abreuvoirs, la provenderie.

La réalisation de ce projet conduira Madame M. à une amélioration des conditions de vie de toute sa famille et l’augmentation du niveau de son épargne.

loans.use: Construction of a fence, troughs and a feed mill.

loans.name: Alowoè

texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Zoti in the VO Prefecture, Alowoè A. is single with one child and takes care of one other person. She got pregnant very young by a cobbler who refused the pregnancy. Abandoned and on her own, she quickly threw herself into the fruit business in the outdoor marketplace in order to support the pregnancy, which she accomplished without difficulty until now. Illiterate but dynamic, she now hopes to improve her business by asking for a loan of $600 in order to set up a display to sell staple goods as well as fruits.

This very courageous woman deserves financial backing so that she can improve her quality of life and provide her children with a good education.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1977 à Zoti dans la préfecture de VO, Madame A. Alowoè est célibataire avec un enfant et a une personne à charge. Très tôt elle tomba enceinte d’un coordonier qui refusa la grossesse. Abandonnée à elle-même, elle s’est vite lancée dans le commerce de fruits au grand marché afin de supporter la grossesse, ce qu’elle réussit bien, non sans difficultés, jusqu’à ce jour. Analphabète mais dynamique, elle désire aujourd’hui améliorer son commerce par la demande d’un crédit de $600 afin d’aménager un étalage pour coupler à la vente de fruits le commerce de produits alimentaires de première nécessité.

Cette femme très courageuse mérite d’être soutenue financièrement afin de lui permettre de relever son niveau de vie et d’assurer une bonne éducation à ses enfants.

loans.use: To set up a display to sell fruit and staple goods.

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Aklakou where she still lives, Pélagie G. is a married woman and mother of five children. Her husband, a mason, does not have enough income to meet the household expenses. Pélagie quickly understood this and thus threw herself into the sale of staple goods such as sugar, milk, generic medications etc. She now has 15 years of experience in this business and has never gone bankrupt.

Her goal now is to expand her display in order to meet demand. For this reason she is asking for a loan of $950 to place a large order. The realization of this project will help Pélagie G. improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1969 à Aklakou où elle vit jusqu’alors, Madame Pélagie G. est une femme mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Son mari, maçon de profession ne dispose pas beaucoup de revenus pour supporter les charges du ménage. Madame Pélagie l’a vite compris s’est alors lancée dans le commerce des produits de première nécessité tels que le sucre, le lait, les médicaments générique etc. Elle est dotée aujourd’hui d’une expérience de 15 ans dans cette activité. et n’a jamais fait faillite.

Son ambition est d’agrandir son étalage aujourd’hui pour être à la hauteur de la demande. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite ce crédit de $950 pour passer une grande commande. La réalisation de ce projet permettra à Madame G. Pélagie d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock up on merchandise

loans.name: Amélévi

texts.en:
Amélévi K. was born in 1965 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of four children and takes care of her brother. Unable to continue secondary school, she started her business selling water (Pure Water). With a husband who does not have a stable job, she has trouble meeting her family’s needs on her own. It is through her business selling water that she arduously tries to meet those needs.

In order to improve her business, meaning to sell water or Pure Water wholesale and retail and to rent a store and increase her profits, she is asking for a loan of $600. Once she has realized her dream, her quality of life will have improved.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Amélévi est née en 1965 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants avec un autre frère à charge. N’ayant pas la chance de continuer les études secondaires, elle a commencé son commerce par la vente de l’eau (pure water). Avec un mari qui n’a pas un emploi aussi stable, elle arrive difficilement seule à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. C’est par son commerce de vente d’eau qu’elle s’investit péniblement dans cette tâche.

Pour améliorer son commerce c'est-à-dire la vente en gros et en détails d’eau ou pure water, louer un magasin et accroître ses bénéfices, elle sollicite un crédit de $600. Une fois ce rêve réalisé, ses conditions de vie seront améliorées.

loans.use: Wholesale and retail sale of mineral water (Pure Water)

loans.name: Sossi

texts.en:
Born in 1932 in Aklakou Xétsavi in the Lacs Prefecture, Sossi S. is a widow with six children. Since her husband’s death, her small business is the only income with which she meets the needs of the children still in her care. The sale of condiments is her mother’s business that she inherited. At the local market she is still the most experimented retailer.

She now asks for a loan of $650 to improve her sale capacity and to fully meet the needs of her clientele. This loan and the accomplishment of this project will help Sossi S. improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1932 à Aklakou Xétsavi dans la préfecture des Lacs, Madame S. Sossi est veuve avec six (06) enfants. Depuis la mort de son mari jusqu’alors, son petit commerce est le seul revenu avec lequel elle satisfait les besoins de ses enfants toujours à sa charge. La vente des condiments est le commerce de sa mère de qui elle a hérité. Sur la place du marché local, elle reste la plus expérimentée des revendeuses.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour accroître sa capacité de vente et satisfaire au maximum les besoins de sa clientèle. L’octroi de ce crédit et la réussite de ce projet permettront à Madame S. Sossi d'amélioré les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To increase her stock of condiments.

loans.name: Kossigan

texts.en:
Mr. Kossigan A. was born in Tohoun Togo on 12 December, 1975. After grade school he emigrated to Benin in order to learn to be a mechanic which he never practiced due to the lack of opportunity. He is married and has two children. He struggles daily to provide for the needs of his small family by doing odd jobs. His hopes lay in a new enterprise he undertook with his cousin selling parts to motorcycles and scooters. Through this small business Mr. A. has acquired a significant amount of experience to open his own shop.

Today, for better or worse, his shop is able to stay open, but only through great difficulty. This is why he is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy bulk quantities of loose motorcycle parts in order to better satisfy his customers.

Given the courage, devotion and especially the experience of this young man, this loan will provide him with a "second wind" as he struggles to manage his shop and will enable him to improve his currently precarious economic situation.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Kossigan est né à Tohoun dans le Moyen Mono le 12 décembre 1975. Après ses études primaires, il émigra au Bénin pour apprendre la mécanique qu’il n’a pas eu le temps d’exercer faute de moyen financier. Marié et père de deux enfants, il doit fermement lutter pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille à travers de petites activités occasionnelles. Son espoir viendra d’un cousin qui lui proposa de gérer sa boutique de vente de pièces détachées pour engins à deux roues. C’est dans la gestion de cette affaire qu’il acquiert son expérience et décida lui-même d’ouvrir sa propre boutique.

Aujourd’hui tant bien que mal, il arrive à émerger mais, faute de moyens suffisants, le démarrage est très difficile. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un appui financier de $1200 pour renforcer son commerce par l’achat en gros des pièces détachées afin de pouvoir satisfaire ses clients. Vu le courage, le dévouement et surtout l’expérience de ce jeune homme, ce financement lui donnera un second souffle dans la gestion de son commerce et lui permettra surtout de sortir de sa situation économique très précaires.

loans.use: motorcycle parts shop

loans.name: Komlan

texts.en:
Born in Momé on March 1, 1973, Komlan A. is married and the father of a family of four children. In addition to his children, he takes charge of two brothers and one sister in apprenticeship. With a secondary school education, Komlan A. has much experience in truck farming, which he has done for more than ten years. The profits from this business are a means for him to meet household expenses.

He now hopes to buy electric irrigation equipment to water his entire farm so that he can enlarge his garden. He asks for $1200 to realize his project that will help him to improve his cultivation practice and his family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

Né à Momé le 1er Mars 1973, Monsieur A. Komlan est marié et père d’une famille de quatre (04) enfants. Outres ces derniers, il compte en charge deux (02) frères et une sœur en apprentissage. Instruit de niveau secondaire, Monsieur A. Komlan possède une large expérience dans le maraîchage, qu’il fait depuis plus d’une dizaine d’années. C’est d’ailleurs les revenus de ce travail qui lui servent de moyen pour subvenir aux charges de son ménage.

Aujourd’hui, il espère acheter des machines électriques pour arrosage de tout son espace maraîcher afin de pouvoir agrandir son jardin. Il sollicite $1200 pour la réalisation de ce projet qui lui permettra d’améliorer ses pratiques culturales et les conditions de vie de toute sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.en:
Ms. Afiwa A. is born on January 5, 1978 in the region of Lomé. She is a single mother of one child. She has a very minimal level of education, but is well-skilled in the hardware store business which she inherited from her uncle. During the last 10 years she has invested herself in this business and manages it with rigor and passion.

She is a very ambitious person, and is asking for a loan of $1200 in order to strengthen her business by renting a storefront and building up a vast inventory of construction materials and other hardware supplies. Once this dream has been realized she will be able to vastly improve her living situation/conditions.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle A. Afiwa est née le 05 janvier 1978 à Lomé. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant. D’un niveau d’étude très moyen mais très expérimentée dans le commerce de quincaillerie qu’elle a hérité de son oncle depuis dix ans, elle s’est investi dans ce domaine et le gère avec rigueur et passion.

Très ambitieuse, elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour renforcer son commerce par la location d’un magasin et la constitution d’un stock important de matériaux de construction et des articles de quincaillerie. Une fois se rêve réalisé son bénéfice sera maximisé source de l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: Sale of hardware/construction materials

loans.name: Agbaï Maduka

texts.en:
Mr. Agbai Maduka K. was born on March 27, 1975 in Nigeria. He did not have a very strong education and was then forced to follow in the footsteps of his older brother [a storekeeper] and establish himself in Togo. A Togo citizen by filiation [lineage], he is a father of one child. He had difficulties beginning his business as a buyer and seller of second-hand clothing. Progressively, he acquired experience in this domain and received financing/funding which allowed him to buy in bulk quantities as well as open his own store in the Adawlato market in Lomé.

Today, he is asking for a new loan of $1200 in order to encourage his suppliers to provide him with clothes of better quality.

He is a very dynamic and serious young man whi has demostrated his passion and his seriousness and his ability to manage credit. If he has arrived at this point in his life it is due to his devotion and courage in a mostly un-favorable environment. He is deserving of our support to help him rise above this difficult situation.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Agbaï Maduka K. est né le 27 mars 1975 au Nigeria. Il n’a pas eu une scolarité brillante et doit suivre son grand frère commerçant pour s’installer au Togo. Togolais par filiation, il est père d’un enfant. Il a difficilement débuté dans le commerce par l’achat et la vente des vêtements de la friperie. Mais progressivement, il a acquis une expérience dans le domaine et a reçu des financements qui lui ont permis d’acheter en gros et même d’ouvrir sa propre boutique dans le marché d’Adawlato à lomé.

Aujourd’hui, il sollicite un nouveau financement de 1200 dollars pour inciter ses fournisseurs à leur concéder plus de stock de meilleure qualité.

C’est un jeune homme très dynamique et sérieux qui a démontré dans le passé sa rigueur et sa capacité de gestion de crédit. S’il est arrivé à ce stade c’est grâce à son dévouement et à son courage dans un environnement qui ne lui était pas favorable. Il mérite qu’on le soutienne pour lui permettre de sortir de sa situation difficile.

loans.use: Sale of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Born in Aného on March 31, 1976 and an orphan of both his parents, Mr. Mama M. is a very dynamic young man. Married and a father of two children, he is also responsible for his two younger bvrothers. He learned at a very young age to apply his knowledge to the retail industry, an activity that he is involved with to this day. Blessed with intelligence, he invested his small savings in the buying and selling of mobile phone accessories after obtaining his high school diploma in 2002. Having already spent 7 years in the business world, Mr. Mama M. already knows the ins and outs of his job.

Today, he would like to take the opportunity to ask for a loan of $1200 in order to buy and re-sell popular mobile phones and their acessories. Through this, he will continue to have a monopoly on the market and will be able to increase his business affairs.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Né a Aného le 31 Mars 1976 et orphelin de père et de mère, Monsieur M. Mama est un jeune très dynamique. Marié et père de deux (02) enfants, il a à sa charge ses deux petits frères, Il a su très tôt mettre son savoir dans le commerce, activité qu’il fait jusqu’alors. Dotée d’une bonne intelligence, il a investi sa petite économie dans l’achat et la vente des accessoires de portables après l’obtention de son baccalauréat en 2002. Déjà 7 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce, Monsieur M. Mama connait tous les rouages de son métier,

Aujourd’hui, il veut saisir cette nouvelle opportunité pour solliciter un appui financier de $1200 afin d’acheter les appareils cellulaires très utilisés actuellement et des accessoires afin de les revendre. Par là, il détiendra le monopole sur le marché et pourra accroître son chiffre d’affaires.

loans.use: Buying and selling of mobile phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Victoire

texts.en:
Born in 1979 in Anfoin, Mrs. Victoire K. is maried and a mother of one child, as well as being responsible for three other children. She is a condiments and cereal [wheat, oat, corn, etc] storekeeper, which she inherited from her aunt. Her business is flourishing nicely and enables her to help her husband who is a motorcylce taxi driver who has been out of work for five years.

A very courageous and hard working woman, she is hoping to break-even with her store through the buying, stocking and selling cereals [wheat, oat, corn, etc]. She is asking for a loan of $600 in order to be able to establish herself in nearby villages.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1979 à Anfoin, Madame K. Victoire est mariée et mère d’un enfant avec trois (03) autres enfants à charge. Elle est commerçante de condiments et céréales qu’elle a hérité de sa tante. Ce commerce très florissant lui a permis d’aider son mari qui est un chauffeur de taxi moto en chômage depuis cinq ans.

Très courageuse et laborieuse, elle désire rentabiliser son commerce d’achat, de stockage et de vente de céréales en sollicitant un financement de $600 afin de s’approvisionner dans les villages environnants.

loans.use: Buying, stocking and selling of cereals [wheat, corn oat, etc]

loans.name: Messan

texts.en:
Born on June 27, 1972 in Aného, where he also currently lives, Mr. Messan L. is married and the father of three children, as well as being responsible for two apprentices. He opened his carpentry shop in 1998 at the end of his own apprenticeship. Blessed with tremendous experience, he does his best to satisfy the demands of his clients.

Today, he is hoping to benefit from this new opportunity and supply his workshop with boards in order to produce more furniture. He is asking for a loan of $950 which would enable him to realize his dream. This loan would help Mr. Messan L. increase his revenues and improvie the living conditions of his entire family.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 27 Juin 1972 à Aného où il vit encore, Monsieur L. Messan est marié et père de trois (03) enfants et à sa charge deux (02) apprentis. Il ouvrit son atelier de menuiserie depuis 1998 à la fin de son apprentissage. Doté d’une expérience énorme, il fait son possible pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

Aujourd’hui, il compte bénéficier de cette nouvelle opportunité pour s'approvisionner en planches afin de produire des meubles. Il sollicite un crédit de $950 qui lui permettra de réaliser son rêve. L’octroi de ce nouveau crédit aidera Monsieur L. Messan à accroître ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de toute sa famille.

loans.use: Supplying his workshop with boards for carpentry work

loans.name: Afoua Anne

texts.en:
Mother of one child and having two younger brothers to look after as well, Afoua Anne E. was born in Badou in the Wawa Prefecture on September 23, 1983. She left her studies after finishing middle school because her parents could no longer afford to pay school fees. After staying at home with her mother for several years, she began to work as a peddlar.

In that way, she managed to save enough to open a little stall selling foodstuffs and household necessities. She also provides for her husband, who is jobless.

This is a woman who is devoted to her business and would like to enlarge it by opening a little store and increasing her stock of goods for sale. In view of the present size of her business, she is asking for a loan of $1000 which will allow her to refurbish and enlarge a little store and add to her inventory. This loan will certainly allow her to increase the income from her store and improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Mère d’un enfant avec deux frères à charge, Madame E. Afoua Anne est née à Badou dans la préfecture de Wawa le 23 septembre 1983. Elle arrêta ses études après son CEPD faute de moyen financier des parents. Après plusieurs années passées aux côtés de sa maman, elle entreprit de faire de petits commerces ambulants ou liquidation.

C’est à travers cette activité qu’elle a fait de petites économies lui permettant aujourd’hui d’installer son étalage de vente de produits alimentaires de premières nécessités. Son mari sans emploi est également à sa charge.

C’est une femme très dévouée à son commerce et veut l’agrandir par l’ouverture d’une boutique et la constitution de stocks plus importants de produits et articles qu’elle vend. Compte tenu de l’ampleur que prend son commerce, elle sollicite un financement de $1000 qui lui permettra d’aménager, d’agrandir sa boutique et de constituer un stock de marchandises. A coût sûr, ce financement augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et la rentabilité de son activité et lui permettra au mieux d’améliorer sa condition de vie.

loans.use: refurbish and enlarge her little store and add to her inventory (aménager, agrandir sa boutique et constituer un stock de marchandises)

loans.name: Fakal

texts.en:
Born in 1982 at Alklakou where he still currently lives, Mr. Fakal GBAHOUGBA is a young married man and father of two children. After elementary school he began to learn the retail industry of auto parts, from which he currently receives income. During the last ten years, through this activity, Mr. Fakal G. possesses experience in selling auto parts that should provide you with confidence in supporting him with a loan.

His business is currently working very well and in the worry of increasing his capabilities to satisfy the increasing demands of his clients, he is asking for a credit of $1000 to be able to buy and sell, in bulk quantities, original auto parts well sought after by his clients. The satisfaction of this project will allow him to increase his revenues and improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1982 à Aklakou où il vit actuellement, Monsieur GBAHOUGBA Fakal est un jeune homme marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Après ses études primaires, il s’est lancé dans le commerce des pièces détachées ; ce qui fait ses revenus actuels. Depuis une dizaine d’années, dans cette activité, Monsieur G. Fakal possède une expérience dans la vente des pièces détachées ; expérience qui lui confère une assurance dans la gestion de crédit.

Ses affaires marchent à merveille et dans le souci d’accroître sa capacité de satisfaire les demandes de plus en plus croissantes de sa clientèle, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter en gros et revendre les pièces détachées originales très appréciées des clients . Comme impact, la satisfaction de ce projet lui permettra d’arriver à augmenter ses revenus et du coup améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling of auto parts.

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Mrs. Abla S. was born in 1984 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of one child as well as being responsible for another child. Not having had the chance to pursue her studies for very long, she quickly became involved in the business of loincloths. Her husband being sick, she is not longer able to single-handedly support the household.

A very dynamic woman with the ability to manage a loan, she is asking for a loan of $800 in order to have enough funds to supply in bulk quantities loincloths in the big supermarkets. This would allow her to support her husband during his illness and tend to the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Abla est née en 1984 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant avec un autre enfant à charge. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’évoluer dans les études, elle s’est vite lancée dans le commerce de pagnes. Son mari étant malade, elle n’arrive plus à supporter seule les charges du foyer.

Très dynamique, et ayant une capacité de gestion du crédit, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 afin d’avoir un fond de commerce signifiant pour s’approvisionner en gros en pagnes dans les grands magasins. Ceci pour pouvoir supporter son mari dans sa maladie et subvenir au besoin de la famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling of fabric for loincloths

loans.name: Fakal

texts.en:
Né en 1982 à Aklakou où il vit actuellement, Monsieur GBAHOUGBA Fakal est un jeune homme marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Après ses études primaires, il s’est lancé dans le commerce des pièces détachées ; ce qui fait ses revenus actuels. Depuis une dizaine d’années, dans cette activité, Monsieur G. Fakal possède une expérience dans la vente des pièces détachées ; expérience qui lui confère une assurance dans la gestion de crédit. 

Ses affaires marchent à merveille et dans le souci d’accroître sa capacité de satisfaire les demandes de plus en plus  croissantes de sa clientèle, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter en gros et revendre les pièces détachées originales très appréciées des clients . Comme impact, la satisfaction de ce projet lui permettra d’arriver à augmenter ses revenus et du coup améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Achat et vente de pièces détachées

loans.name: Achieng

texts.en:
J. Achieng is a 26 year-old entrepreneur and mother of three school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Kisumu, Kenya. She began her current business of dress making in the year 2000 in Rongo, Kenya. In 2006, she moved her business to Kisumu where her husband is employed. She specializes in both women’s and men’s clothing’s.

The business location, coupled with her friendly interaction with customers, has enabled her to establish a good clientele base. She owes her success to hard work, perseverance, and two previous microfinance loans she has received from KMET. She has also established a training site for girls who have dropped out of school (currently has 10 students) who are trained in dressmaking. To keep up with her customers' demand she has employed a full-time tailor.

J. plans to move to a more spacious site with her next loan of US $625. She will use it to purchase more stock of sewing materials and to pay a month's rent at the new site.

loans.use: Purchase more material and move her business to a more spacious location

loans.name: Arum

texts.en:
G. Arum is a 29 year-old husband and father of three school-aged children. He lives in Nyalenda, one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya and runs a community pharmacy in his area. His pharmacy (pictured) has been his only source of income since completing his secondary education. G. was one of the first community health workers trained by KMET and has tirelessly provided home-based care services for people living with HIV/AIDS for the past three years.

People living in this community are very poor, thus making him sell his drugs at very subsidized prices. The community appreciates his services and you will often hear him being called daktari (Kiswahili word for Doctor). He stocks a range of drugs such as painkillers and medications for malaria, family planning, allergies, ulcers, worms and skin infections, and various syrups for children. He has a word of kindness to KMET for extending credit to him and enabling him establish his business. This has earned him a good reputation within his community.

G. has received and fully paid two previous loans from KMET. He has applied for a loan amounting US $600 to further expand his pharmacy and purchase drug stock in bulk.

loans.use: To expand the community pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tailoring and waste paper recycling business

loans.name: Mworia

texts.en: J. Mworia 35 year-old community health nurse who runs a clinic in Meru, Eastern Province, Kenya. He wore a smile on his face when he heard the news that he can access a loan to improve the quality of services at his clinic. He runs a rural clinic that serves also as a point of referral for other clinics. So many clients now come to Mworia’s clinic that two other clinics that used to operate within the same area have had to relocate to different sites, due to their reduced number of clients. He intends to use the loan to establish a fully equipped minor surgery theatre, renovate, and create more space.

loans.use: Expand and improve health services

loans.name: Celanda

texts.en:
Celanda has earned and paid back three loans in our program. She started out making and buying cheese to sell. Her customer base and business skills have grown to the point where she is able to run her neighborhood grocery store. This loan will give Celanda the capital to purchase the store and goods where she works.

This typical Dominican store, which you can find in every neighborhood throughout the country, is a vital resource for families who cannot afford to travel to the large grocery stores in town. Celanda can sell fruit and vegetables, meat, refrigerated goods, canned food, beverages, daily hygiene products, and her specialty cheeses at inexpensive prices and in small quantities.

Celanda would be in charge of providing for families in her village in Los Alcarrizos, Santo Domingo as well as caring for her 1-year-old granddaughter. Celanda has paid off her previous three loans with her solidarity group called "Las Empresarias" and can now receive this large individual loan thanks to her proven ability and dedication.

loans.use: To purchase a small grocery store and its complete inventory

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a printing press for his printing and design business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a three- wheeler tuk tuk taxi

loans.name: Iris Yuliana

texts.en:
I work as a seamstress, making blouses for women, and I sell them to stores and to individuals. Currently, I need to make various styles of blouses for summer, but I need the capital to buy the raw material such as lace, cloth, thread, and others. This is my only form of income which helps me to maintain my home and my son's education.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi trabajo es la confeccion de blusas para damas, vendo a personas que tienen tiendas y particulares. En este momento tengo que fabricar varias blusas de verano, por lo que necesito capital para comprar materia prima como encajes, telas, hilos y otros. Esta es mi unica fuente de ingreso que me ayuda a mantener mi casa y los estudios de mi hijo.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, thread, zippers, embellishments, laces and other items.

loans.name: Iris Suyapa

texts.en:
I have had my business of selling women's clothing for several years, and now that the summer is approaching I need capital to invest in order to buy clothes for the beach as well as accessories such as sunglasses, sunscreen and hair treatments. With my earnings I can help my children with their education since my business is doing better. I know that my sales in summer will bring in higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Tengo varios años de dedicarme a la venta de ropa para damas, ahora en la epoca de verano necesito capital para comprar ropa para playa, asi como accesorios como lentes, cremas para el sol, tratamientos de cabello. con los ingresos de mis ventas he podido ayudar a mis hijos con su educacion, ahora estoy realizando mejoras a mi casa. Se que con las ventas de verano podre tener mejores ganancias.

loans.use: To purchase shorts, shirts, towels, bathing suits and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To transform his barbershop to become a unisex hair salon

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana runs a very popular store, which sells new children’s clothing as well as arts and crafts supplies. Parents come to purchase new children’s apparel while their children come for the colorful accessories and tiny toys lining the shelves and hanging from the ceiling. Ana is a perfect fit for the atmosphere. She is constantly smiling and quick to laugh. This loan would allow her to supply the demand in her village – adding some extra joy to the impoverished community. The income generated by her new investment will improve her ability to provide a job for her sister working in the shop as well as care for the needs of her four young children – ages 5, 8, 12 and 14.

NOTE: Ana is a member of the "Las Empresarias" group, along with four other entrepreneurs. They will be accountable to one another for paying back this loan of $750. This group lending method requires group members to help one another throughout the loan repayment process. Loans are paid back as a group. If one person is deficient on their loan, the group must make up the difference. Everyone in Ana’s group has gone through Esperanza's training and proven to be responsible and determined to invest in their business and care for their children.

loans.use: Purchase new children's clothing as well as arts and crafts for her retail store

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Julia Rolanda

texts.en:
I make and sell sweets to my neighbors, schools and grocery stores in my town. This activity has been my help for a long time and has enabled me to meet many people and now I have various clients who sell my products in their businesses, and I also sell my sweets in the schools where the children buy them. This business has generated good earnings that have allowed my to support my children in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Me dedico a la elaboracion de dulces que vendo a mis vecinos, escuelas y pulperias de mi ciudad. Esta actividad ha sido mi ayuda durante mucho tiempo y me ha servido para conocer a otras personas, ahora tengo varios clientes que venden en sus negocios, reparto a escuelas donde los niños compran. Este negocio me ha generado buenas ganancias con las que he podido apoyar a mis hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: To purchase milk, sugar, colorants, artificial flavorings, bags and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase welding equipment for his craft and metal joinery business

loans.name: Dorila

texts.en:
In my neighborhood I am well known because I have sold food for many years, which are known in Honduras as "golosinas" (snacks), which are really fast-food types of food such as tacos, pastries, and french fries. I currently have many customers who buy my foods in the evening hours and since school has started again, many students who buy my food in the afternoons as well as the evenings, since my business is located near one of the school centers. With this activity I have been able to help my children with their studies and cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

En mi colonia soy bastante conocida ya que desde hace muchos años me dedico a vender comidas, en Honduras a este tipo de comida le llamamos golosinas que son comidas tipicas rapidas, como tacos de tortillas con pollo, pastelitos, papas fritas. Actualmente tengo bastantes clientes quienes por las noches me compran, ahora que iniciaron clases los estudiantes me compran por las tardes y en la noche, ya que mi negocio esta ubicado cerca de un centro de estudios. Con esta actividad he podido ayudar a mis hijos en sus estudios, y apoyar en los gastos de mi casa.

loans.use: To sell pastries, french fries, tacos and other foods.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Iris Haydee

texts.en:
For 5 years I have worked as a tailor, making pants for men and children as well as blouses for women, which I sell in the markets in the capitol. I also do contracts for school centers to make uniforms. Currently, I need capital to buy cloth, zippers, buttons and to hire another person to help me part-time. The employee will will help me make enough product to create enough income to continue supporting my family and to better my sales and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Desde hace 5 años me dedico a la confeccion de pantalones para caballeros y niños, asi como blusas para damas que vendo en mercados de la capital. Tambien hago contratos con centros escolares para fabricarles sus uniformes. Ahora tengo un contrato con tres escuelas por lo que necesito capital para comprar telas, ziper, botones y contratar a otra personas para poder entregar el pedido a tiempo. Este contrato me generara ganancias para poder seguir ayudando a mi familia y poder mejorar mucho mas mis ventas y ganancias.

loans.use: To purchase cloth for dress-pants and jeans.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sewing machines for expanding and relocating her tailoring business.

loans.name: Allan Gustavo

texts.en:
My dream had always been to own my own bakery, and for three years now I have been baking breads which I sell in grocery stores and to individuals who sell products outside of my city. Thanks to the trust of those who would lend me money I will be able to make my business grow, but now I need to buy materials to bake more breads and to hire other young people to help me. Thanks to the earnings I make selling my bread I can better the construction of my home and my business as well as help my children in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi sueño fue tener mi propia panaderia, desde hace tres años me dedico a fabricar pan, ahora vendo a pulperias, personas particulares que venden fuera de la ciudad, gracias a la confianza de las personas que me dieron capital de trabajo he podido hacer crecer mi propio negocio, ahora necesito comprar material para fabricar mas pan, y contratar otros jovenes para que me ayuden con este negocio. Gracias a las ganancias de las ventas de pan he podido mejorar la construccion de mi casa, mi negocio y ayudar a mis hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: To purchase flour, butter, sugar, eggs, salt, cinnamon, colorants, molds, firewood and other items.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
I have been making trousers for 2 years as well as making shoes. My business is small, however I am working hard to make it grow and to make my products better-known. But for this I need capital to buy raw materials to make the trousers and shoes. With my efforts I will be able to make my business grow and to help my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Tengo dos años de dedicarme a confeccionar pantalones, comunmente llamado ropa de maquila y fabricar calzado, mi negocio es pequeño aun, estoy trabajando para hacerlo crecer y dar a conocer mis productos. Es por eso que necesito capital de trabajo para comprar materia prima y fabricar pantalos y zapatos. Con mi esfuerzo se que puedo hacer crecer mi negocio y ayudar a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase cloths and other materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Margarita Reyna

texts.en:
For 5 years I have sold clothing for men, women and children, and I have a loyal clientel, I sell in offices, and by contract for neighbors. The saint-week will be coming and I need to stock my summer clothing to satisfy my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Desde hace cinco años me dedico a la venta de ropa para varon, mujer y niño, ya tengo mi clientela fija, vendo en oficinas, y vecinos por encargos. Ahora que viene la semana santa necesito surtir la ropa de verano para satisfacer a mis clientes.

loans.use: To purchase blouses, skirts, summer clothing and other items.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
I make and sell tortillas, and I have several years experience in this business, which has created enough income to help my family in their daily expenses. Now the demand has increased and some of them have businesses where they sell food and contract me to make tortillas for them to use, as do my neighbors for family dinners and special events.
