I need capital to buy materials for the tortillas and to double my current earnings because I have two children who will be starting university and the costs continue to grow. I know that I can continue to support them economically and to achieve a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este rubro que me ha generado ganancias para ayudar a mi familia en los gastos. Ahora la demanda de mis clientes ha crecido ya que algunos de ellos han puesto negocios de comidas y me encargan las tortillas para acompañar sus comidas, asi como mis vecinos en sus tiempos de comida familiar y eventos. Necesito capital para comprar material para las tortillas y doblar mis ingresos ya que tengo dos hijos que inician sus estudios universitarios y los gastos se incrementaron. Se que puedo seguirles apoyando economicamente y lograr mejorar nuestra calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy corn-flour, firewood, water and other items.

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.en:
I sell daily consumer goods and my grocery store is rather well known and I continue to attempt to keep my store well stocked with the items that sell the most. I am currently in need of stock with the end result being to better my earnings in order to support my children in their studies. My grocery store has a very good location in my neighborhood because it is on the main street and also next to a taxi stop.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi negocio es la venta de productos de consumo popular, mi pulperia es bastante conocida ya que siempre trato de tenerla surtida con los productos de mayor venta, ahora necesito surtirlo con el proposito de mejorar mis ingresos para apoyar a mis hijos en sus estudios. Mi pulperia tiene buena ubicacion ya que es la calle principal de mi colonia y los taxistas actualemnte tienen su terminal aca.

loans.use: To purchase eggs, butter, milk, bread, refreshments, coffee, meats, chicken, dairy products and other items.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Agna Azucena

texts.en:
I have several years experience selling sausages and I have my business run from my own home because I live on the main street of my neighborhood and everyone comes to my home to buy sausages. My suppliers know me because I return to them every week to make my purchases. My business has grown and now I find myself losing business because I need more capital to buy more product.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Tengo varios años de dedicarme a la venta de embutidos, mi negocio lo tengo en mi casa ya que vivo en la calle principal de mi colonia y todas las personas pasan por aca comprando sus embutidos. Mis proveedores ya me conocen por lo que semanal les hago compras. Mi negocio ha crecido y ahora me quedo corta en ventas por lo que necesito capital para comprar mas producto.

loans.use: To purchase ham, various sausages,bologna, cheese and other items.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.en:
I work as a merchant, selling new clothing to people in offices, schools and markets. I travel to Guatemala or El Salvador where I buy my products and I return home to sell them to my own customers. Currently I need to travel to buy summer clothing and I wish to take advantage of the season in order to better my earnings and to finalize the repairs on my home.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi trabajo es vender ropa nueva a personas en oficinas, escuelas y mercados, viajo a Guatemala o El Salvador donde compro y vengo a venderles a mis clientes por encargos. Ahora necesito viajar para comprar ropa de verano, quiero aprovechar esta epoca para mejorar mis ganancias y finalizar la reparacion de mi casa.

loans.use: To buy summer clothing.

loans.name: Vilma Leonor

texts.en:
One of the most common accompaniments for meal in our country is the tortilla, and every meal three times a day, should have hot and delicious tortillas with it. I have several years experience making tortillas which has created enough income to help my family and now that my children have grown, and are going to secondary school, their education costs have doubled. I need to buy more material to make tortillas so that I can increase sales and to continue supporting my children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Uno de los acompañantes de cada comida en nuestro pais son las tortillas, los tres tiempos de comida deben acompañarse con las ricas y calientes tortillas. Tengo varios años de dedicarme a la fabricacion de tortillas y me ha generado ganancias suficientes para ayudar a mi familia, ahora mis hijos han crecido y van a la secundaria por lo que la inversion en sus estudios es el doble. Necesito comprar material para las tortillas e incrementar mis ventas para seguir apoyandoles.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make tortillas.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate and expand her pub business

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.en:
I have worked for several years making all-natural refreshments and I buy seasonal fruits for the drinks and make foods to sell in the markets and home. With this business I have been able to help my family with daily expenses and my children with their studies. Now as the school season approaches I will sell refreshments in local schools as well as fruits, foods and churros.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Tengo varios años de dedicarme a la fabricacion de refrescos naturales, compra la fruta de temporada para frescos y elaboro alimentos para vender en mercados y casa. Con este negocio he podido ayudar a mi familia con los gastos y a mis hijos con sus estudios. Ahora en temporada escolar entrego refrescos en escuelas cercanas a mi casa, al igual que les vendo frutas, comidas y churros.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, bags, thermoses and other items.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Glenda Xiomara

texts.en:
I make tortillas and through this business I have been able to help my family, but now the demand for my product has increased and to meet it I need the capital to buy raw materials in order to make my tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Me dedico a la fabricacion de tortillas, con este negocio he podido ayudar a mi familia, ahora la demanda de tortilla ha crecido por lo que necesito capital de trabajo para comprar materia prima y fabricar mas tortillas.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make tortillas.

loans.name: Doris Margoth

texts.en:
My business is the sales of clothing for women and children, it is a good business which has enabled me to support my children and to take care of the household expenses. As the summer season approaches, I need to stock my business with various products and to better my earnings in order to invest them in my children's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi negocio es la venta de ropa dama y niño, este es un buen negocio ya que me ayuda a mantener a mis hijos y apoyar en los gastos de mi casa. En esta epoca de verano necesito surtir mi negocio con productos variados y mejorar mis ingresos para invertirlos en los estudios de mis hijos.

loans.use: To purchase shorts, glasses, sunscreen and other accessories and summer clothing.

loans.name: Jose Gustavo

texts.en:
For several years I have been working in the sales of clothing for adolescents, children and adults. My business has created enough income to help my family and now I need to invest money in order to stock my store and to have a wider variety of clothes for those customers who will be heading to the beaches. Thanks to my family's efforts I have been able to grow my business to what it is now, and at the moment it is rather difficult to find work, so there is a need to find another way to help one's family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Desde hace varios años me dedico a la venta de ropa para jovenes, niños y adultos. Mi negocio me ha generado ganancias para ayudar a mi familia, ahora necesito invertir capital para surtir y tener variedad en ropa para las personas que salgan a las playas. Gracias al esfuerzo de mi familia he podido salir adelante con este negocio ya que en estos momentos es bastante dificil encontrar trabajo y hay que buscar algo para ayudar a la familia.

loans.use: To purchase various clothing articles for men, women and children.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.en:
In this zone of the city I am known as "Angel the container seller," because I sell plastic items for the home. I have another stand in another part of the city, which is run by my wife, and with the earnings we make we help our family with expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

En esta zona de la capital me conocen como angel el vende pailas, y es porque me dedico a la venta de articulos de plasticos que son utiles en los hogares, tengo otro puesto en otro punto de la ciudad que es atendido por mi esposa, con los ingresos que percibimos ayudamos a nuestra familia con los gastos.

loans.use: To purchase containers, razers, cups, plates and other plastic items.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura has a small boutique in her home. Laura began her business with the help of her family. At first she only sold costume jewelry. Now she continues to offer those products together with sportswear and formalwear. She will use the loan to invest in product display materials and to purchase more products for sale. She is sure that her business will grow and she will be able to make additional investments. Laura is a mother of three children, separated, and is 57 years old. She depends entirely on this business to support her family. She hopes that this loan will give her the financial security to allow her to save for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Laura tiene un pequeño boutique en su vivienda. Laura empezó el negocio con la ayuda de un familiar. Al principio solo vendía bisutería. Ahora continúa ofreciendo estos productos junto con ropa sport y de vestir. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en una vitrina para sus productos y comprar mas artículos de bazar. Ella tiene toda la seguridad que su negocio crecerá y podrá seguir haciendo inversiones. Laura es madre de tres hijos, separada, tiene 57 años. Ella depende de su negocio completamente para apoyar a su familia. Tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le dará seguridad financiera y puede permitirle ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Invertir en una vitrina para los productos

loans.name: Mariela

texts.en:
Mariela has a small bazaar in her home. Mariela began her business with the help of her husband who provided US$150 in investment capital. She began selling purses and backpacks to her friends and family. Now she continues selling purses and backpacks together with other items. Mariela will use the loan to invest in wholesale merchandise and thereby increase her income. She has faith that these new products will help her business grow. Mariela is a mother of three children, married and 23 years old. Mariela hopes that this loan can improve her family's quality of life and that it will give her stability to grow her business.

Mariela tiene un pequeño bazar en su domicilio. Mariela empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien le facilito un capital de 150 dólares. Se inicio vendiendo bolsos y mochilas a sus amistades y familiares. Ahora ella continua vendiendo bolsos y mochilas y articulos de bazar. Mariela usara el préstamo para invertir en mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mejores ingresos. Ella tiene la fe que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecerá. Mariela es madre de 3 hijos, esta unida, tiene 23 años. Mariela tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le dará estabilidad y crecimiento al negocio.

loans.use: Comprar sus productos al por mayor

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura has a small drugstore and sells various producs out of her home. Laura began her business with the help of her husband who provided money to start up the drugstore. At the beginning she only sold medicines. Now she offers those products together with school supplies and office supplies. Laura will use the loan to grow her business and to improve the quality of her home. She is sure that with these new products her business will grow. Laura is married and a mother of two children. She is 36 years old. Laura is convinced that this loan will improve the financial standing of her family to enable them to build a home and save for their children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Laura tiene una pequeña farmacia y ventas de articulos varios en su vivienda. Laura empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien le facilito el dinero para arrancar en la farmacia. Al principio solo vendía medicamentos. Ahora ofrece estos productos junto con articulos escolares y de oficina. Laura usara el préstamo para ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de su local. Ella tiene la plena seguridad que con estos nuevos productos su negocio va ha tener crecimiento. Laura es madre de dos hijos, casada. Ella tiene 36 años. Laura esta convencida que con este préstamo mejorara el nivel económico de su familia para así poder construir su vivienda y ahorrar para la educación futura de sus hijos.

loans.use: To improve her home and invest in new products.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is married and has four children. She has been in business for the last five years. She started her business by buying kitenges - a type of cloth wrap - from wholesalers in Kisumu; then, she took a loan from Krep and started buying the kitenges in wholesale in Busia Uganda.

The business has enabled her educate her children. Given the loan, she wants to buy and sell more kitenges, as the demand for them is high.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Askar

texts.en:
A. is involved in three businesses: fish monger, selling of vegetables, and restaurant owner. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She started her business with a capital of $100 which she got from the husband to start a hotel business. Since then she diversified as her business grew.

Given the funds, she wants to inject the money in the three businesses so that they can bring more income to her. She is a widow with six children who are school-going and solely depend on the profits from the business for their education.

loans.use: Expand her three businesses

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James O. sells different types of books, both new and second-hand. He started his business with a capital of $150 which he had saved while working. He has been in this business for the last five years. He is married and has two children. He has two brothers who depend on him.

Given the funds, he intends to diversify his business by stocking different books and materials to meet his clients' demands. He intends to expand and open a bookshop in the near future.

loans.use: Buy more stock of goods

loans.name: Galileo

texts.en:
O. is married and has two children, and one child is going to school. He started his business with a $200 loan from his cousin. Since then, he has been supplying the building stones by buying on credit and repaying after selling.

Given the loan, he intends to restock the stones as they are in high demand in Kisumu as more buildings are going up.

He takes care of two children from his deceased brother. He intends to use the profits to build his own house and buy medical insurance for his family.

loans.use: Buy more building materials

loans.name: Kenedy

texts.en:
M. started his business in 1996 with capital of $800 from other sources. His business is situated in a busy market in Kibuye Kisumu. He is married and has 6 children who are going to school.

He has undergone training by Rafode in business management and loan use, and he buys the clothes to stock his market stall in Nairobi and Kampala, Uganda.

After receiving the loan, he wants to stock a greater variety of clothes to attract more clients.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
N. is married and has two children. One child is going to school. He started his business with $100 from his previous employer four years ago. Since then, the business has grown, enabling him to meet the financial needs of the family.

With the loan, he wants to buy more garments to meet the ever-increasing demands of his customers. He intends to use the profits to buy a plot and build a house for the family.

loans.use: Investing in business

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is married and has three children. He has been in the business of selling new clothes and garments for the last two years. He started the business with savings he accumulated while employed.

With the loan, he will invest in the business and buy a variety of clothes to cater for the demands of children and adults.

He intends to use the profits from the business to help his father at home by building a good house for him, taking care of the family, and educating his children.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is married and has three children two ging to school, she started her tailoring business three years ago and she was trained in a local politechnic in tailoring skills.

She has one employee and she intends to expand the business by buying two machines to enable her serve her increassing clients.

Given the loan i will nable her buy the two machines and also buy materials to be used in her business.

She intends to use the profit to re invest in the business and save for future use.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Limaeka

texts.en: Limaeka has created a very interesting business. Her products which she sells at gift shops, flea markets, and hotels are always high in demand. There are also her regular customers that place orders every fortnight that Limaeka can’t prepare by the time they need it, so she has also employed 2 village girls to work with her to meet deadlines. Limaeka's children are receiving a good education through their mother's sweat from trying bringing up her business into the situation it is now. But she still believes that she needs to extend her business by providing a different variety of handicrafts like leis and bracelets which her customers are requesting. That will also boost her income and also her standard of living.

loans.use: Buy materials, fabric paint, glitter, laufala, pandanus

loans.name: Marawai

texts.en: Marawai is a 45 year old mother of 6 children. Three of them are in college while the other two are still in secondary school. Her 4 year old she’s looking after. Mara was educated in The Samoan Polytechnic Instituted, doing tourism. She met her husband their, taking mechanics and they later got married, and started their lawn mowing business, which is a far field from what they took in school. But Marawai explains, that with what they’ve learned from the courses they took it is really helping them with their business. Her hospitality to her customers are keeping them returning to  the business, and her husband's mechanic experience helps to repair their lawn mowers. Mara’s goal is to make her business more successful so that she can increase the number of clients.

loans.use: To purchase another lawn mower, accessories, and fuel to be used by another employee she hired to expand her business

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is a 35 year old mother of 4 children.  Both she and the husband are self-employed working together on their taro plantation.  Matalena is staying at her husband’s village, taking care of her husband’s parents.  Matalena’s only source of income is from her business, which she thinks, is not enough to take care of her children and the whole family. All her children attend the village school, which she prefers because it is affordable for her to pay.   Her aim is to expand her business, so that she can earn more to cater to the whole family, and provide a better education for all her children.  With this loan, she’s aiming to buy cattle to start a cattle farm business which is lucrative.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, chemicals, weed killer and a grass cutter.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en: Natia S. is a 48 year old mother of 3 who won an award as one of the best business woman in the year 2006.  Natia’s business was a canteen shop at one of the schools and some of her goods she sells are sandwiches, hot dogs, pork cakes, pancakes and buns with coconut cream. Natia’s thanks goes out to the teaching of her church LDS that she was able to learn how to make the best goods in healthy ways that made her business the best selection for her customers. With her requested loan, Natia aims to start a cattle farm business, to use up their unused 12 acres of land. She’ll also still be running her canteen business.

loans.use: To buy 4 cattle

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Onofa

texts.en: Onofa is a 40 year old mother with 4 sons; two are employed at Salani Reef Resort, one is a policeman, and one lives at home working in his father’s plantation.  Onofa’s business is a grocery shop that was developed from her husband’s plantation.  Back then, before she joined SPBD, she was only able to buy some goods that they could afford, mostly rice, sugar, tea, mosquito oil, noodles, soap and toilet tissues.  It’s now Onofa’s third loan and there has been a big improvement with her business.  She’s now selling different a variety of goods, candies, snacks, soft drinks, beer, cigarettes, frozen foods, fruit etc.  With her requested loan, she plans to extend her shop because with her business growing she is not able to fit into the small space she has now.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods and inventory for her retail shop and for expansion of her store space

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: I am a 32-year-old single mother of two. I do my business to meet the basic needs of food and shelter for my family. I want the loan to enable me to earn a profit of US $2 a day.

loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business to include fruit vending.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en: I am a single man. I am the head of a 6-person household. I am the main bread-earner. I dropped out of school to take care of my siblings after the death of our parents due to HIV/AIDS in 2005.

loans.use: I will use the loan to purchase bicycle repair equipment.

loans.name: Osooso

texts.en: Osooso is a 51 year old mother of 4, who has been doing this chips business for 6 years now. She can not increase produce because with her income it is not enough to provide for their family needs and to keep the business running. Now she needs a loan of $800 to expand the area of her production, and to buy more tools to provide fast production. She aims to improve her business to increase her income to satisfy her family and also to keep her business running.

loans.use: Buy new tires for their delivery car, ingredients for making taro chips, plastic sealer and cooking equipment

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Pepeu

texts.en: Pepeu is a 59 year old woman, with a weaving business. Pepeu has been doing weaving from the age of 17. She was being taught by her mother in her early teens, because back then, Samoan culture was really strong and if you couldn't weave then you were not a true Samoan lady. One of Pepeu’s works was weaving fine mats that we always have to present during special events, like funerals & weddings. It’s a very special treasure of Samoa. Nowadays we hardly find these treasures, and so women who do weaving are actually benefiting from it, through selling it. For a small size mat, which is about 2 meters long will cost up to US$20, and as the meters go on the price as well goes up. Not only its cost by meters, it’s also it’s priced for how they weave it, and you can imagine how hard it is to make. For a mat 2 meters long, it takes 2 whole weeks to complete, but if you’re a faster weaver it will only take a week.

loans.use: To purchase materials for weaving: pandanus, paints, dyes, feathers, cords and to replace old weaving tools

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: I am a 33-year-old mother of four. I take care of 2 other orphared children.The loan will improve  My life because I will increase my income which will enable me to pay school fees for the 2 children in secondary school. I  loan to enable me to earn a profit of US $3 a day.

loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Rufo

texts.en: Rufo is a 45 year old mother of one son and 3 adopted children.  Her business is a coffee shop located in the capital of Samoa which is Apia.    Rufo lived most of her life in America but when her husband passed away she moved back to Samoa. She started a coffee shop business that is her main source of income in taking care of her children.  Rufo had the idea of her business from America, and she found it really successful in Samoa. She has picked a good location which is near to the main bus stop.  Her daily customers are mostly students.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her coffee shop and buy new cooking equipment - stove, coffeemaker, pots, pans, and other utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will spend the loan money to purchase a dairy goat

loans.name: Samutia

texts.en: Samutia is a married 29 year old lady with 2 kids. She runs a food stall business, primarily selling pancakes, home made cakes, fried sausages, chickens and fish. Samutia has been in business for 5 years now, and is very happy with the success of her business. She’s a very energetic mother who wakes up at 4.30am in the morning to put in order her food stall for opening at 6am; this is her routine from Monday to Saturday every week. Samutia has become really dedicated to her business. She aims to save money so that by time her children are ready to go to school, she can provide them with the best education.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making pancakes: flour, eggs, milk, sugar, flavourings, shortening and to purchase a new stove

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the loan to purchase bicycle repair tools.

loans.name: Sinuu

texts.en: Sinuu is a 53 year old mother with 5 children, all grown up with two of them living in New Zealand and three still in Samoa working.  Sinuu owns about 8 acres of land in her village with 4 acres being used  by her business and the other four divided amongst her children in Samoa to work on.  She has been in the business for more than ten years now, and had been really successful with the support from her husband and children.  She aims to buy another 2 acres of land for her two children overseas, so that when they come back home they have a land to work and are able to continue her work.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers, chemicals, fungicides, and farm implements

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en: I am a 28-year-old. I am married with 2 children. I intend to use the loan to build skill and increase my income.

loans.use: I will use the loan to purchase bicycle repair tools.

loans.name: Kibera

texts.en: I am a 27-year-old father of 2.  I take care of 2 other children. My life will improve because I will be able to pay the school fees for my brother in  secondary school.

loans.use: I will use the loan to buy more high quality shoes

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: I am a 32-year-old mother of 3.  I take care of 3 other children. My life will improve because I will be able to pay the school fees for the 3 in secondary school. I want the loan to enable me to earn a profit of US $2 a day

loans.use: I will use the loan to buy more high quality clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase carpentry equipment and raw materials needed to expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Hezekiah

texts.en: I am a father of 3, aged 34 years. I also take care of my parents and nephews. I sell second-hand men's clothing. I wish to earn more money through diversifying my business.

loans.use: Purchase high quality clothes and pay for license

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica has been in the business of selling onions for the last five years. Her business is situated in the busy Kibuye market of Kisumu. She buys the onions in bulk and sells them to other traders on a retail basis. She is educated to level 8 and dropped out of school due to poverty. She is married and has seven children, five of whom are going to school.

She started her business with $200 from her grandmother. With the loan, she wants to increase the stock she buys on a weekly basis to enable her to meet the demands of her customers.

She will use the profits from her business to educate her children and expand the business.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Hounouvi

texts.en:
Born in 1948 in Kpessi, Mr. Hounouvi N. is married and a father of seven children. A teacher who has been retired for the last four years, he has devoted himself to agriculture and farming in order to attend to the needs of his family. After being formally trained for a year at the ICAT [institute of counsel and technology], Mr. N. has established himself in his village where he puts into practice his knowledge with traditional methods and very limited production capabilities.

He specializes in growing onions, an activity that is very profitable, espeically during this specific time period where demands outnumber supplies. He is asking for a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a motorized water pump, a spray nozzle and industry inputs and to rent a plot of land. This would greatly help him to increase his number of transactions. The resulting profits would allow him to improve the currently very miserable living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1948 à Kpessi, Monsieur N. Hounouvi est marié et père de sept (07) enfants. Enseignant admis à la retraite depuis 4 ans, il s’est consacré au maraîchage afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Après une formation d’un an à l’Institut de conseil et d’appui technique (ICAT), Monsieur N. s’est installé dans son village où il met en pratique ses connaissances mais avec des moyens traditionnels et très limités la production. Spécialisé dans la culture d’oignons, une activité très rentable surtout en cette période où la demande dépasse l’offre, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter une motopompe, un pulvérisateur, des intrants et pour bailler d’autres parcelles. Ceci l’aidera beaucoup à accroître sa production et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires. Les revenus ainsi dégagés contribueront à améliorer les conditions de vie très misérables de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase a motorized water pump, a spray nozzle and industry inputs

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Akossiwa was born in 1971 in Tabligbo in the county of Yoto; she is married and the mother of five children. Her husband, a breakdown mechanic, has a hard time taking care of the family. She pursues retailing to meet her family’s needs. Very bright, she conducts a rigorous management of her activities thus making her loan reimbursements without difficulties.

She is soliciting a loan for $600 to develop her retail business by buying her food products in bulk, which will cost her less. This will enable her to maximize her profit and increase her family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Akossiwa est née en 1971 à Tabligbo dans la préfecture de Yoto, elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Son mari, un dépanneur arrive difficilement à s’occuper de la famille. Elle se lance dans le commerce afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Très intelligente, elle fait une gestion rigoureuse de ses activités ce qui fait que ses remboursements se font sans difficulté.

Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $600 pour développer son commerce en achetant en gros ses produits d'alimentation, ce qui lui revient moins cher. Ceci lui permettra de maximiser le profit et d’améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.

loans.use: Buying and re-selling of food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase new syllabus books

loans.name: Siolova

texts.en: Siolova is a married mother with six children. Three of them are in college while the other three are in primary. Siolova is a very religious woman who never gives up. She has had a lot of trouble with a husband who is an alcoholic, but it didn’t stop her from doing her duty, looking for opportunity to get money for their survival. She has educated her children from income earned from her bag-making and weaving business. In addition, she grows taro, bananas and vegetables for extra earning for the family. Given a loan of $800, Siolova intends to buy more modern tools to bring her products to a more modern level.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making of Samoan bags: pandanus, fibers, paint, dye, cloth lining and purchase of weaving tools

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify my business to include clothes

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.en:
Mr. S. Ayaovi was born in 1981 in Lomé in the county of the Golfe. He abandoned his schooling at the elementary level because of lack of support; very quickly he launched himself in the wood selling business (boards for carpentry work) to meet his own needs. Very good at management, he succeeds at drawing a profit.

He solicits a credit of $600 to buy a stock of boards from the zone of large productions in order to make a maximum profit. He could then open a store; have a permanent stock and retail wholesale. This will increase his income and his well-being.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Ayaovi est née en 1981 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe. Abandonnant ses études au cours primaire par manque de soutien, il s’est très vite lancé dans le commerce de bois (planches pour travaux de menuiserie) pour subvenir à ses besoins. Très doué en gestion, il arrive à rentabiliser ses activités. Il sollicite un crédit de $600 pour s’approvisionner dans les zones de grandes productions de planches en vue d’un bénéfice maximum. Il pourra ouvrir un magasin, avoir un stock permanent et vendre en gros. Ceci augmentera ses revenus en vue de son bien être.

loans.use: Open a store and have a wood inventory

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: I am a 32-year-old married man with 3 children. My business is located in the outskirts of Kisumu. I intend to diversify my business to include clothes.

loans.use: Diversify my business to include clothes

loans.name: Kenedy

texts.en:
Kenedy has been in the business of making furniture for the last two years. He started the business in 2004. He is widowed and has one child who is going to school. He also takes care of his elderly father and mother, and he is paying school fees for his two brothers.

Since he started the business, he has been able to meet his needs from the proceeds of the business. With the loan, he intends to buy materials in bulk to enable him to reduce the cost and thereby maximize his profits.

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Antoinnette

texts.en:
Born in 1966, S. Antoinette is a woman full of initiative who wishes to become self-sufficient and detach herself from the burden of her husband. She cares for six (06) people, including an uncle and her mother. Her husband is a craft worker who has almost no clients left, he then has no income to provide for the family’s needs. The income derived from the wife’s business of palm nut biomass is invested to cover the family’s needs consequently she does not have the capacity to auto-finance. She is soliciting a loan of $400 for start up capital to purchase palm nut biomass so she can efficiently turn a profit in this activity. She knows that business well and could provide properly for her children’s needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1966, S. Antoinette est une femme pleine d’initiative qui souhaite s’auto suffire et se détacher du poids de son mari. Elle a six (06) personnes à charge dont un oncle et sa mère. Son mari est artisan et n’a pratiquement plus de clientèle ce qui fait qu'il n'a plus de revenus pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Les revenus du commerce des débris de noix de palme de la femme est investi dans les besoins de la famille si bien qu’elle ne détient plus aucune capacité d’autofinancement. Elle sollicite ce crédit de $400 en guise de fonds de commerce pour acheter des débris de noix de palme afin de pouvoir rentabiliser effectivement cette activité qu'elle maîtrise bien et subvenir convenablement aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use:
Purchase of palm nut biomass (alternative fuel energy)

Achat de débris de noix de palme

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita, 27, is single and lives with her parents in the village of Tanugamanono, about 30 kilometers from Apia, Samoa.  All of her brothers and sisters have migrated overseas for better employment and education for their children.  Sita has chosen to remain in Samoa to take care of her parents.

She wants to earn enough money to build her parents a new home because they are currently living in an open, non-concrete house with no rooms.  After that, she would like to go back to school so that she can be like her brothers and sisters.

Sita is a very talented and innovative person who uses many different recipes in the making of her taro chips. She is applying for a loan of $875 in order to purchase the supplies necessary to make taro chips and a stove.

She thanks the SPBDF for providing the funds that will enable her to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making taro chips and a stove

loans.name: Françoise

texts.en:
Born on April 2, 1977 in Aného in the county of the Lacs, Miss E. Françoise is single without children. Because of lack of funds, she abandoned her schooling at the secondary level and engaged in the business of selling colorful traditional wrap around fabrics (pagnes). With an enterprising spirit and strong ethics, she manages to turn a profit from her activities.

She is asking today for a first loan of $600 to allow her to establish a permanent stock of pagnes-fabrics to avoid running out of stock. The realization of that project will increase her income and contribute to her empowerment.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 02 avril 1977 à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs, Mademoiselle E. Françoise est célibataire sans enfant. Par manque de moyen, elle a abandonné ses études au cours secondaire et s’est lancée dans le commerce de tissus pagnes. Ayant un esprit d’entreprenariat et dotée d’une bonne moralité, elle arrive à bien rentabiliser ses activités. Elle demande aujourd'hui un premier crédit de $600 qui lui permettra de faire un stock permanent de pagnes afin d’éviter les ruptures de stocks. La réalisation du ce projet augmentera ses revenir en de son épanouissement.

loans.use:
Purchase and sale of traditional wrap around fabrics

Achat et revente de tissus pagnes

loans.name: Soloao

texts.en: Soloao is a retired teacher, aged 66. She’s a strong mother of 14 children, one deceased, 4 living overseas and 9 staying in Samoa. Soloao is a very hard working mother. When she was teaching, she realized that her salary couldn’t provide for all her kids, so she helped out her husband set up a fishing business. She started with a single canoe with just her husband alone. One day she resigned as a teacher because she realized that their business was growing and her husband needed support. From that single canoe, they now own 3 fishing vessels, with 3 employees on each boat. Her business has become really successful, but she still wants to do more. So she’s requesting a $850 loan for upgrading her fishing gear and maintenance of her boats.

loans.use: Buy fishing gear, maintenance of boats

loans.name: Alougba

texts.en:
Born in Atiémé, Mrs. A. Alougba is married and a mother of six (06) children. Very early on her husband lost his job and she had to shoulder all the household responsibilities. Becoming the de facto head of the family she launched herself in looking for firewood from fallen trees to provide for her family’s needs. Avery courageous woman working with stamina and abnegation, she has been able to master and manage her business and she more or less makes it. Mrs. A. Alougba has a vast experience of managing loans, she has already obtained and reimbursed her 3 loans promptly and without incidents.

Today she is soliciting a loan of $800 to promote her business by purchasing and stocking firewood and by paying her woodcutters. This will allow her to increase her income to improve her living conditions and that of her family. The demand for this market is year round.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1956 à Atiémé, Madame A. Alougba est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Très tôt, son mari perd son emploi et toutes les charges du foyer reposent sur elle. Devenue chef de famille par la force des choses, elle se lança dans la recherche de bois de chauffage provenant de l’abattage des arbres qui ne produisent plus afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Femme très courageuse et travaillant avec endurance et abnégation, elle a su bien maîtriser et gérer son commerce par lequel elle s’en sort tant bien que mal. Madame A. Alougba a une large expérience dans la gestion des crédits après ses 3 crédits respectifs obtenus et remboursés promptement sans incidents.

Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $800 pour promouvoir son activité en achetant et stockant des bois et en payant ses ouvriers qui lui fendent le bois. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille. La demande pour ce marché est permanente.

loans.use:
Purchase and stock piling of firewood

Achat et stockage de bois de chauffe

loans.name: Suafai

texts.en: Suafai, 32, is a mother of 2 grown up children. She runs a grocery shop in the village of Matautu-Uta -- about 5 kilometers from the central town of Apia, Samoa. Her husband is unemployed but working in their extended family’s plantation. Suafai is a volunteer member for the Catholic Church, doing community work for people in need. She’s a very Christian lady that loves to lend a helping hand to anyone in need. Even with her shop, she believes that with her good work, it has brought so much success in her business, and also happiness in her family. Suafai’s goal is to become a good model for the other ladies in their village, to become business women to be able to provide their kids with better education.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her retail shop.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Born on August 19 1970 in Glidji in the county of the Lacs, Mrs. E. Jeanne is married and the mother of 2 children, she is also responsible for an additional person. Her principal activity is the trade of hardware merchandise. Thieves have looted her husband, a reseller, so he does not have anything left. Mrs. E. Jeanne is now in the obligation of caring alone for her family.

She is soliciting today a loan of $800 to develop her hardware business. She wishes to rent a small warehouse to maximize her profit and to better provide for her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 19 août 1970 à Glidji dans la préfecture des Lacs, Madame E. Jeanne est mariée et mère de deux enfants et a à sa charge une autre personne. Son activité principale est le commerce des produits de quincaillerie. Son mari un revendeur a été pillé par les voleurs ce qui fait qu’il se retrouve sans rien. Madame E. Jeanne se voit dans l’obligation de s’occuper seule de la famille. Elle sollicite à ce jour un crédit de $800 pour développer son commerce de quincaillerie. Elle désire louer un magasin de stockage afin de réaliser un profit maximum et mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use:
Opening a hardware store

Ouvrir un magasin pour la vente des produits de quincaillerie

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is a widow. She has 4 children, and two of them are going to school. She is educated to level 10 and dropped out of school due to the problem of school fees. She has been in business since 1999, and the business has been able to meet the needs of the family.

With the loan, she wants to diversify so that both of the two businesses can generate income. This will enable her to to maximize on profit which she relies on to take care of the family. She wants to use part of the profits to save in preparation for sending her children to secondary school and part to buy a plot and build a home for herself.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Amélé

texts.en:
51-year-old Mrs.Amélé A. is married and the mother of six (06). Abandoned early by her now deceased husband, she bears all the household responsibilities. She started an onion business to provide for her family‚s needs. A very courageous and dynamic woman, Amélé decided to cultivate onions herself and to sell them to her numerous clients who admire her courage and mostly the quality of her produce. But sufficient financial means are lacking.

Mrs., A. is asking for a loan of $1200 to increase her farming area, to acquire suitable and modern tools and materials: a motorized water pump and fertilizers very necessary to increase her production and to satisfy the ever growing demand currently in the market. This project has all the ingredients to be successful; in particular, the proximity of the lagoon and the sea, the easy access to the site and the availability of current and potential clients.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 51 ans, Madame A. Amélé est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Abandonnée très tôt par son mari défunt, toutes les charges du foyer reposent sur elle. Elle s’est lancée alors dans le commerce d’oignons afin de subvenir aux besoins familiaux. Femme très courageuse et dynamique, elle a décidé de cultiver elle-même les oignons et de les vendre à ses nombreux clients qui admirent sa bravoure et surtout la qualité de ses produits. Mais les moyens financiers suffisant lui manquent cruellement.

Madame A. sollicite un apport financier de $1200 en vue d’agrandir la surface exploitée, acquérir des outils et matériels de travail adéquats et modernes : motopompe et acheter les intrants et autres produits phytosanitaires très indispensables pour accroître la production et satisfaire les demandes sans cesse croissantes actuellement sur le marché. Le présent projet jouit de tous les atouts notamment la proximité de la lagune et de la mer, accessibilité du site et l’existence de clients actuels et potentiels.

loans.use:
Purchase of motorized water pump and various fertilizers

Achat de motopompe et intrants

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
P. Sopha and Sou Saret have been married for seven years. They have two sons, one is five years old and the other is one year old. Nowadays, this couple is running a small business which sells breakfast to students, workers, and people from the neighborhood and they can earn $2.50 per day.

The amount they need to enlarge their business is $1,000, but they have their own capital of $700 already, so they are requesting a loan of $300 to cover the additional costs. After they enlarge the business they hope they will earn $10 per day. After this cycle, P. Sopha and Sou Saret would like to invest more in their business until becomes a good restaurant; they anticipate this will eventually require capital of around $3,000.

loans.use: To enlarge their shop and service

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.en:
Born on July 27, 1972 in Attitogon, Mr. K. Yaovi is married and father to one child. He is a driver by trade. Not having the means to practice in his line of work, he was hired by an import-export company where he worked for 3 years as a commercial representative. Today he manages his own store of traditional wrap around fabrics -pagnes- at the big market in Lomé. The responsibilities for his family (he is also caring for his elderly parents) but mostly the acquisition of his goods at retail prices are costing him a lot and is plunging him further into poverty.

He is requesting a loan of $900 to acquire a new store and to get a stock at wholesale prices -less expensive in Ghana- so he can satisfy his increasing clientele here in Togo and also in Benin. This activity is very profitable and deserves to be financed in order to increase his sales so he can achieve financial autonomy, which will likely change his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 27 Juillet 1972 à Attitogon, Monsieur K. Yaovi est marié et père d’un enfant. Il est chauffeur de profession mais n’ayant pas de moyens pour exercer son métier, il s’est fait engager dans une société import-export où il a eu à travailler 3 ans comme Agent Commercial. Aujourd’hui il gère sa propre boutique de pagnes au grand marché de Lomé. Mais le poids de la famille(ses parents devenus vieux sont à sa charge) et surtout l’achat en détail lui revient très cher et le plonge davantage dans la misère.

Il sollicite un crédit de $900 pour acquérir un nouveau magasin et pour s’approvisionner en gros et donc très moins cher au Ghana afin de satisfaire ses clients qui deviennent de plus en plus nombreux ici au Togo et même au Bénin. Cette activité très rentable mérite d’être financé pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires afin d’atteindre une autonomie financière susceptible de changer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
Renting of a store and wholesale purchase of traditional fabrics -pagnes-

Location de magasin et approvisionnement en pagnes

loans.name: Tala

texts.en: Tala is a 58 year old seamstress, married with 4 kids, 2 working in American Samoa for a fishing company, one locally employed at Aggie Grey Hotel and one finishing school next year.  Tala’s business has provided so much support in her family that she was able to finance her children’s schooling.  Tala will no longer be able to tailor, due to her eye sight. She aims to develop their family plantation because she believes that she’s got the strength together with the husband to work towards achieving and getting good income.

loans.use: To purchase planting materials, fertilizers, chemicals, fungicides

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie D. is married with one child and takes care of another. She was born in 1972 in Asanhoun (in Avé prefecture). Very early on, she started selling charcoal because her husband, a teacher, earns a salary too meager to support the family. Everything rests on her shoulders. Despite her very limited education, she has a talent for managing her business. And so, to boost her business in order to take better care of her family, she is requesting a loan of $800. She can then stock enough charcoal to prevent supply shortages. This will result in worthwhile profits and thus a better future for her family.

Translated from French by David Pigott and Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteers.

Née en 1972 à Asanhoun, dans la préfecture de l’Avé, Madame D. Marie est mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant et a à sa charge une autre personne. Très tôt elle s’est lancée dans la vente du charbon de bois à cause du maigre salaire de son mari enseignant qui n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Tout se repose sur la femme. Malgré son niveau d’étude très bas, elle est douée dans la gestion de ses activités. Ainsi pour renforcer ses activités afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui lui servira de faire un stock consistant afin d’éviter la rupture de stock ce qui rentabilisera son profit en vue d’un meilleur devenir de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase a larger inventory of charcoal for resale during times of scarcity

loans.name: Sokémawu

texts.en:
Sokemawu K. was born on July 2, 1977 in Logowome. He is married and the father of two. Orphaned upon the deaths of his parents, he could not complete the apprenticeship that he had started in auto mechanics. He managed to do all right by using the little savings he had to get his driver’s permit. He also had to work for three years during which he acquired a used car of his own with the help of a loan. The car allowed him to take care of two brothers, as well as his children. The car is totally amortized at this point. And after much maintenance and repair work, it is apparent that a new car is needed. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 as supplemental funds to buy a new car and to revitalize his business. The realization of this project is the only way to achieve the steady revenues needed to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by David Pigott and Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteers.

Marié et père de deux (02) enfants, Monsieur K. Sokémawu est né le 2 Juillet 1977 à Logowomé. Orphelin de père et de mère, il n’a pas pu terminer son apprentissage de mécanique à 4 roues qu’il avait commencé. Il s’est débrouillé avec le peu d’économie pour avoir son permis de conduire et a eu à travailler pendant 3 ans au cours desquelles il a pu bénéficier de crédit pour s’acheter sa propre voiture d’occasion qui permettait de prendre en charge en plus de ses enfants deux frères. Actuellement le véhicule est totalement amorti et après plusieurs entretiens et réparations, l’acquisition d’un nouveau s’impose. Il sollicite alors un crédit de $1200 qui sera un complément de fonds pour acheter une voiture neuve et relancer son activité. C’est seulement à partir de la réalisation de ce projet que la famille de Monsieur K. peut disposer de revenus réguliers et améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: Purchase of a new vehicle

loans.name: Mélanie

texts.en:
Melanie E. was born in Aného on January 4, 1968. She is married, the mother of four, and is responsible for one other person. Not having been fortunate enough to attend school, she entered into the commerce of sacks and bags at the outdoor market in Akodésséwa. With her husband being an unemployed taxi driver, she alone has been taking care of the family for five years. Experienced in commerce, she has done well to extract herself from this problem situation. She is now requesting a loan of $800 as capital to lease a store and to augment her inventory of sacks, so that her family may achieve its potential.

Translated from French by David Pigott and Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteers.

Madame E. Mélanie est née le 04 janvier 1968 à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle a à sa charge une autre personne. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de sac au marché d’Akodésséwa. Avec un mari chauffeur en chômage, elle s’occupe seule de la famille depuis 5 ans. Expérimentée dans le commerce, elle arrive bien à s’en sortir. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui va lui servir de fond de commerce pour louer un magasin et augmenter son stock en sacs en vue de l’épanouissement de la famille.

loans.use: To open a store to sell sacks

loans.name: Messan

texts.en:
In 1968, Messan K. was born into a polygamous family in Anfoin. He is married with two children and takes care of a third. As a merchant at the market in Akodessewa, he is the sole provider of the family since his wife lost the strength to work following a prolonged illness. Mr. K. has taken management training and has expertise in his hardware business. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to take a stronger position in the market by renting a larger retail space and to increase his inventory. By so doing, he will enhance his revenues and improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by David Pigott and Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteers.

Monsieur K. Messan est née en 1968 à Anfoin dans la préfecture des Lacs. Issu d’une famille polygame, il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants et a à sa charge une personne. Commerçant dans le marché d’Akodésséwa. Il est seul à s’occuper de toute de la famille car sa femme a perdu la force de travailler suite à une longue maladie. Ayant suivi une formation en gestion, il a une bonne maîtrise de son commerce des produits de quincaillerie. Il sollicite alors ce crédit de $1000 pour renforcer son activité en louant un magasin plus large et augmenter son stock de marchandises. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus en d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille

loans.use: Sale of hardware goods

loans.name: Marie Jeannette M.

texts.en:
Marie Jeanette Makpowoassinou A., 29, is married, the mother of three children, and guardian of three others from her deceased older brother. She is a hairdresser by profession. Her husband teaches part-time on a farm and makes $20 a month, which barely covers one day of family expenses. Aware of the situation, she began a small business selling beauty products to make ends meet. However, the lack of sufficient means, particularly working capital, poses a serious handicap to her deteriorating finances. And this highly devoted and enterprising woman is becoming poorer and poorer as a result. So she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to grow her shop by paying cash for beauty supplies, a much less costly way to do it. She may also acquire certain tools of the trade, notably two hairdryers. The goal is to open a very modern hair salon of her own. And the loan will help increase her turnover, so that she can provide for her family at all times.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 29 ans, Madame A. Marie Jeannette Makpowoassinou est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants et a à sa charge les trois (03) enfants de son grand frère décédé. Son mari est enseignant volontaire dans une ferme et dont le salaire de $20 par mois, couvre à peine les dépenses d’une journée. Consciente de cet état de chose, Madame A., coiffeuse de formation, s’est lancée dans le petit commerce de produits de beauté afin de joindre les deux bouts. Mais le manque de moyens suffisants surtout le fonds de roulement constitue un handicap sérieux à son décollage économique et accentue la paupérisation de cette dame très dévouée et entreprenante. Aussi, sollicite t-elle un crédit de $1000 pour agrandir sa boutique en payant comptant et donc très moins cher ses produits et à acquérir certains matériels de travail notamment deux séchoirs en vue d’ouvrir son atelier de coiffure très moderne. Ce crédit l’aidera à augmenter son chiffre d’affaires afin de subvenir à tout moment aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase hairdryers and to open a hair salon

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria T. is married with 3 children. Both she  her husband gained good results in school but were unemployed due to high unemployment rates. Both she and the husband struggled to look for opportunities to get some source of income to provide for their needs. Victoria then applied her knowledge of sewing kid’s clothes to get some money, and then managed to join SPBD, that really helped her financially in setting up her business. She’s no longer struggling  but working hard now to keep her business growing. And with her requested loan she wishes to expand her business, and provide quality service to meet the growing demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy a new model of sewing machine to replace her old machine and additional fabrics and materials for sewing

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Têko

texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Anfoin (in Lacs prefecture), Teko A. is married, the father of four children, and is responsible for one other person. As an unemployed accountant, he opened a shop selling frozen foods at the market in Adodessewa. His wife, who does not work, is unable to help him cover any family expenses. He would like to diversify by selling groceries, but he lacks the means. And so he is hoping for a loan of $1,000 to boost his business, to maximize his profit, and thus to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Têko est né en 1965 à Anfoin dans la préfecture des Lacs. Il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants avec une personne à charge. Comptable en chômage, il a ouvert une boutique de vente des produits congelés au marché d’Akodésséwa. Sa femme qui n’exerce aucune activité , n’arrive pas à l’aider dans les charges de la famille. Monsieur A. Têko veut associer la vente des produits d’alimentation générale mais manque de moyens. A cet effet, il souhaite avoir un crédit de $1000 pour le renforcement de ses activités et réaliser un profit maximum pour subvenir au besoin de la famille.

loans.use: Sale of frozen foods and groceries

loans.name: Sassou

texts.en:
A mason by trade, Sassou A. is married and the father of three. He is the eldest of 12 children in a family in which both parents died prematurely. This predicament has forced him to abandon his studies. And having no money, he no longer practices his trade. To meet the needs of his family which weigh heavily on him, he got eight months of formal training in the truck farming sector producing bundles of vegetables for sale at the marketplace. Now, like a bird, he soars on his own. But devastatingly, he lacks the means to promote his business and to turn a profit. And so he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy tubing and the necessary materials for an electrical installation, fertilizer, and other soil and farming supplies likely to make his business worthwhile. The goal is to meet the every-growing demands of his customers and especially to increase his revenues.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Maçon de profession, Monsieur A. Sassou est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Il est l’aîné d’une famille de 12 enfants dont les parents sont décédés très tôt. Cette situation l’a amené à abandonner ses études et à apprendre un métier qu’il n’exerce pas faute de moyen. Pour faire face aux charges de la famille qui pèsent sur lui, il s’est fait former sur le tas en maraîchage pendant 8 mois et aujourd’hui, il vole de ses propres ailes. Mais les moyens lui manquent cruellement pour promouvoir son activité et en tirer profit. Il sollicite alors un crédit de $1000 pour acheter des tuyaux, les matériels nécessaires pour l’installation électrique et des intrants susceptibles de rentabiliser l’activité afin de répondre aux demandes sans cesse croissantes de sa clientèle et surtout pour augmenter ses revenus.

loans.use: To purchase tubing and materials for the installation of electrical improvements for his farm and for soil amendments

loans.name: Vinemoto

texts.en: Vinemoto is a 42 year old mother of 5 children, 3 working and 2 in school.  Her husband works for Samoa National Provident Fund as a driver.  Vinemoto’s business is sewing. It’s her favorite hobby that was taught to her by her mother.  Vinemoto is a brave woman, who has worked for some organizations in the past years.  Vinemoto wasn’t happy about her working life because she knew she had a talent that she needed to shine.  So she resigned 25 years ago and started her own sewing business.  Vinemoto’s talent enabled her to start her business and at the same time build up her skills and talent while earning.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of fabrics, sewing materials and tools for maintaining her sewing machine

loans.name: Etêh

texts.en:
Eteh E. was born in 1981 in Aneho (Lacs District). He is married and has one child and another one he takes care of. Although he is trained in freight logistics, he is currently unemployed. His wife is a stay-at-home mom. Unable to provide for his family anymore, he decided to try selling used cars and mopeds. Accomplishing this goal requires money that he lacks. And so he is requesting an initial loan of $950 to start his business in the port city of Lomé, the capitol of Togo. This loan will also allow him to help his wife with something that will lead to better living conditions for the family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le en 1981 à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs, Monsieur E. Etêh est marié et père d’un enfant avec une personne à charge. Transitaire de formation, il est actuellement sans emploi avec une femme ménagère. N’arrivant plus à s’occuper des besoins de la famille, il a décidé d’entreprendre la vente des voitures et de motos d’occasions. La réalisation de ce projet nécessite assez de moyens dont Monsieur E. Etêh ne dispose pas. Ainsi donc, il sollicite un premier crédit de $950 pour débuter son activité au port de Lomé. Ce crédit lui permettra aussi aider sa femme à faire quelque chose en vue d’une meilleure condition de vie de la famille.

loans.use: Used Car Sales

loans.name: Amidou

texts.en:
Mr. Amidou B. is 46 years old and lives in Agoe-Fiovi where he is active in the commercial sector. He has four children and lots of mouths to feed, given he is from a large family that is very poor. Although trained as an electronics repair technician, he specialized in business right away due to a lack of resources. He has been in business for 16 years. His previous loans were wisely employed and have been repaid. But we must take note that, times as they are, he cannot make ends meet for his family. To do so, he is requesting a new loan in the amount of $950 to bolster his business by making volume purchases at a much lower price.

Translated from French by David Pigott and Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteers.

Monsieur B. Amidou a 46 ans et vit actuellement à Agoè-Fiovi ou il exerce dans le secteur commercial. Père de quatre (04) enfants, il a beaucoup de bouches à nourrir étant donné qu’il est issu d’une famille large et très pauvre. Technicien de maintenance et électronicien de profession, Monsieur B. s’est très tôt spécialisé dans le commerce faute de moyens pour une fonction qu’il exerce depuis 16 ans. Les prêts antérieurs reçus sont utilisés à bon escient et sont remboursés. Mais force est de constater que les revenus de ce dernier ne lui permettent pas de subvenir totalement aux besoins de sa famille. Pour ce faire, il sollicite à nouveau un crédit de $950 pour renforcer ses activités en achetant en gros les articles.

loans.use: To bolster his business

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.en:
Ayoko A. was born in 1977 and lives in Atchamé. She is married, the mother of two, and is also responsible for her brothers and sisters. And since her husband does not work, she is essentially the head of household. The principal source of Ms. A.'s income derives from making coconut oil out of coconuts. It must be said that the meager income from this business is not enough to support her household. Her previous loans have allowed her to see some progress and have indeed been repaid.

To reinvigorate her business, she is asking for a loan of $650 to stock up on firewood and coconuts. She would also like to buy a cart for transporting the coconuts. This will augment her production in hopes of increasing her revenues.

Translated from French by David Pigott and Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteers.

Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, Madame A. Ayoko est née en 1977 et est domiciliée a Atchamé. Elle a également ses frères et sœurs en charge et joue pratiquement le rôle de chef de ménage, le mari étant sans activité. La transformation des noix de coco en huile de coco constitue son activité principale d’où elle tire son revenu. Il faut dire que cette activité ne lui permet pas avec le revenu maigre qu’elle en tire, de supporter toutes ses charges. Les crédits antérieurs lui ont permis de réaliser des progrès et ont été bien soldés.

Pour redynamiser ses activités, elle sollicite $650 pour s’approvisionner en bois de chauffe, en noix de coco et pour acheter un pousse-pousse pouvant lui permettre de transporter les noix de coco. Ceci augmentera sa production en vu d’accroître son revenu.

loans.use: To stock firewood and coconuts and to buy a cart

loans.name: Bruno

texts.en:
Bruno S. was born in Cotonou, Republic of Bénin, on October 6, 1984. He is single and has no children. Having no money, he left secondary school and apprenticed for three years to learn haircutting. When finished, he wanted to open a barber shop but lacked financial means. As a very intelligent and polite man, he has quickly won the trust of his community.

And so he is requesting a loan of $600 for leasing and outfitting his shop and for buying certain supplies and very useful tools of the trade. Accomplishing these goals will improve his living conditions and ensure a degree of financial independence.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 06 octobre 1984 à Cotonou en république du BENIN, Monsieur S. Bruno est célibataire sans enfant. Par manque de moyen, il a abandonné les études secondaires pour se lancer dans l’apprentissage de la coiffure pour homme pendant trois ans. A la fin de l’apprentissage, il désir ouvrir son atelier mais manque de moyens financiers. Très intelligent et poli, il a vite gagné la confiance dans habitants de sa localité.

Ainsi, il sollicite un crédit de $600 qui va lui permettre de louer et d’aménager son atelier et d'acheter certains matériels de coiffure très utiles. La réalisation de ce projet améliorera ses conditions de vie et lui assurera une autonomie financière.

loans.use: To lease a place for his shop and to buy barbershop supplies and tools

loans.name: Tohossoussi

texts.en:
Tohossoussi G. is married and the mother of six. She was born in Agbanakin in 1939 and currently lives in the village of Atchamé (in Les Lacs prefecture). Her main income-generating business is now commerce in the palm oil that she produces. It should be noted that this is a very involved and difficult business that requires a lot financial resources and hard work. She must provide for her family with the meager income from it.

Concerned with pursuing progress, and to increase her production, she is requesting a loan of $650 to go towards building a major inventory of palm nuts and firewood. This project will allow her a degree of financial independence and will set an example for her community.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée et mère de six (06) enfants, Madame G. Tohossoussi est née en 1939 à Agbanakin et vit actuellement dans le village d’Atchamé dans la préfecture des lacs. Sa principale activité génératrice de revenu reste le commerce d’huile de palme qu’elle produit. Il faut noter que c’est une activité très pénible qui nécessite beaucoup de moyens financiers et de mains d’œuvres. C’est avec le maigre revenu qu’elle tire de cette activité, qu’elle doit subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

Dans le souci de poursuivre cette avancée et accroître sa production, elle sollicite un montant de $650 destinés à disposer d’un stock important de noix de palme et du bois. Ce projet lui confèrera une autonomie financière et sera une référence dans sa communauté.

loans.use: Stocking palm nuts and firewood for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Edoh

texts.en:
Edoh A. was born in Agbodrafo (in Les Lacs prefecture) on November 22, 1982. He is single with no children. He left school because of frequent headaches that prevented him from studying. So he entered an apprenticeship for cutting hair in order to support himself. He is a master barber, and as a result, he is renowned in his neighborhood. Parents want to send their children to him as apprentices, but he does not have a shop in which to teach them. He therefore is requesting a loan of $600 to open his own shop and to buy certain indispensable supplies and tools of the trade. He can then get a start in his business. Once his plan is realized, he will be financially independent.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 22 novembre 1982 à Agbodrafo dans la préfecture des Lacs, Monsieur A. Edoh est célibataire sans enfant. Abandonnant ses études suite à de fréquents maux de tête qui l’empêche d’étudier, il se lance dans l’apprentissage de la coiffure pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins. Il a une maîtrise totale de son métier, ce qui lui confère une bonne renommé dans son quartier. D’autres parents veulent envoyer leurs enfants en apprentissage chez lui mais il n’a pas un atelier.

Alors, il sollicite un crédit de $600 pour l’ouverture de son atelier et l’achat de certains matériels de travail très indispensables pour le démarrage de son activité. Avec la réalisation de ce projet, il aura une autonomie financière.

loans.use: To open a barber shop and to buy barber supplies

loans.name: Améyo Reine

texts.en:
Améyo Reine A. is a young woman of 34 and works as a merchant in the village of Agbanakin in Les Lacs prefecture. As a mother of three children, she also covers most of the family expenses; her husband is unemployed. Various grocery items compose the majority of goods she offers in the open-air display she has set up. It must be emphasized that the income derive from this business is directly used to cover daily expenses, making it difficult to save any money. In order to build a shed for protecting her display of goods, to increase customer orders, and to boost her sales, she is requesting a loan of $750.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Jeune femme de 34 ans, Madame A. Améyo Reine est commerçante dans le village d’Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs. Mère de trois (03) enfants, elle supporte la plus grande partie des charges de sa famille ; son mari étant sans emploi. Les produits d’alimentation générale et divers sont les principaux constituants de son étalage dressé à ciel ouvert. Il faut souligner que le revenu tiré de ce commerce est directement investi dans la consommation quotidienne, ce qui rend difficile l’épargne. Afin de construire un hangar pour abriter son étalage et augmenter ses commandes afin accroître son chiffre d’affaire, elle sollicite une somme de $750.

loans.use: To build a shed to protect her display of goods for sale and to boost customer orders

loans.name: Dossou

texts.en:
Dossou H. was born on October 20, 1985 in Agbodrafo (in Lacs prefecture). He was orphaned very early on when his father died, so he had to leave school for an apprenticeship at his uncle’s place, where he learned how to cut hair. As a single man with no children, he lacks the means to open his own shop. This is because he works much like a laborer for his uncle, who exploits him.

To remedy the situation, he is hoping for a loan of $600, which will allow him to open a modern barber shop and to buy certain indispensable supplies to get his business going. The realization of his dream will help improve his life.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur H. Dossou est né le 20 octobre 1985 à Agbodrafo dans la préfecture des Lacs. Très tôt orphelin de père, il a du abandonner ses études pour l’apprentissage de la coiffure chez son oncle. Célibataire sans enfant il manque de moyens pour ouvrir son propre atelier car il travail comme ouvrier chez son oncle qui l’exploite.

Il souhaite pour cela un appui financier de $600, qui va lui permettre d’ouvrir un atelier moderne et d’acheter certains matériels très indispensables pour le démarrage du métier. La réalisation de se rêve contribuera à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To open a modern barber shop and to acquire supplies and tools of the trade

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her grocery shop business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her milk selling business.

loans.name: Lako

texts.en:
Ms. Lako Y., age 78, lives a life of subsistence ranching, raising a few heads of sheep and pigs in the village of Atchamé. The purely heirloom livestock can be vulnerable to disease. She is compelled to run her business herself to survive because there is nobody to take care of her. She must reorganize her livestock business while taking into account veterinary care. Then she may receive a good return on her investments and thus increase her income.

And so Ms. Y. is requesting a loan of $850 as backing that is as much financial support as it is technical. We must remember that she repaid her previous loans without any problems. The loan will serve to construct an enclosure to keep the livestock, to equip the enclosure, and to buy new livestock. The funds will also ensure regular veterinary care, so that the animals may be raised in a healthful environment. All of this will provide her with regular income.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 78 ans, Madame Y. Lako vit d’un élevage de subsistance dans le village d’Atchamé. Composé de quelques têtes de moutons et de porcs, le cheptel est purement traditionnel et vulnérable aux risques de maladies (pestes). Obligée de mener cette activité pour survivre parce que n’ayant personne pour la prendre en charge, elle doit réorganiser son cheptel en tenant compte des traitements vétérinaires afin d’avoir un bon rendement pour améliorer son revenu.

Dès lors, elle sollicite une somme de $850 pour son appui tant financier que technique. Il faut rappeler que les crédits antérieurs ont été déjà soldés sans incidents. Les fonds seront servis à construire un enclos, à l’équiper et à acheter de novelles têtes de bétails et à assurer les soins vétérinaires régulièrement afin que les animaux puissent se développer dans un environnement sain et procurer à Madame Y. des revenus réguliers.

loans.use: To construct a livestock pen, to buy new livestock, and to ensure regular veterinary care

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her spinning and knitting shop.

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.en:
Adjoavi A. is 30, single, and lives in the Djamadji sector in Aného. She come from a poor family, and being the oldest daughter, she has several mouths to feed. She is a seamstress by training; but realizing that the demand for sewing and dressmaking is only profitable during holiday periods, she decided to switch to modest commercial activities. She has been a merchant of ice water for two years as her principal business, which does not quite generate enough income. Using the daily «tontine» system (a kind of group savings/investment fund), she was able to secure loans, which have already been repaid.
