Concerned about meeting the growing demand for ice water, Ms. A. is requesting a loan of $850 to buy a freezer, some coolers, and to establish working capital. With this financing, she will also diversify her business by producing fruit juice and by opening an eatery in order to cover expenses. Thus, she can derive substantial income to address her own needs and those of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Célibataire de 30 ans, Mlle A. Adjoavi est domiciliée dans le quartier Djamadji à Aného. Issue d’une famille pauvre, elle a plusieurs bouches à nourrir étant la fille aînée. Elle est couturière de formation ; mais ayant réalisé que cette activité n’est rentable qu’en période de fête, elle a décidé de se lancer dans le petit commerce ; ce qu’elle fait depuis 2 ans. La vente d’eau glacée est son activité principale qu lui génère des revenus quoique insuffisants. Avec le système d’épargne par la tontine journalière, elle a pu obtenir des crédits qu’elle a déjà soldés.

Dans le souci de satisfaire la demande en eau glacée qui devient de plus en plus forte, elle demande un crédit de $850 pour acheter un congélateur, des glacières et se constituer un fond de roulement. Avec ce financement, Mlle A. aura à diversifier son activité en produisant des jus de fruits et ouvrir un mini restaurant afin de couvrir les demandes et tirer des revenus substantiels pour faire face à ses propres besoins et ceux de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and coolers and also to open an eatery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en:
Adjo S., née DANDO, was born on May 10, 1970 in the Republic of Bénin. She has been residing in Gapé-Centre for twenty years and is the mother of five. She had married a poor, polygamous peasant who is recently deceased. To address the basic needs of these children left abandoned for her alone to support, she went into business selling fried fish. This woman lives a life of extreme poverty, but she really devotes herself to small-scale commercial activities in order to pay for schooling for her children. She has already benefited from an initial loan that has been repaid.

As a moral woman with a will to succeed, she is submitting an application for a $700 loan, so that she can meet the demands of her customers. This loan is her only chance of success that will allow her to take care of herself financially.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame S. Adjo née DANDO est née le 10 mai 1970 en République du Bénin et réside actuellement à Gapé-Centre depuis plus de vingt ans. C’est une femme mère de cinq (05) enfants et mariée à un pauvre paysan polygame décédé il y a peu. Pour faire face aux besoins primaires de ses enfants abandonnés à elle seule et sans aucun soutien, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de poissons frits. C’est une femme qui vit dans une extrême pauvreté, mais se dévoue beaucoup pour faire de petits commerces afin de pouvoir payer la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle a déjà bénéficié d’un premier financement qui fut remboursé.

Vu sa bonne moralité et sa volonté de réussir et de satisfaire sa clientèle, elle soumet un dossier de crédit de $700, seule possibilité de réussite lui permettant de s’auto prendre en charge financièrement.

loans.use: Selling fried fish

loans.name: Gbogossi

texts.en:
Gbogossi A. is a specialist in producing and selling palm oil. She was born in 1959 and lives in an extended family. Besides her five children that she supports, there are several people under her care and responsibility. So she feels she needs financial support in the amount of $650 to acquire sacks of palm nuts and firewood. This will revitalize a business that she has been running for 20 years. She has been successful due to her long experience in her field of endeavor. The loan will allow her to be better organized and to meet strong customer demand by augmenting her production of palm oil, as well as augmenting her revenues. She can then help maintain herself in her community, avoid loan sharks, and provide for her children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Spécialiste dans la production et la commercialisation d’huile de palme, Madame A. Gbogossi est née en 1959 et vit avec une famille élargie. En dehors de ses cinq (05) enfants qu’elle supporte, nombreuses sont les personnes qui constituent pour elle une charge. Ainsi, elle ressent la nécessité d’avoir un appui financier de $650 pour acheter des sacs de noix de palmes et des bois de chauffe pouvant la relancer dans son activité qu’elle mène depuis 20 ans. Les expériences qu’elle a eu à faire déjà dans ce domaine ont été fructueuses. Ce crédit lui permettra de mieux s’organiser et de répondre à la forte demande en augmentant sa production d’huile et en augmentant ses revenus pouvant l’aider à s’affirmer dans sa communauté, à éviter les usuriers et à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Damaris would like to buy a dairy cow to increase her milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her small business in Kibera, Africa's largest slum

loans.name: Komlan

texts.en:
Komlan A. was born in Gapé-Centre on December 27, 1969. After finishing primary school, he entered an apprenticeship to get training in electronics. He is now practicing his trade as a radio repairman and is very active in it. He currently runs his own electronic technician’s shop but with all kinds of challenges despite the micro-loans he has gotten. He received four such loans that have all been repaid. As a father, he sets a fine example, enjoying the respect of his friends, neighbors, and family members alike. And that inspires more confidence. Now, for him to acquire new radio parts for sale to customers, he is requesting a loan of $800. He can then improve his family living conditions and his economic situation.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Komlan est né le 27 décembre 1969 à Gapé Centre. Après ses études primaires, il entre en apprentissage pour se former en électronique. Il exerce actuellement le métier de réparateur de radio et est aussi un membre très actif dans son activité. Il gère actuellement son atelier d’électronicien avec toutes les difficultés du monde, malgré les petits financements reçus. Il a reçu quatre (04) financements qui ont été remboursés. Père de famille, sa conduite exemplaire et le respect dont il jouit au sein de sa famille et de ses proches inspirent plus de confiance. Pour s’acheter de nouvelles pièces de radio qu’il revendra à ses clients, il sollicite un montant de $800 qui l’aidera à améliorer ses conditions de vie sur le plan économique et familial.

loans.use: Commerce in spare parts for household electronics

loans.name: Dédé

texts.en:
Dédé A. was born in 1954 in Togba (in Lacs prefecture). She currently resides in Atchamé, where her business activity has been selling foodstuff and other provisions for 15 years. She is married and takes care of eight people. And so, because she is faced with continuously growing demands, a shake-up of things and the introduction of change are turning out to be what is required. She can then maintain a steady customer base. This will allow her to fulfill her role as a mother to her family.

Aware of the requirements of her business, Ms. A. is requesting a loan of $750, which is necessary and useful for her to carry out her project (to construct and equip a shed). An arrangement such as this, outfitted and secure, will attract many potential, as well as current, customers. She can then increase her sales, which will lead to financial independence for her.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1954 à Togba dans la préfecture des Lacs, Madame A. Dédé est aujourd’hui domiciliée à Atchamé où elle exerce comme activité la vente des denrées depuis 15 ans. Elle est mariée et a en charge huit (08) personnes. Ainsi, face à une demande sans cesse croissante, la réorganisation du cadre avec des innovations s’avère indispensable afin de maintenir une constante clientèle lui permettant de jouer pleinement son rôle de mère de famille

Consciente des exigence de cette activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $750 qui lui sera nécessaire et utile pour réaliser ce dessein (construction et équipement de hangar). Ce cadre aménagé et sécurisé attirera beaucoup de clients actuels et potentiels permettant à Madame A. d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire débouchant sur son autonomie financière.

loans.use: To build and equip a shed

loans.name: Sehonou

texts.en:
Sehonou A. was born on April 17, 1966, in the Republic of Bénin. He currently resides in Gapé-Centre, and has been there for 17 years. He has eight children to take care of in his family. Because he lives in extreme poverty, he often turns to money-lenders in the Gapé area who charge exorbitant rates. He uses these loans to stock his grocery store.

And so, weary of working for loan-sharks and not wanting to walk that path anymore, he is requesting a loan of $700 that he could repay, given his sound management and enormous experience acquired in commerce.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Sehonou est né le 17 avril 1966 en République du Bénin et est actuellement à Gapé Centre depuis dix sept ans. Il est père de famille de huit (08) enfants qui sont à sa charge. Vivant dans une extrême pauvreté, il fait souvent recours aux usuriers dans la localité de Gapé avec des intérêts très exorbitants pour approvisionner sa boutique d'alimentation générale.

Lassé de travailler pour les usuriers et ne voulant plus faire chemin avec ceux-ci, il sollicite un prêt de $700 qu’il pourrait remboursé grâce à sa gestion saine et l’expérience énorme qu’il a acquis dans le domaine commercial.

loans.use: To stock his grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan would like to increase her business so that she may pay school fees for her child in secondary school

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary started her business in 1990 with $150. She is a widow and has four children going to school. The business has enabled her to take care of the family as a single mother.

With the loan, Rosemary wants to expand her business and diversify so that she can attract a variety of clients with a variety of needs. This will enable her to open additional channels of income to complement the clothing business.

She will use the profits from her business to educate her children, pay medical expenses in times of sickness, and save for buying a plot.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock for her business

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Kossi A. is 39 years old and lives in Gapé-Nyita, in Zio prefecture. He is married and the father of 12 children, who are all facing a hard life. The initial loan he received was for raising livestock, which in turn allows him to keep his children in school. The loan was repaid with no particular problems. He makes a good livestock farmer because he is a good manager and he works on maintaining his corral every day.

He is requesting a new loan of $500 to buy feed for his livestock. We think that once he receives financing, he can make his livestock holdings profitable but especially find his way out of poverty.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Kossi âgé de 39 ans vit à Gapé- Nyita dans la préfecture du Zio. Il est marié et père de douze enfants qui sont tous en situation difficile. Son premier crédit reçu pour faire de l’élevage afin de pouvoir scolariser ses enfants fut remboursé sans aucun problème particulier. La bonne gestion et l’entretien qu’il fait chaque jour pour son enclos fait de lui un excellent éleveur.

Il sollicite un nouveau crédit de $500 pour l’achat de nourritures pour ses bêtes. Nous pensons qu’en recevant ce financement, cela va lui permettre de rentabiliser son élevage et surtout sortir de sa misère.

loans.use: To buy feed for his livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her small business in Kibera slums.

loans.name: Houévi

texts.en:
Houévi F. was born in 1934 and now lives in the village of Atchamé. She has seven people to look after, all by herself. She has been a specialist in the weaving and marketing of mats, a business of hers for 20 years. It however does not manage to cover the basic needs of her family. This devoted woman has been trying to build a financial base through micro-loans, which have been beneficial and which she repays by the expected due date.

Concerned about resolving this problem and to increase her production of mats, she is asking for a loan of $800 to buy large quantities of raw materials while plentiful. The success of his project will allow her to weave and sell mats full-time. She can then augment her income and provide for her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1934, Madame F. Houévi vit aujourd’hui dans le village d’Atchamé avec sept (07) personnes en sa seule charge. Spécialiste dans le tressage et la vente des nattes, elle vit de cette activité depuis 20 ans et dont les revenus n'arrive pas à couvrir tous ses besoins élémentaires et ceux de sa famille. Cette dame dévouée tente de se constituer un fond de base à travers les petits crédits dont elle bénéficie et qu’elle rembourse dans les délais requis. Cette entreprise manque de matériels et de mains d’œuvres.

Dans le souci de résoudre ce problème et pour accroître la production des nattes, elle demande un crédit de $800 qui va lui servir à acheter les matières premières en grande quantité en cette période d’abondance. La réussite de ce projet lui permettra de tresser et de vendre en temps plein et d’augmenter son revenu pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy raw materials (for weaving)

loans.name: Félicia

texts.en:
Félicia D. was born on April 14, 1967 in Gapé-Nyita (in Zio prefecture), a village located 6 km from Gapé-Centre. She is married and the mother of seven children, who depend on her entirely. Her husband is unemployed and has absolutely no financial resources. Ms. D. raises goats and sheep that are free-ranging in the village, and so the animals roam unrestrained at the risk of being injured or lost. For the purposes of constructing a new corral to better watch over the animals, she has resorted to borrowing $500. Since she seems to be a moral person with an attitude of a good livestock breeder, she would be able to repay her loan easily.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame D. Félicia est née le 14 avril 1967 à Gapé- Nyita dans le Zio, village distant de six kilomètres de Gapé-Centre. Elle est mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants qui sont à sa charge. Son mari est sans emploi et n’a aucun moyen financier. Son élevage des chèvres et de moutons se fait à l’air libre dans le village et les bêtes errent librement avec pour conséquence des dégâts et pertes. En vue de construire un nouvel enclos pour pouvoir mieux surveiller ses bêtes, elle fait recours à un prêt de $500. Présentant une bonne moralité et une attitude d’un bon éleveur, elle pourrait rembourser facilement son crédit.

loans.use: To build a pen to raise goats and sheep

loans.name: Zinab

texts.en: Zinab is 29 years old and a single mother with 1 child. She operates a popular food joint on the main bypass which links the metropolis with the interior parts of the distict. The spot is highly patronised by the middle and upper classes of the city. She is also a beneficiary of the TEACH sessions provided by KRABAN to its clients to improve their business operations. She is therefore seeking KIVA'S support to improve the quality of service to her clients.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Gérard Kouassi

texts.en:
Mr. Gerard Kouassi A. is 44 years old & lives in Agbanakin in the Lake District of Togo. He is head of a family of more than six. He makes his money principally from traditional farming techniques which he does with simple tools such as hoes and scythes. The size of his plot and the number of persons he cares for require him to expand and modernize in order to increase profitability. At present this is nearly impossible with the scant resources he has received over the last 15 years. He is asking for a loan of $1000 which will allow him to acquire young sugar cane stalks, to buy new tools (boots, wheelbarrow, and a canoe which will enable him to better access his land.

Agé de 44 ans et domicilié à Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs, Monsieur A. Gérard Kouassi est un père de famille ayant plus de six (06) personnes en charge. Il tire principalement son revenu de l’agriculture traditionnelle qu’il pratique avec des outils rudimentaires comme la houe et le coupe-coupe. La taille de son ménage et le nombre de personnes qu’il a en charge exigent de lui la nécessiter d’agrandir et de moderniser son exploitation en vue d’une meilleure rentabilité. Ceci est quasi-impossible avec le faible revenu qu’il tire de son activité depuis 15 ans. Ainsi, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui peut lui permettre d’acquérir de jeunes plans de cannes à sucre, d’acheter des matériels de travail : bottes, pousse-pousse et une pirogue. Ceci fera de lui le leader incontesté de la localité.

loans.use: Acquisition of young sugar cane plants & purchase of working material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tabitha Wanjiku would like to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Mansan

texts.en:
Madame G. Mansan is 36 years old, wife and mother of three children. She has learned through the help of an NGO that provided aid in her area, to make "Pommades Salicyclees" (Medicinal ointments), which are very popular with the local population. This activity has generated good profits which have been used for transport costs and to purchase new material to make her product. To balance this, she received a previous loan which was repaid without any problems. She is now asking for a new loan of $800.00 which will allow her to open her own store and to make her product more easily.Her own living conditions wil gradually change if her request for a loan is accepted.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Madame G. Mansan, âgée de 36 ans, est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle a appris à travers l’initiative d’une ONG de développement intervenant dans la localité à fabriquer des « Pommades Salicylées » qui intéressent vraiment la population locale. Cette activité lui génère beaucoup de profits qui sont finalement consommées par les frais de transport pour l’achat de nouveaux produits pour la fabrication. Pour remédier à cet état de chose, elle a reçu un premier crédit qui fut remboursé sans trop de difficulté. Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $800 lui permettant d’ouvrir sa propre boutique de ses produits et d’en fabriquer facilement. Ses conditions de vie pourraient changer progressivement si la demande de ce nouveau crédit est acceptée.

loans.use: To open a store to sell ointments (medicinal products)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Nyambura would like to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Mansah

texts.en:
Madame B. Mansah was born December 31, 1966 at Gape-Centre. She is the manager of "Foufou Bar" across from the market of Gape-Centre. She is married and mother of six children. She wishes to refurbish her building and restauraunt in order to satisy client demands which have grown incessantly, and to do this she is asking for a loan of $700.00. She is loyal and honest in her re-payments. She deserves our encouragement as well as financial support.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame B. Mansah est née le 31 décembre 1966 à Gapé-Centre. Elle est tenancière de « Foufou Bar » en face du marché de Gapé-Centre. Elle est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Afin d’aménager son local et son restaurant afin de satisfaire les besoins sans cesse croissant de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de $700. Elle est très dévouée et honnête en matière de remboursements. Elle mérite donc nos encouragements et surtout un appui financier.

loans.use: To refurbish her bar and to build up business funds.

loans.name: Démihindo

texts.en:
Born in 1967 and mother of seven children, Madame A. Demihindo also cares for her parents. For more than 10 years, she has worked in the sales of corn-balls (pasta) with different sauces. This activity has created an income that is not enough to support the needs of her family. Everything is used for daily food. The previous received and re-paid loans have enable her to better organize and to save. In order to have a consistant funds, she is asking for a loan of $750.00. This sum will allow her to stock primary food goods which she will use at the right moment to better serve her clients and to increase her earnings even if it is only by a little.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1967 et mère de sept (07) enfants, Madame A. Démihindo a à sa charge ses parents. Depuis plus de 10 ans, elle exerce comme activité la vente des boules de maïs (pâte) avec différentes sauces. Cette activité lui génère des revenus qui ne suffisent pas à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Ainsi dit, tout rentre dans la consommation quotidienne. Les crédits précédemment reçus et remboursés lui ont permis de mieux s’organiser et d’épargner. Afin d’avoir un fond de roulement consistant pour se relancer, elle sollicite un montant de $750. Cette somme lui permettra aussi de faire des stocks en matières premières alimentaires qu’elle va utiliser au moment opportun et de réhabiliter le cadre de travail pour mieux servir les clients et accroître ses revenus jusqu’ici très maigres.

loans.use: To stock primary food materials.

loans.name: Abra

texts.en:
S. Abra, born December 31 1970 in the Republic of Benin, has lived in Gape-Centre for 15 years. Her commercial activity is primarily the preparation and the sales of a corn based pasta formed in balls commonly called "Akpan." She is married and the mother of seven children, all attending school. The demand from her clientel has increased and has obliged her to ask for her first loan of $300.00 which was re-paid ahead of the deadline. She is asking for a new loan of $600.00 to expand her business and to stock goods to avoid paying for them on credit and to re-pay for them after sales. She is also an active member of a woman's group in the village. If her request is accepted, it will allow her to improve her socio-economic conditions.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

S. Abra, née le 31 décembre 1970 en République du Bénin, elle vit à Gapé-Centre depuis quinze ans. Son activité commerciale repose essentiellement sur la préparation et la vente d’une pâte de maïs en boules appelée communément « AKPAN ». Elle est mariée, mère de sept (07) enfants tous scolarisés. La demande accrue de sa clientèle l’a obligé à bénéficier d’un premier crédit de $300 qui a été bien remboursé avant l’échéance. Elle sollicite à nouveau un financement de $600 pour créer d’autres points de restauration et constituer un stock de marchandises afin d’éviter l’achat à crédit et les rembourser aux fournisseurs aussitôt après vente. Elle est aussi un membre actif d’un groupement de femmes dans le village. Cette demande, si elle est acceptée, lui permettrait d’améliorer ses conditions de vie socio économiques.

loans.use: To stock corn and other primary goods to make Akpan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy Muthoni would like to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en:
At 52, Madame A. Kayi is married and caretaker for six people. Her principle economic activity is the production of coconut oil which she then sells. This activity could be more competitive if she had more modern equipement. The previous loans she has received have allowed her to organise a little. However, currently, it is clear that there is much to be done to organize and and collect nuts, the production and sales which attempt to satisfy the local market are ever under growing demand. In order to have a more constant source of funds, she is asking for a loan of $750.00. This sum will allow her to buy a rickshaw to transport nuts and coconuts. This will allow her to increaser her profits and to adequately suppport her family's needs.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agée de 52 ans, Madame A. Kayi est mariée et a à sa charge six (06) personnes. Sa principale activité génératrice de revenu est la production d’huile de coco qu’elle commercialise. Cette activité pouvait être beaucoup plus compétitive si elle est équipée de matériels adéquats et modernes. Les crédits antérieurs qu’elle a reçus lui ont permis de s’organiser un tout petit peu. Mais aujourd’hui, il est clair que beaucoup reste à faire pour organiser la collecte des noix, la transformation et la commercialisation en vue de satisfaire un marché local de plus en plus exigeant et dont la demande est très forte. Pour se constituer un fond de roulement un peu consistant, elle sollicite une somme de $750. Ledit crédit servira à acheter un pousse-pousse pour le transport des noix et une cocoteraie. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin de subvenir adéquatement aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase a rickshaw to transport nuts and coconuts and working materials.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a young woman of 23 years. She is a single mother with one child. As a school drop-out, she took to trading. With the support of her mother, she went into the sale of yams. She has set up her store at Kwesimintim, a major suburb of the city. Sales are very encouraging and the potential for increased sales is good.

At present, Regina's supplies come from wholesalers who give her the foodstuffs on a credit basis. As a graduate of the TEACH sessions from KRABAN, she is now poised to take her business to a new level. She intends to use the loan to pay off her suppliers when they come, rather than buying on credit. This, she believes, can increase her bargaining power.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Amélevi

texts.en:
At 25, Madame A. Amelevi lives in Tabligbo in the region of Yoto. She is married and mother of three children, and the caretaker of five people. Her principle economic activity is the production and sales of bread. To increase her production and her profits, she is asking for a loan of %500.00. This loan will allow her to increase her production of bread and therefore increase her profits which will lead to improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agée de 25 ans, Madame A. Amélevi vit à Tabligbo dans la préfecture de Yoto. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants avec cinq (05) personnes a charge. Son activité principale est la fabrication et la vente du pain. Pour augmenter sa capacité de production et accroître la rentabilité de son activité, elle sollicite une aide financière de $500 sous forme de crédit. Ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter sa capacité de production de pain afin d’accroître ses revenus pour une bonne amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Stock wheat-flour for the production of bread.

loans.name: Kokou Améto

texts.en:
Well known for the quality of his palm oil, Mr.D. Kokou Améto was born in 1975 in Agomé-Glozou where he still resides. Married and father to four (04) children, he is practicing this activity, which he inherited from his mother fifteen years ago. He gained tremendous experience from his practice. The income from the production of palm oil, even meager, allows him to care for his family’s needs.

Today he is overwhelmed by the market’s demand because he lacks the financial means. He is requesting a loan of $750 to buy tons of palm nuts to produce oil. This will improve the living conditions of his whole family and will help Mr. D. to better save and obtain a regular income.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Reconnu pour la qualité de son huile de palme, Monsieur D. Kokou Améto est né en 1975 à Agomé-Glozou où il réside encore. Marié et père de quatre (04) enfants, il exerce cette activité qu’il a héritée de sa mère depuis une quinzaine d’années. Aujourd’hui, cette durée lui confère de l’expérience. Les revenus tirés de la production de l’huile de palme quand bien même maigre lui sert à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

Aujourd’hui excédé par la demande sur le marché faute de moyens financier, il sollicite cet apport financier de $750 pour acheter des tonnes de noix de palme afin de produire plus d'huile. Ceci pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de toute la famille et aidera Monsieur D. à mieux épargner et avoir de revenus réguliers.

loans.use:
Purchase of tons of palm nuts and tools for his trade

Achat des tonnes de noix de palme et des matériels de travail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Winnie Wanjira Njoroge would like to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Mr. S. Komi, born on January 23 1980 in AFAGNA in the Vo, is a good-natured person, hard working and full of talents. He is married and father of one (01) child and is responsible for five (05) persons. He is a barber and a repairman for mobile phones. After abandoning his secondary education because of lack of funds, he tried several commercial activities before settling in hairdressing. He then specialized in repairing cellular phones.

He would like to sell mobile phones and accessories, but lacking the funds he is requesting a financial help of $800 to realize this project. This loan would first let him achieve his dreams and allow him to make a profit likely to get him out of poverty.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Komi, né le 23 janvier 1980 à AFAGNA dans le Vo est une personne aimable, travailleur et plein de talent. Il est marié et père d’un enfant avec cinq (05) personnes à charge. C’est un coiffeur et réparateur de portable. Après avoir laissé ses études secondaires pour faute de moyens, il a entrepris plusieurs activités commerciales avant de se stabiliser dans la coiffure, puis après s’est spécialisé dans la réparation de postes cellulaires.

Il compte vendre des portables et des accessoires, mais faute de moyens, il sollicite une aide financière de $800 afin pouvoir réaliser le projet qu’il veut mener. Ce crédit demandé va lui permettre d’abord de réaliser ses rêves et de faire des bénéfices susceptibles de le sortir de la pauvreté.

loans.use:
Sales of mobile phones and accessories

Vente de téléphones portables et accessoires

loans.name: Laté

texts.en:
Born in Aného in 1975, Mr. L. Laté is married and the father of two (02) children. With his secondary education level he has been developing his business for ten years in Afagnan where he resides. The sale of kerosene remains his principal activity. Today Mr. L. Laté holds an enormous experience in the kerosene business. His first loan, which was repaid on time, allowed him to start up his activity in a place where there was no point of sale.

Facing a strong demand, he is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a kerosene storage tank and will retail the kerosene in small units. From this business Mr. L. Laté will be able to make a better income and will improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à Aného en 1975, Monsieur L. Laté est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Avec son niveau d'instruction secondaire, il développe ses affaires depuis une dizaine d’années à Afagnan où il réside. La vente du pétrole reste son activité principale. Aujourd’hui, Monsieur L. Laté possède une énorme expérience dans la vente du pétrole. Son premier crédit qui a été bien soldé, lui a permis de démarrer son activité dans un milieu où il n’y a aucune station de vente.

Face à la forte demande, il sollicite un crédit de $800 pour acheter une citerne de pétrole et la revendre par unité. De ce commerce, Monsieur L. Laté pourra mieux dégager de revenus et améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of a storage tank for kerosene

Achat d'une citerne de pétrole

loans.name: Davi

texts.en:
Davi is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She sells cassava and corn dough to a large population in the community where she resides. She has been selling these food items since she was an adolescent.

Davi has managed to acquire a plot of land close to her family house. She therefore intends to apply the loan amount to raise a shed from which she can operate and expand her business. She has also benefited from KRABAN'S TEACH learning sessions.

loans.use: To build a shed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 20 more chairs and renovate her hotel business.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
A married mother of 6, Ms. Akossiwa S. left Vogan in 1990 to rejoin her husband in Dévémé. 46 years of age, she has been able to maintain her condiment business since her arrival in Dévémé. In fact, she has become quite well-known due to the business. Her daily work consists of going to gardens, purchasing baskets of condiments and reselling them. She is now seeking a loan of $500 to diversify into the sale of essential manufactured products and increase her purchasing power. Implementing this project will allow Ms. S. to improve her family's living conditions with the income generated by the business.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de six (06) enfants, Madame S. Akossiwa quitta Vogan en 1990 pour rejoindre son mari à Dévémé. Agée de 46 ans, elle a pu maintenir son commerce de vente de condiments qu’elle exerce depuis son arrivée à Dévémé. Cette activité fait d’ailleurs d’elle une femme bien connue. Aller dans les jardins, acheter des paniers de condiments, revenir les vendre reste son boulot quotidien. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 pour associer la vente des produits manufacturés de première nécessité et augmenter son pouvoir d’achat. La réalisation de ce projet pourra amener Madame Akossiwa S. à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille grâce aux revenus dégagés de son activité.

loans.use: Diversify into the sale of essential manufactured items and increase her purchasing power

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cultivate her farm and buy a high quality cow.

loans.name: Nyinougbé

texts.en:
Born in 1969, Ms. Nyinougbé A. is a courageous woman. A married mother of 2, her principal business remains agriculture and the production of gari (local processing of manioc into flour). Despite her illiteracy, her business experience has earned her a good reputation. She is now seeking a loan of $650 to acquire materials for the processing of manioc and a manioc field to meet the needs of the market. Realizing this dream will help Ms. A. improve her family’s precarious living conditions, both socially and financially.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1969, Madame A. Nyinougbé est une femme courageuse. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, son activité principale reste l’agriculture et la production du gari (transformation locale du manioc en farine). Analphabète, elle possède une expérience dans son activité, ce qui lui confère une bonne renommée. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour acheter le matériel de transformation du manioc et un champs de manioc afin de satisfaire la demande du marché. La réalisation de ce rêve, pourra aider Madame A. Nyinougbé à changer les conditions de vies sociales et économiques précaires de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of manioc processing materials and a manioc field

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a big-time dealer in grains and cereals. These are maize, groundnuts, beans and others. She buys her items in bulk from Techiman in the central part of the country. She is 38 years old and married with 5 children, 4 of whom are currently schooling.

Efua's major problem is the transport cost for her wares. This is gradually draining the little capital with which she is trading. She intends to use the KIVA loan to support her capital to cover the transport payments for her goods.

loans.use: For transport costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Eunice wants to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Somégna

texts.en:
Born in 1969 to a poor family, Ms. Somégna N’TSOUGAN is a married mother of three. She contributes toward the household expenses through income earned by raising goats. Her husband, a traditional blacksmith, has lost his ability to work due to a long-term illness. This has left Ms. N’tsougan solely responsible for the needs of the home. She is seeking a loan of $750 to construct an enclosure for her animals, install troughs and for the long-term storage of feed sacks. The implementation of this project will contribute to the adequate development of her animals, the sale of which will generate income that will likely alleviate the suffering she and her entire family endure.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1969 d’une famille pauvre, Madame N’TSOUGAN Somégna est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle contribuer aux dépenses du foyer à partir des revenus de son élevage de caprins. Son mari, forgeron traditionnel, a perdu sa force de travail à la suite d’une longue maladie ce qui laisse Madame N’TSOUGAN Somégna seule devant les charges du ménage. Elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour construire un enclos pour ses bêtes, installer des abreuvoirs et stocker des sacs d’aliments sur une longue période. La réalisation de ce projet contribuera au développement harmonieux des bêtes dont la vente périodique procurera des revenus susceptibles d’alléger les souffrances de cette femme et à travers elle toute sa famille.

loans.use: Construction of an animal enclosure, installation of troughs and food storage.

loans.name: Ayéléwa

texts.en:
Ms. Ayéléwa A. was born in 1957. She has been widowed for 10 years and has 4 children. The inheritance left by her deceased husband is not enough to meet the numerous needs of the family. However, her small animal breeding business, which she has run since a young age, allows her to more or less cover some expenses. She is now seeking a loan of $650 to build an animal enclosure and introduce a new species. Through this activity, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Ayéléwa est née en 1957 et veuve avec quatre (04) orphelins depuis 10 ans. L’héritage laissé par son mari défunt ne lui permet pas de subvenir aux nombreux besoins de la famille. Néanmoins, son petit élevage qu’elle exerce depuis son jeune âge l’aide à assumer tant bien que mal ses besoins. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour faire la clôture à ses animaux et introduire une nouvelle espèce de bêtes. A partir de cette activité, elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et augmenter son niveau de vie.

loans.use: Construction of an enclosure and introduction of new species of animals

loans.name: Kokou

texts.en:
Born in 1961 in Dévémé, Mr. Kokou A. is a brave and well-respected man. A married father of 4, he is experienced in coal production. It is thanks to this activity that he is able to support the people under his care. Currently, the demand for wood coal is growing incessantly as few people can afford to purchase gas. However, it requires modern equipment. He is now seeking a loan of $750 to acquire a sawing machine and purchase wood for producing charcoal and meet the demands of the market. He'll be able increase his business figures and improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1961 à Dévémé, Monsieur A. Kokou est un brave homme et bien respecté. Marié et père de quatre (04) enfants, il possède une expérience dans la production de charbon. C’est d’ailleurs grâce à cette activité qu’il subvient aux besoins des personnes à sa charge. Actuellement, la demande de charbons de bois ne cessent d’augmenter car très peu de gens arrivent à s’acheter des gaz, mais il faut des moyens modernes de travail. Aujourd’hui, il sollicite un crédit de $750 pour acquérir une machine à scier et acheter des bois pour produire des charbons afin de satisfaire la demande du marché. Il pourra augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase a sawing machine and wood

loans.name: Ajala

texts.en:
Ajala is a 48 years old and a single mother of 2 children. She deals in the sale of clothes and suiting materials, and has undergone the TEACH sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION. She obtains her supplies from the capital, Accra.

Ajala trades her wares under a shed which is not very secure, such that she has to arrange them each morning and remove them at the close of every day. She intends to use the KIVA loan to construct a well-secured structure to keep her goods in.

loans.use: Capital to build a structure

loans.name: Mélanie

texts.en:
Ms. Mélanie A. is a 36-year-old married mother of 4 and cares for 5 other people. Her modest ice selling business provides a meager income and is not enough to cover all the household expenses. She has already benefited from two consecutive loans which were repaid without incident. The sale of ice involves mainly logistical requirements such as ice boxes, a freezer and a generator, among others. For this reason, Ms. A. is asking for a sum of $650, which will allow her to revamp her business, thereby increasing her revenue for the well being of her family.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Mélanie, âgée de 36, est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants et à sa charges cinq (05) autres personnes. Sa modeste activité de vente de glaçon lui génère de maigres revenus n'arrive pas à couvrir toutes les dépenses du foyer. Elle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits successifs qui sont déjà remboursés sans incident. La vente de glaçon nécessite des moyens surtout logistiques comme entre autres les glacières, le congélateur, groupe électrogène. Ainsi, Madame A. Mélanie sollicite une somme de $650 qui lui permettra de rehausser son activité afin d’accroître également son revenu pour le bien-être de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase a generator, freezer and ice boxes

loans.name: Zinhoé

texts.en:
A married mother of 2, Ms. Zinhoé K. is 44 years of age. She currently lives with her family in Agbanakin. The weaving of mats constitutes her main income-generating activity, which she performs with passion. Difficult and exhausting but quite profitable, the business provides a meager income for Ms. K.. She is asking for $500 to obtain necessary raw materials at a lower cost, thereby increasing production with the proper equipment. Acquiring these raw materials and equipment will make her job easier and increase production, as well as the income Ms. K. needs to bring her family out of its current state of absolute poverty.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, Madame K. Zinhoé est âgée de 44 ans. Elle vit actuellement à Agbanakin avec sa famille. Le tressage de nattes constitue pour elle la principale activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce avec passion. Difficile et fatiguant mais très rentable, cette activité procure de maigres revenus à Madame K.. Dans le souci de disposer de matières premières nécessaires à moindre coût pour augmenter la production avec des matériels appropriés, elle sollicite $500. L’acquisition de ces matériels et matières premieres faciliteront le travail et feront augmenter la production et naturellement les revenus dont a besoin Madame K. pour sortir sa famille de la misère absolue actuelle.

loans.use: Acquisition of equipment and raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock to expand her retail business

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She sells firewood to the community in which she lives. She carts the firewood from the nearby villages to her house. This is one commercial activity which is highly regulated because of its negative impact on the environment. However, the majority of the people still depend on firewood to do their cooking and prepare food for sale to the public.

Mariama sometimes runs out of supplies. She therefore intends to apply the loan to create buffer stock before the rains set in by late May.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her mobile food vending business

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi is 34 years and married with 2 children who are in school. He runs a carpentry shop which produces bedsteads, tables, chairs and other household furniture for sale.

Kofi's objective is to acquire some specialized tools to be able to expand his product range and thus increase his market size. Since the population of his area is expanding, demand for his products is also on the increase. As a result of KRABAN'S TEACH learning sessions, Kofi hopes to use a KIVA loan to attain his objective.

loans.use: Capital to buy tools

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Born in 1954 in Tsévié, Zio prefecture, Ms. Afi K. is a married mother of 4 and cares for 2 other people as well. She is an illiterate woman who has dedicated herself to the sale of fish and food products. Her financial means are insufficient for meeting the demands of her clientele. In order to breathe new life into her business, she is asking for a loan of $400 which will provide the funds needed to grow her business, increase its yield and improve its self-financing ability.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1954 à Tsévié dans la préfecture du Zio, Madame K. Afi est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants et a également à sa charge deux (02) autres personnes. C’est une femme analphabète qui s’est investie dans le commerce de poisson et des produits alimentaires. Ses moyens financiers insuffisants n’arrivent pas à satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Pour donner un autre souffle aujourd’hui à son commerce, elle sollicite un crédit de $400 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour augmenter la taille de ses activités afin d’accroître son rendement et améliorer sa capacité d’auto financement.

loans.use: Sale of fish and food products

loans.name: Massawonda

texts.en:
Born in Ghana in 1970, Ms. Massawonda M. is a rice retailer in Tabligbo, Yoto prefecture. A mother of 4, she also cares for 3 other people. Abandoned by her husband, her current business does not allow her to meet the financial needs of her family. In order to develop a side business to supplement the sale of rice, she is in need of financial assistance in the amount of $300 for the purchase of Muslim veils and wrap dresses for resale. The requested loan will allow her to increase her self-financing abilities.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1970 au Ghana, Madame M. Massawonda est une revendeuse de riz à Tabligbo dans la préfecture de Yoto. Elle est mère de quatre (04) enfants et à sa charge trois (03) autres personnes à charge. Son commerce actuel ne lui permet pas de faire face aux exigences financières de sa famille abandonnée par son mari. Pour développer d’autre projet à part la vente du riz, elle a besoin d’une aide financière de $300 pour l’achat des voiles des musulmans et des pagnes afin de les revendre. Ce crédit demandé lui permettra d’augmenter sa capacité d’autofinancement.

loans.use: Acquire and sell veils and wrap dresses in addition to selling rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of baking equipment for her business

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is 27 years old. She began her trading activities after elementary school since her parents could not afford the cost of a secondary education.

Ekua has been selling fresh tomatoes for the past five years. Having participated in the TEACH sessions organised by KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION in October, 2006, she decided to seek a KIVA loan as seed capital to support her business.

loans.use: Seed capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her grocery business

loans.name: A. Adjewoda

texts.en:
Mr. Adjewoda A. N. was born in Togoville and lives in Tabligbo. He is a married father of 4 with two brothers under his care. He leads a happy life with his family despite their unenviable financial situation. A substitute caretaker at the WACEM company in Tabligbo, he is not employed full time, and his income does not allow him to make ends meet. He is in need of $1000 to purchase a corn mill. He is quite skilled in mill operation. Financing this project will allow him to better care for his family.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur N. A. Adjewoda est né à TOGOVILLE et demeure à Tabligbo. Il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants avec deux (02) frères à charge. Il mène avec sa famille une vie heureuse malgré leur situation financière peu enviable. Gardien remplaçant à la société WACEM de Tabligbo, il n’a donc pas un emploi en plein temps et ses revenus ne lui permettent pas de s’en sortir sur le plan financier. Il a besoin d’une aide de $1000 pour le financement d’un moulin à maïs. C’est quelqu’un qui maîtrise bien la gestion d’un moulin. Le financement de ce projet lui permettra de moeux s'occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and install a corn mill

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame is just 22 years old, and has done menial jobs to keep himself going since elementary school. With the little money that he saved, he managed to start a small communications shop which he is running.

Kwame wants to use a KIVA loan to secure a small structure from to operate his communications business. He is preparing for the TEACH learning sessions to be conducted by KRABAN very soon.

loans.use: Capital to secure a structure

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Komi E. is a welder by training and a merchant in the prefecture of Yoto. He was born on December 4, 1976 in Vokoutimé (in Vo prefecture). In addition to two welding shops, he has a stall, where he sells school supplies and various other items. Married with two children and with five other people to provide for, he and his family live together in a warm and inviting home. To develop the business for his stall, he is requesting $700 of help in the form of a loan, which will allow him to augment his profits and his ability to finance himself.

Translated from French by David Pigott and Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteers.

Monsieur E. Komi est un soudeur de formation et commerçant dans la préfecture de Yoto. Il est né le 04 décembre 1976 à Vokoutimé dans la préfecture de VO. Il a deux ateliers de soudure et une boutique dans laquelle il vend des articles scolaires et divers. Marié et père de deux (02) enfants avec cinq (05) personnes à charge, il vit dans une ambiance de chaleur totale dans la maison avec sa femme et ses enfants. Pour le développement de ses activités dans sa boutique, il demande une aide de $700 sous forme de crédit.. Cela lui permettra d’augmenter son rendement et sa capacité d’autofinancement.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Kokou

texts.en:
Kokou A. was born on April 23, 1977 in Tsekpo Devé, in Yoto Prefecture. Friendly and generous, he is married with two children and two additional people to provide for. Having abandoned his primary studies because it was too expensive, he apprenticed in a sewing shop and became a certified master tailor in Tabligbo. But because tailor shops have multiplied, and especially because the living standards in the area are very low, his sewing studio no longer makes any money. As a result, he wants to start over and hopes to accomplish many things.

He is asking for a loan of $1200 to finance his farming plans, buy a mill, and restart other ways to generate income.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Kokou est né le 23 avril 1977 à Tsekpo Devé dans la préfecture de Yoto. Il est aimable et généreux. Il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants et aussi avec deux (02) autres personnes à charge. Ayant abandonné ses études primaires pour faute de moyen, il entre en apprentissage de la couture et est aujourd’hui un maître tailleur confirmé à Tabligbo. Mais avec la multiplication des ateliers de couture dans sa localité et surtout avec le niveau de vie très bas des populations, son atelier ne fonctionne plus. Face à cette situation il veut se reconvertir et compte réaliser beaucoup de choses.

Aussi demande-t-il une aide $1200 pour le financement de l’agriculture et l’achat d’un moulin. Elle lui permettra de redémarrer d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.

loans.use: Start farming and buy a mill

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a young woman of 22 years, married, with 1 child. Her husband has helped her open a beauty shop. Some of the items include mesh, trinkets, necklaces and assorted hair goods.

Nana is seeking the KIVA loan to increase the product base so as to meet the demand of her customers. She also wants add children's wear to her range of products since the demand is very great.

loans.use: Capital to expand her product line

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The initial deposit for a milk van

loans.name: Dansi

texts.en:
Dansi S. is 37 years old and a mother of four. For more than 10 years, she has sold store-bought fish in addition to occasionally working as a seamstress. From a poor family, the little income she brings in makes her practically the only member who can provide for its daily needs. 10 years of experience has given her many customers, but lacking sufficient working assets, she is unable to satisfy their demand.

To build up a good stock of fish, bought in bulk directly from fishermen instead of in shops, she is requesting a $850 loan to diversify and improve her business. This will allow her to have a consistent and regular form of income, and to improve her financial and social situation.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Mère de quatre (04) enfants, Madame S. Dansi est âgé de 37 ans. Elle exerce le commerce de poissons acheté en détail depuis plus de 10 ans en complément de son métier de couture qu’elle exerce de façon occasionnelle. Issue d’une famille pauvre, elle est pratiquement la seule à pourvoir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille avec les maigres recettes qu’elle fait dans son activité. L’expérience de 10 ans lui a permis d’avoir beaucoup de clients qu’elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire faute de fond de roulement suffisant.

Pour disposer de stocks importants de poissons achetés en gros cette fois-ci directement au port, elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $850 pour redynamiser son commerce afin d’avoir un revenu consistant et régulier et changer sa situation financière et sociale.

loans.use: Purchase of fish in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her groceries business by purchasing additional fresh fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Fuseina

texts.en:
Fusiena is 35 years old and married, with 3 children. She sells grains and cereals in her community, including rice, beans, maize and groundnuts.

Because Fusiena buys on credit from her suppliers, it tends to reduce her profit margin. During the KRABAN 'TEACH' learning sessions, Fusiena got to know about the KIVA program, and she is therefore seeking a loan for seed capital to be able to pay off her suppliers at the point of purchase. She hopes this will improve her profit levels.

loans.use: Seed capital

loans.name: Clémentine

texts.en:
43 years old, Clémentine K. is from a poor family and now lives in the village of Agbanakin, in the Lacs Prefecture. She has several people to care for in addition to her three children, and lives with her family, providing for them with the small earnings she makes selling palm nuts and fish. Since receiving three loans, which she managed well, her business has improved and she is financially unable to keep up with demand.

To do this, she is asking for a $700 loan that will allow her to stock up on and sell less expensive palm nuts. She expects to triple her sales, which will enable her to have a consistent and regular income, and to meet her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 43 ans, Madame K. Clémentine est issus d’une famille pauvre et vit actuellement dans le village d’Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs. Ayant plusieurs personnes en charge en plus de ses trois enfants, elle vit avec sa famille des maigres revenus qu’elle tire de la vente des noix palmistes et des poissons. Après avoir reçu et bien géré trois crédits, elle a constaté une amélioration de ses activités qui nécessitent des moyens financiers plus importants dont elle ne dispose pas pour satisfaire les demandes.

Pour ce faire, elle demande un crédit de $700 qui lui permettra de faire un stock de noix moins cher destiné à la commercialisation en vue de tripler son chiffre d’affaires et avoir un revenu consistant et régulier pouvant l’emmener à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Build a good inventory of palm nuts

loans.name: Navigodo

texts.en:
Navigodo F. is about 45 years old and is a very active woman. Illiterate, she is married with three children. Her husband works mainly in agriculture, but because of bad weather, his earnings don’t provide enough for their family’s needs. To do this, Navigodo F. has decided to help contribute by selling various food products. She quickly joined and started to work with a group of vendors.

Now she hopes to take advantage of the opportunity and is asking for a $700 loan in order to expand her food stand. Income from sales will help her make ends meet and give her financial independence.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 45 ans environ, Madame F. Navigodo est une femme très active. Analphabète, elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. L’activité principale de son mari est l’agriculture. Avec les intempéries actuelles, les revenus issus de cette activité ne confèrent pas un épanouissement de la famille. Pour cela, Madame F. Navigodo a décidé d’aider son mari dans les charges à partir de son commerce de vente de produits divers d'alimentation. Très tôt, elle a adhéré à un groupement avec lequel elle opère.

Aujourd’hui, elle veut saisir cette opportunité pour bénéficier d’un crédit de $700 afin d’agrandir son étalage. Le bénéfice de la vente lui permettra de mieux couvrir les dépenses de son foyer et avoir une autonomie financière.

loans.use: Expansion of food stand

loans.name: Comlan

texts.en:
Comlan N’TSOUGAN was born in 1970 and is married with four children. After finishing secondary school, he studied agropastoral farming, which led to raising livestock. Presently, he provides for his family with the small earnings he makes from raising pigs. He quickly joined a group of other stockbreeders and earned a loan through them. He has a lot of experience raising this kind of livestock, and has earned a good reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $950 to modernize his operation, which includes buying troughs and grain and introducing a more productive species of pig. This will enable him to increase his income, improve his working conditions and provide for his family.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1970, Monsieur N’TSOUGAN Comlan est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Après ses études secondaires, il s’est fait formé en Agropastoral qui lui ouvre la porte de l’élevage. Aujourd’hui, Monsieur N’TSOUGAN subvient aux besoins de sa famille à partir des maigres revenus de l’élevage du porcin, Très tôt, il adhère à un groupement auprès duquel il a bénéficié d’un crédit. Il possède une grande expérience en ce type d’élevage ; ce qui lui confère une bonne réputation.

Il sollicite un crédit de $950 pour moderniser son élevage : acheter des abreuvoirs, des sons et introduire une nouvelle espèce de porcs plus productrice. La réussite de ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et améliorer ses conditions de travail et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: Modernize livestock operation, buy troughs and grain, and introduce new types of pigs

loans.name: Mawupénya

texts.en:
Born in 1969, Mawupénya A. is married with four children. She grows vegetables to make ends meet. Her husband, a farmer, isn’t making enough money to meet the family’s needs. Despite being illiterate, she is a member of a farming group, which has given her instruction and allowed her to apply for loans.

She is presently requesting a $950 loan to buy fertilizer and increase the size of her field to meet the high demand for food in the area. The earnings will be used to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1969, Madame A. Mawupénya est une femme mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Pour contribuer aux charges du ménage, elle s’appuie sur les revenus de son travail de maraîchage. Son mari, agriculteur de profession n’a pas une bonne situation financière qui puisse permettre l’épanouissement de la famille. Bien qu’elle soit analphabète, Madame A. Mawupénya fait partie d’un groupement agricole avec lequel elle a pu suivre plusieurs formations et gérer des crédits.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 destiner à acheter des engrais pour élargir son champ afin de satisfaire les nombreux besoins sur les marchés environnants. Le bénéfice sera destiné à l’amélioration des conditions sociales de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and increase size of farmland

loans.name: Tchomagnan

texts.en:
Tchomagnan A. was born in 1972 in Afagna-Gléta. After attending school, he moved to Dévémé, where he lives now, to be with his father. Married with three children, he makes ends meet by raising pigs. He has a good reputation, is very successful and changes the types of pigs he raises every two years.

He is requesting a $850 loan to purchase a more productive pig species, increase the size of his pens and stock up on feed. This will increase his earnings and give him real control over his life.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Tchomagnan est né 1972 à Afagna-Gléta. Après son cours moyen, il rejoint son père à Dévémé où il vit actuellement. Marié et père de trois (03) enfants, Monsieur A. arrive à subvenir à ses besoins à partir de son petit élevage de porcins. Cette activité fait de lui, l’ami des consommateurs de cette viande. Chaque 2 ans, il change les espèces de ces porcs. Aujourd’hui, il possède une grande expérience qui lui confère une tranquillité et une réussite parfaite.

Monsieur A. Tchomagnan sollicite un crédit de $850 pour s’acheter une nouvelle espèce de porcins plus productive, étendre son enclos d’élevage et s’approvisionner en provenderie. La réalisation de ce projet pourra l’amener à augmenter ses revenus et se prendre en charge véritablement.

loans.use: Increase size of pig pen, buy a new species of pig, and stock up on feed

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Married with five children, Yawa K. was born in 1967 in Dévémé (Lacs Prefecture). Her sodabi (local palm-based drink) business has earned her the nickname “Mama AHATO.” This is how she meets the needs of her five children, mother and little sister, whom she also provides for. She has a good amount of experience with loans, having already received and paid back two.

She is requesting a loan of $600 to buy drums of sodabi and increase sales, which will boost her earnings and improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, Madame K. Yawa est née en 1967 à Dévémé (P/Lacs). Son commerce de sodabi (boisson locale à base de palmier) lui confère dans son village, le surnom de « maman AHATO ». C’est d’ailleurs avec ces revenus qu’elle subvient aux besoins de ses cinq enfants, sa mère et sa petite sœur qui sont à sa charge. Elle possède une grande expérience en gestion de crédits après deux prêts qui sont bien soldés.

Madame K. Yawa sollicite un apport financier de $600 pour acheter des bidons de sodabi afin d’espérer à une meilleure vente. Ceci pourra changer positivement ses revenus, ses conditions de vie de même que celle de toute sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of sodabi drums

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Akossiwa S. is a very active widow with eight people to provide for in her home: five children and three grandsons. After losing her husband, she quickly took up making pots—a skill she learned from her mother—to feed her family. With this she earns a small income, but her products are very popular, and if she were able to produce them in higher quantities, they could be sold in other places throughout the region.

She is requesting a loan of $850 to buy new tools that will help her produce more pots and satisfy demand. The sales will help her meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Akossiwa est une veuve très active. Précocement laissée par son mari, elle s’est vite recyclée en fabrication de pots qu’elle a héritée de sa mère pour pouvoir nourrir ses orphelins. Aujourd’hui, elle a en charges huit (8) personnes : cinq (5) enfants et trois (3) petits fils. Son activité lui procure un minimum de revenu avec lequel elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. Mais ses produits artisanaux sont très bien appréciés et s’ils sont produits en grande quantité, Madame S. pourra les écouler rapidement dans d’autres marchés de la région.

Elle sollicite alors crédit de $850 pour se procurer de nouveaux outils de fabrication des pots afin de réussir à produire en quantité suffisante. Les revenus tirés de cette vente l’aideront à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for pottery

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 28 years old and married, with 2 children. She works selling fresh fruits, namely oranges, watermelons, mangoes, and imported apples.

Apart from the apples, which Sabina buys on the open market, the fruits are brougt from the hinterland by herself. She distributes these bulk purchases to various retailers at a regional market outside the city. Sabina plans to use the KIVA loan to increase these bulk purchases.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Soédalo

texts.en:
Soédalo A. is married with six children. She raises goats in Dévémé, where she was born in 1964. In addition to her children, she cares for two grandsons. She meets the needs of her family by buying goats in area villages and selling them. She has experience in managing loans, and has repaid them all.

She is requesting a loan of $750 to build a pen for her animals and to buy feed. This project will increase her income and improve her living family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Soédalo est une femme mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Elle pratique l’élevage de caprins à Dévémé où elle est née en 1964. Outre ses enfants, elle a en charge deux petits fils. Madame A. arrive à assurer ses besoins à partir des bénéfices tirés de la vente de ses bêtes. Elle circule dans les villages pour acheter du caprin qu’elle élève une bonne période avant la revente. Elle possède une bonne expérience en matière de gestion. Elle a bénéficié d’un premier crédit qu’elle a déjà soldé.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour construire de l’enclos à ses animaux et acheter de la nourriture pour les alimenter. La réalisation de ce projet lui procurera beaucoup de revenus et changera son cadre de vie..

loans.use: Construction of animal pen and purchase of feed

loans.name: Gaméli

texts.en:
Gaméli D. was born in 1969 in Afagnan (Lacs Prefecture) and is married with three children. To meet his family’s needs, he stores corn in good seasons and sells it when there is a shortage. His wife helps make ends meet by selling food at area schools.

During the current period of abundance, he doesn’t want to waste the opportunity of very low corn prices and is requesting a loan of $950 to create a large inventory and increase sales. The income will be used to improve his family’s living conditions and increase his saving capability.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur D. Gaméli est né en 1969 à Afagnan (P/Lacs). Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Pour subvenir aux charges familiales, il fait le stockage de maïs en période d’abondance pour revendre en temps de pénurie. Sa femme qui vend des denrées alimentaires dans les établissements scolaires contribue elle aussi moyennement aux charges de sa famille.

En cette période d’abondance, Mr D. ne voudrait pas rater sa saison surtout que les prix sont très bas actuellement. Il sollicite un crédit de $950 pour faire des tonnes de stockage de maïs afin d’espérer un bon chiffre d’affaire. Le bénéfice sera destiné à améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et à augmenter sa capacité d’épargne.

loans.use: Purchase, stocking and sale of corn

loans.name: Siméssou

texts.en:
Siméssou K. was born in 1955 and is married with five children. After her husband became sick and could no longer work, she took over for meeting the family’s needs. She makes palm oil and now has the nickname “AMITO.” Despite being illiterate, she runs her business well and has repaid her previous loans.

She is presently requesting a $650 loan to buy palm nuts in order to make and sell more palm oil, which will help her improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1955, Madame K. Siméssou est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Son mari devenu malade, perd sa force de travail, ce qui amène Madame K. à supporter toutes les charges de la famille. La production de l’huile de palme l’amène à porter le surnom de « AMITO ». Malgré son statut d’analphabète, elle a une bonne gestion de ses activités ce qui fait que ses crédits antérieurs sont bien soldés.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour s’acheter des noix de palme afin de produire et vendre abondamment de l’huile. Cela pourra améliorer ses revenus et inévitablement ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expansion of her fresh juice refreshments business

loans.name: Aditodokoin

texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Afagnagan, Aditodokoin A. was widowed at a young age and now has six children to care for, plus two grandsons, after her oldest daughter left for Lomé to look for work. Selling sodabi (a local drink made with palm) has made her a well-known woman in her community.

Despite being illiterate, she runs her business well, and is presently requesting a $550 loan to buy drums of sodabi, which she plans to resell. With the income from these sales, she will increase her saving capability and improve the living conditions of her large family.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1956 à Afagnagan, Madame A. Aditodokoin est devenue très tôt veuve avec six (06) orphelins à sa charge et deux petits fils laissés par sa fille aînée partie à Lomé pour chercher du travail. La vente de sodabi (boisson locale à base de palmier) fait d’elle une femme bien connue dans sa localité. Malgré son statut d’analphabète, elle possède une expérience en matière de gestion des activités.

Elle sollicite un crédit de $550 pour acheter des bidons de sodabi pour revendre. Avec les revenus de sa vente, elle pourra augmenter sa capacité d’épargner et améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de toute sa grande famille.

loans.use: Purchase of drums of sodabi

loans.name: Léocadie

texts.en:
A mother of three, Léocadie K. is a kind and very dynamic woman. After finishing primary school, she married a sodabi (local drink) maker in 1992, with whom she had her three children. Seeing her husband’s income, she quickly invested her small amount of money in food sales, as her mother was doing at the time. She has proven herself to be a good businesswoman and has repaid loans earned with her group of women. Since prices are low right now, she wants to take advantage of the opportunity to increase her stall and meet her customers’ demand. She is requesting a loan of $750, which will help her provide for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Mère d’une petite famille de trois (3) enfants, Madame K. Léocadie est une douce dame très dynamique. Instruite de niveau primaire, elle épousa en 1992 un producteur de sodabi (boisson locale) avec qui elle a fait ses enfants. Vu le niveau du revenu de son mari, Madame K. Léocadie a investi sa petite économie très tôt dans la vente des produits divers d'alimentation comme le faisait sa mère. Elle fait ses preuves de gestion des activités et de crédit dans un groupement de femmes. En cette période de réduction des prix des articles,elle veut saisir cette opportunité pour agrandir son étalage afin de bien répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Ceci pourra élever sa capacité de couvrir les dépenses de sa famille. Aussi sollicite –elle un crédit de $750

loans.use: Improvement of food stall

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra sells clothing. She began her business with help from her brother-in-law who gave her merchandise to start her business. In the beginning she only sold children's clothing door-to-door. Now she continues to offer children's clothing together with clothing for adult women and men. Alexandra hopes to sell all types of clothing together with other boutique items. She will use the loan to invest in wholesale merchandise and to purchase a display case. She is sure that this new merchandise will help her business grow. Amexandra is a mother of four children. She is 39 years old and has been married for several years. Her husband is her right hand man in the business, and he moved to Guayaquil after living in Los Rios. Her business is the only source of income for her family. Alexandra hopes that this loan will give her financial security to save for her children's education and to continue the construction of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Alexandra es comerciante de ropa. Ella empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su cuñado quien le dio mercadería para que empezara su negocio. Al principio ella solo vendía ropa de niños puerta a puerta. Ahora ella continúa ofreciendo ropa de niños junto con ropa de damas y caballeros. Alexandra aspira vender todo tipo de ropa junto con articulos de bazar. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir comprando mercadería al por mayor y una vitrina. Ella tiene la seguridad de que con esta nueva mercadería su negocio crecerá. Alexandra es madre de cuatro hijos. Ella tiene 39 años tiene varios años unida a su esposo quien es su mano derecha en el negocio, se mudo a Guayaquil después de vivir en Los Ríos. Su negocio es la única fuente de ingreso en el hogar. Alexandra tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le dará seguridad financiera y pueda permitirle ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos y poder seguir construyendo su casa.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale clothing and a display case.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells cosmetics. Maria began her business with $100 in capital. At the beginning she just sold cosmetics but now she also sells costume jewelry. Maria hopes to establish a store to display her merchandise. She will use the loan to invest in merchandise purchased on sale and therefore be able to offer competetive prices. She believes that these new products will help her business grow. Maria is single and 28 years old. Through this business Maria helps her family. Maria hopes that this loan will give her fanancial stability and allow her to save for her future.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Maria tiene ventas de cosméticos. Maria empezó su negocio con un capital de 100 dólares. Al principio ella solo vendía cosméticos, pero ahora también vende bisutería. Maria aspira establecer un local para exhibir su mercadería. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en compras de mercadería a precios de ofertas y así vender a precios competitivos. Ella tiene la fe que con estos nuevos productos su negocio seguirá creciendo. Maria esta soltera, Ella tiene 28 años. Ella por medio de su negocio apoya a su familia. Maria tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le permitirá tener estabilidad económica y ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: To establish a store

loans.name: Sogbossi

texts.en:
Sogbossi K. was born in 1958 in Dévémé. She is married, a farmer, and the mother of four. Her commerce in fish allows her to meet the needs of her family. She is loved by all for both her smile and a welcoming personality, and her sales are increasing day by day. She possesses a lot of experience in her line of work: buying fish in Lomé and selling them in local marketplaces. She is mastering her business. The loan of $500 that she is requesting will go towards stocking up on fish and avoiding shortages. It will help meet numerous orders from her customers. She will thus be able to improve her ability to save money, her living conditions, and those of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Sogbossi est née en 1958 à Dévémé, mariée à un cultivateur, elle est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son commerce de poissons lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Aimée de tous par son accueil et son sourire, son chiffre d’affaires augmente au jour le jour. Elle possède une grande expérience dans son activité : acheter les poissons à Lomé et aller les revendre dans les marchés locaux. Madame K. Sogbossi dispose d’une maîtrise de son activité. Elle sollicite un crédit de $500 pour s’approvisionner en quantité et éviter les ruptures de stock afin de satisfaire les nombreuses demandes de sa clientèle. Ainsi, elle pourra améliorer sa capacité d’épargne, ses conditions de vie et celle de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock up on fish

loans.name: Houfongbé

texts.en:
Houfongbé A. is 53 years old, married, the mother of four, and is the guardian of a child from her deceased older brother. Her husband is primarily a carpenter. Twelve years ago, to help with family expenses, she entered into commerce in «gari» (granulated cassava flour), a flourishing business. Despite being illiterate, she is a disciplined manager. Her good experience managing loans need not be demonstrated any further. She is requesting a loan of $650 to acquire a field of cassava plants. Cassava roots are made into gari, which is widely consumed in the region. This loan, when released, will really benefit her, since she will have a higher income, something that will make a difference in her family’s standard of living

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 53 ans, Madame A. Houfongbé est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants et à sa charge un (1) enfant de son grand frère décédé. L’activité principale de son mari est la menuiserie. Pour contribuer aux besoins familiaux, Madame A. se lance dans la production et la vente de « gari » farine de manioc. Elle exerce cette activité florissante il y a 12 ans et en fait une gestion rigoureuse malgré qu’elle soit analphabète. Son expérience en matière de gestion de crédit n’est plus à démontrer. Elle sollicite un crédit de $650 afin d’acquérir un champ de maniocs,matières premières du gari très consommé dans la région.. Ce crédit débloqué lui serait très bénéfique puisqu’elle aura à augmenter le revenu qui se répercutera sur le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire a cassava field for making gari

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
