Grace is 26 years old and married with 1 child. She sells vegetables to her community, namely tomatoes, onions, pepper and eggplants.

Grace brings this produce from Techiman, Bolgatanga (northern Ghana), or Bourkina Faso. Thus a major constraint on her business is transport cost. She wants therefore to secure the KIVA loan to beef up her capital and to augment the number of boxes she can bring on a trip.

loans.use: Capital for transport costs

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.en:
Adjovi K. was born into a poor family in Afagnan in 1973. She is married and the mother of four. She is now primarily a livestock farmer, and this is furthermore the source of income on which her family lives. Educated through primary school, she possesses a rigorous management sense in her business activities. Ms. K. is requesting financial support in the amount of $700 to acquire bran, some animal feed, and to ensure veterinary care for her livestock. The loan’s impact will increase her income, her savings, and thus improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née a Afagnan en 1973 d’une famille pauvre, Madame K. Adjovi est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son activité principale reste l’élevage associé à l’agriculture. C’est d’ailleurs de ce revenu que vive sa famille. D’un niveau d’étude primaire, elle a un sens rigoureux de la gestion de ses affaires. Elle sollicite un apport financier de $700 afin de s’acheter des sons, de la provenderie et assurer des soins vétérinaires à ses animaux. Comme impact, ceci pourra augmenter ses revenus, son épargne et du coup, l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy bran, animal feed, and veterinary care for livestock

loans.name: Adéméwolé

texts.en:
Adéméwolé A. was born in Atchandomé in 1955. She is married, the mother of five, and is a merchant with over 20 years of experience. Her husband, a farmer, does not make enough money to take care of the whole family. That is why Ms. A. is a trader of corn and condiments; in her own way, she helps her family to cover household expenses. The arrival of new corn is a great opportunity for her to build up her stock. And so she is requesting a loan of $600 to increase her ability to stock corn and also to sell condiments. The resulting income will serve to improve her living conditions and those of her family, especially with regards to health and nourishment.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1955 à Atchandomé, Madame A. Adéméwolé est une commerçante de grande expérience. Mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants, elle pratique cette activité depuis une vingtaine d’années. Son mari, agriculteur de profession ne possède pas assez de revenu pour prendre en charge toute la famille. C’est pour cette raison que Madame A. pratique le commerce de vente de maïs et des condiments pour contribuer à sa façon aux charges du ménage. L’apparition de nouveaux mais est une aubène pour elle de constituer son stock. Elle sollicite ce crédit de $600 pour augmenter sa capacité de stockage en maïs et aussi vendre les condiments. Les revenus lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie de toute sa famille surtout en matière de besoins en santé, et en nourriture.

loans.use: To do commerce in corn

loans.name: Xassivi

texts.en:
Xassivi A. was born in Dédomé in 1963. She has been married for over 20 years. Her husband, a farmer, does not have substantial financial resources. Nevertheless, that has not prevented them from having five children together. Though illiterate, she has invested some savings into a business involving small fish, which she buys at retail outlets. She sells the fish at local marketplaces. Her profits go towards daily expenses at home. Today, she would like to buy fish in bulk in Ghana at much lower prices for resale locally. She needs $550 in financial backing to expand her ability to buy fish for resale. This will allow her to provide for her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née 1963 à Dédomé, Madame A. Xassivi est une femme mariée depuis une vingtaine d’années. Son mari agriculteur de profession ne possède pas un grand pouvoir financier. Néanmoins, cela n’a pas empêché Madame A. Xassivi à avoir cinq (5) enfants avec lui. Analphabète, elle a investi une petite économie dans le commerce des petits poissons qu’elle achète chez des détaillants qu’elle revend sur les marchés locaux. Les bénéfices de cette activité sont investis dans la consommation quotidienne au foyer. Aujourd’hui, elle veut acheter en gros au Ghana très moins cher et revendre dans les marchés locaux en détail. Elle a besoins d’un appui financier de $550 pour pouvoir agrandir sa capacité d’achat et de revente des poissons. Ceci lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Commerce in fish

loans.name: Komlan

texts.en:
Komlan K. was born in 1965 in Dévémé. He is married, the father of six, and takes care of two younger brothers. Making charcoal is now his principal business activity, which has earned him the name «Papa Akato». His wife helps him sell charcoal at markets. His revenues are put towards buying trees to produce charcoal and towards covering household expenses. Presently, he is requesting a loan of $650 to buy more trees because of a strong demand for charcoal. This business, when it is financed, will allow him to completely improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1959 à Dévémé, Monsieur K. Komlan est marié et père de six (06) enfants. Il a à sa charge deux petits frères. La production du charbon reste son activité principale. Ce qui lui fait porter le nom de « Papa AKATO ». Sa femme l’aide à vendre le charbon dans les marchés. Ses revenus son destinés à acheter d’autres arbres pour produire de charbons et à subvenir aux charges du ménage. Monsieur K. Komlan sollicite un crédit de $650 pour acheter des arbres et produire plus de charbon face à la forte demande. Cette activité, une fois financée pourra lui permettre d’arriver à une amélioration parfaite des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy wood for the production of charcoal

loans.name: Aligbo

texts.en:
Aligbo A. is an energetic woman, about 40 years old. Educated through primary school, she got married at age 25 to a farmer with whom she now has three children. She helps with family expenses with revenues from selling garden produce. This is a flourishing business, but she lacks the means to modernize. And so her yield of vegetables is not up to the demands of the marketplace. Today, she is requesting a loan of $850 to buy a motorized pump and watering cans in order to benefit from the weather and to reduce manual labor. This will help her extend her cultivated fields and produce more vegetables for the market. The revenues will serve to meet the needs of the family more easily.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 40 ans environ, Madame A. Aligbo est une femme dynamique. Instruite de niveau primaire, elle épousa à 25 ans un agriculteur avec qui elle a aujourd’hui trois enfants. Elle contribue aux charges de la famille à partir des revenus tirés de la vente de ses produits maraîchers. C’est une activité très florissante mais Madame A. manque de moyens financiers pour la moderniser ; ce qui fait que le rendement n’est pas à la hauteur de la demande sur le marché. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite ce crédit de $850 pour pouvoir acheter une motopompe et des arrosoirs des légumes afin de bénéficier du temps et économiser de son énergie. Ceci l’aidera à étendre son espace cultural et produire plus de légumes sur le marché. Les revenus lui serviront à mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.

loans.use: To buy a motorized pump and watering cans to grow vegetables for the markets

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Afi E. was born in 1972 in Dévémé. She is married and the mother of four. Her husband is a farmer who does not make a lot of money. This compelled Ms. E. into the corn trade. Although illiterate, she manages her business well and thus was able to repay her two previous loans without a problem. She is presently requesting a loan of $750 to stock enough corn in the hopes of selling it at a higher price during times of scarcity. She could then see clear to a good profit that will ensure her a degree of financial autonomy.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1972 à Dévémé, Madame E. Afi est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son mari cultivateur ne possède pas un grand revenu, ce qui oblige Madame E. à se lancer dans le commerce de maïs. Analphabète, elle a une bonne gestion de ses activités ce qui lui a permis de solder ses deux précédents crédits sans incident. Elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour stocker assez de maïs afin d’espérer le revendre plus cher en période de soudure et ainsi dégager beaucoup de revenus qui vont lui assurer une autonomie financière..

loans.use: To stock up on corn

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en: Sophie L., divorced with three children, began selling in 1998 with a beginning business capital of $100. She started selling many different kinds of women’s beauty products. Informed by a friend about HOPE’s microfinance program, Sophie joined a loan group and received her first loan in 2004.  She sells mainly kitchen utensils. Sophie is planning with a $700 loan to buy a freezer and increase her inventory of utensil sets as the demand for her products is high in the community. Sophie loves her business. Her hard work in her business helped her overcome the difficulty of her divorce.

loans.use: She wants to buy a freezer which will allow her to sell drinks and cream.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nonouwoédé

texts.en:
Nonouwoédé E., age 42, is married, the mother of four, and also takes care of two sisters still in school. Not fortunate enough to go to school herself, she lost no time starting a business selling cooked beans along the roads leading to her village. This is how she helps with family expenses. A very welcoming woman always ready with a smile, she has quickly gained the trust of the inhabitants of her village and has attracted more customers. However, she lacks the means to meet the demand for her goods. And so she is requesting financial support in the amount of $650 to stock drums of oil, beans, and firewood. This will increase her sales capacity, her turnover, and her revenues.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 42 ans, Madame E. Nonouwoédé est une femme mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants et à sa charge ses deux (2) sœurs en scolarité. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’être scolarisé, elle s’est vite lancée dans le commerce du haricot cuit aux abords des routes de son village afin de contribuer aux charges du ménage. Très accueillante et souriante, Madame E. a vite gagné la confiance des habitants de son village et a attiré plus de clientèle qu’elle n’arrive plus à satisfaire faute de moyens. Elle sollicite un apport financier de $650 pour stocker des bidons d’huile et du haricot et des bois de chauffe afin d’accroître sa capacité de vente et d’améliorer son chiffre d’affaire et ses revenus.

loans.use: To stock drums of oil, beans, and firewood for making and selling cooked beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her snacks business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz rents washing machines. Beatriz began her business by financing a debt to purchase two washing machines from a large commerical store. In the beginning she just offered laundry services from her home. Now she continues to provide this service but also rents out the machines from her home. She will use the loan to purchase another machine. She is sure that with this new tool her business will grow and she will be able to continue to invest in it. Beatriz is a mother of four children, married and 38 years old. She is sure that the loan will help her to improve her family's quality of life and her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Beatriz se dedica alquilar lavadoras. Beatriz empezó su negocio endeudándose en una casa comercial para adquirir dos lavadoras. Al principio ella solo daba servicio de lavado en su domicilio. Ahora ella continua dando este servicio y alquilando lavadoras desde su domicilio. Ella usara el préstamo para la compra de otra maquina. Ella tiene fe que con la introducción de estas nuevas herramientas de trabajo su negocio se incrementara y seguirá haciendo inversiones. Beatriz es madre de cuatro hijos, casado tiene 38 años Ella tiene la seguridad que el préstamo le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y su negocio crecerá.

loans.use: To purchase another washing machine

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Afi K. was born in 1970 in Afagnan. She is a married young woman and the mother of four. Her children describe her as a courageous mother. She figured out how to maintain her business raising caprins (a kind of goat) despite a few instances of theft. But due to a lack of money, she is now unable to bring about what is needed for the normal growth of her livestock. And so she is hoping for a loan of $750 to buy feed from the fodder mill and to ensure her animals have adequate veterinary care. Her goal is to have a regular revenue stream and to properly provide for her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1970 à Afagnan, Madame K. Afi est une jeune femme mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Qualifiée de mère courageuse par ses enfants, elle a su continuer son élevage de caprins malgré les quelques tours de voleur. Mais elle est incapable aujourd’hui de réunir les conditions minimales pour une croissance normale des bêtes, faute de moyens. Madame K. Afi espère avoir un crédit de $750 pour acheter de la provenderie pour alimenter ses animaux et assurer les soins vétérinaires adéquats afin d’attendre une bonne croissance des bêtes. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra de disposer à tout moment de revenus réguliers et de subvenir convenablement aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying animal feed and ensuring veterinary care

loans.name: Edoh

texts.en:
Edoh A. was born in Kouvé (in Yoto prefecture) in 1971. She is a very active woman, is married, and has three school-age children. She owns a sugar cane field that she is busy with each day doing farm work. A very ambitious woman, she has set a goal for herself: to one day be the first woman producer of sugar cane in her area. Yet the tools she uses are still rudimentary. And so she is requesting a loan of $550 to buy modern tools and to increase her production. This will allow her to boost her living standards and her family’s too.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1971 à Kouvé (P/Yoto), Madame A. Edoh est une femme très active. Mariée, elle est mère de trois (3) enfants encore en âge scolarisable. Elle possède un champ de canne à sucre qu’elle entretient et vaque quotidiennement à ses travaux champêtres. La canne à sucre est un produit qui s’écoule très vite dans sa localité. Très ambitieuse, Madame A. s’est fixée un objectif, être un jour la première femme productrice de la canne à sucre dans sa localité alors que ses outils sont encore rudimentaires. Elle sollicite un appui financier de $550 pour s’acheter des outils modernes et accroître sa production. Ce qui lui permettra de relever son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy modern tools, fertilizers, etc., for producing sugar cane

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia has a small variety store where she sells cosmetics and school supplies. She began the business with her husband's help; he motivated her to start the business with 100 dollars.

In the beginning she only sold pens, notebooks, sweets and soft drinks. Now she continues to offer those products, along with clothing and gifts. She would use the loan to buy a variety of merchandise at wholesale prices. Lucrecia has faith that her business will grow thanks to the variety of products she'll be able to offer her clients.

Lucrecia is 30 years old and married. She has 4 children, all in school. She is certain that her business will grow and allow her family to get ahead. Lucrecia hopes that this loan will help her build her home and give her children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Lucrecia tiene un pequeño bazar donde vende cosméticos y útiles escolares. Lucrecia empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien la motivo para que emprendiera el negocio con 100 dólares.

Al principio sólo vendían plumas, cuadernos, golosinas y colas. Ahora continúan ofreciendo estos productos junto con ropa y regalos. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar variedad de mercadería a precio de mayorista.

Lucrecia tiene fe que su negocio crecerá con la variedad de articulos que ofrecerá a sus clientes. Lucrecia tiene 39 años unida, tiene cuatro hijos todos estudian. Ella esta segura de que su negocio crecerá para salir adelante con su familia. Lucrecia tiene la esperanza de que este préstamo le ayudara ahorrar para construir su vivienda y darles educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy a variety of merchandise at wholesale prices

loans.name: Sodjidé

texts.en:
Sodjidé A. is a widow, born in Kpétsou in 1951. She has five children. She now lives by producing gari (a granulated cassava flour). Her deceased husband, a peasant at the time, did not leave an inheritance to his now orphaned children. To provide for her school-age children, she buys cassava from farms, digging the roots out of the earth. She then produces gari from them to sell in local marketplaces. Presently, she is requesting a loan of $600 to buy large fields of cassava in order to augment her production and to meet market demands. Her sales will increase, so that she can better provide for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1951 à Kpétsou, Veuve A. Sodjidé est mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle vit aujourd’hui d’une activité : la production du gari (farine à base du manioc). Son mari défunt, paysan de son vivant, n’a pas laissé un héritage aux orphelins. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants encore en âge scolaire, Madame A. achète du manioc sur les champs, le déterre et produit du gari qu’elle vend sur les marchés locaux. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour pouvoir acheter de grands champs de manioc afin d’augmenter sa production et répondre aux demandes du marché. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy cassava fields in order to augment her production of gari

loans.name: Mafwa

texts.en:
K. has been in his business since 1980. He started with $400, selling socks and general goods. K. was informed by his church about Hope’s programs. He decided to become a member of a loan group in 2004. Now K.’s business capital is around USD 800. He is happy with Hope’s loans and likes his business. He spends almost all of his time talking to his clients about their needs. K.’s vision is to become a wholesaler for his community, and through this he will not only grow his own business but also create jobs for others.

As the demand from people of his community and the neighboring area has increased, K. has not been able to satisfy their demand. With a $600 loan, he will be capable of providing goods for their needs.

loans.use: To increase inventory for retail

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her salon business and buy modern equipment

loans.name: Afiwagan

texts.en:
Afiwagan HOUKPATI has been married to a peasant for over 20 years. She has five children and was born in 1965 in Dévémé, where she lives now. Her business still involves commerce in the truck farming sector in which she buys bundles of vegetables from growers and sells them at the marketplace. The revenues from this business is how she provides for her children. She possesses a great deal of experience in her domain and is very popular in the area. While she turns a profit, she does so with very limited means. Today, she is requesting a loan of $550 to acquire more vegetable fields. She can then assert herself in the marketplace, particularly during periods of shortage. The loan will improve her revenues, as well as the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée à un paysan depuis une vingtaine d’années, Madame HOUKPATI Afiwagan est mère de cinq enfants. Elle est née en 1965 à Dévémé où elle vit actuellement. Son activité demeure l’achat des parcelles de légumes sur l’espace maraîcher et la revente dans les marchés. C’est d’ailleurs avec ces revenus qu’elle subvient aux besoins de ses enfants. Madame HOUKPATI Afiwagan possède une large expérience dans son commerce et est très populaire dans le milieu. Son activité est rentable mais elle l’exerce avec les moyens très limités Elle sollicite un crédit de $550 aujourd’hui pour acquérir d’autres espaces de légumes afin de s’imposer sur les marchés surtout en cette période de pénurie. Ceci pourra améliorer ses revenus de même que les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Commerce in vegetables

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo has a restaurant in the market where he sells breakfast, lunch and snacks. He started his business by borrowing 200 dollars from his brother. He started out selling breakfast only. With a lot of effort he now offers not only breakfast but lunch, snacks, and sweets.

Richard would use the loan to buy an industrial kitchen. This new tool would set the stage for the growth of his business, since he would be able to cook in much larger quantities.

Ricardo is 56 years old and married. He has 4 children, one of whom one is still in school. He depends entirely on his business to support his family. Ricardo has confidence that this loan will give him economic security and allow him to make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Ricardo tiene un comedor donde vende desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas en el mercado. Ricardo empezó su negocio prestando un dinero a su hermano de 200 dólares. Él empezó sólo vendiendo desayunos. Con mucho esfuerzo ahora él ofrece este mismo servicio junto a almuerzos, piqueos y golosinas.

Ricardo usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar una cocina industrial. Esta nueva herramienta de trabajo le facilitara el crecimiento de su negocio, ya que el podrá cocinar en cantidades mucho mas grandes.

Ricardo tiene 56 años, está unido tiene cuatro hijos uno de ellos estudia. Él depende completamente del negocio para apoyar a su familia. Ricardo tiene la confianza que este préstamo le dará seguridad económica a su familia y permitirle adecuar su vivienda.

loans.use: Buy an industrial kitchen

loans.name: Maman

texts.en:
Maman A. is a very energetic young lady. Making beignets (a kind of doughnut) has made her the favorite of her village. She is married to a peasant farmer, has five children that she supports, in addition to her brothers-in-law, making a total of nine persons in her household. To cover the numerous expenses of each day, she has invested the profits from selling sandals into purchasing wheat, oil, sugar, and other things to produce beignets. Schools are where she sells her beignets. These ingredients, bought at retail prices, are becoming very pricey for her. Today, she is requesting a loan of $750 to build a wholesale inventory of the sugar, flour, and oil that are necessary to increase her production. This plan will augment her revenues in order to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Maman est une jeune dame très dynamique. La production de ses beignets, fait d’elle le « chouchou » de la population de son village. Mariée à un paysan, elle est mère de cinq (5) enfants qu’elle supporte en plus de ses beaux frères, soit un total de neuf (9) personnes au foyer. Pour venir à bout de ses nombreuses dépenses quotidiennes, Madame A. Maman a investi les recettes tirées de la vente des sandalettes dans l’achat du blé, de l’huile, du sucre et autres pour produire des beignets qu’elle vend dans les établissements scolaires. Ces denrées alimentaires, achetées en détail reviennent très chères pour A.. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $750 qui va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en gros en sucres, farines de blé et en huile nécessaires pour augmenter la production de beignets. Ceci augmentera ses revenus afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock sugar, flour, and oil at wholesale prices for making beignets

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane B. N. is 35 years old, married, and a mother of four children. She lives in the vastly populated Kibera slum settlement in Nairobi city. Her husband is unemployed. All of her children attend junior school in grades one, two, four and six. She owns a small grocery business selling charcoal, water and fresh fruits and vegetables. This business has been in operation for the last nine years and is the main source of income for her family. However, Jane's earnings from the business are not enough to meet her family’s increasing needs. Overall, her business is doing well, since she has plenty of regular customers. The demand for her charcoal is high, because this is the commonly used fuel in the slum. The fruits and vegetables, too, sell quite well. Also, the water-vending business is successful, since many residents do not have tap water at their homes. Still, Jane would like to increase her earnings to be able to provide all the necessities for her family. To achieve this, she intends to expand the scope of her business operations. She wants to open up more water taps and increase the stock of fruit, vegetables and charcoal. Jane is requesting a loan of US$1000: US$250 for buying and installing two water meters and pipes, and US$750 for purchasing more charcoal, vegetables and fruits. She is a business-focused woman and will definitely be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more water taps and more stock for her busness

loans.name: Fiodjidé

texts.en:
Fiodjidé D. was widowed about 12 years ago. Born in 1965, she had left her parents for her husband in Dévémé, where she current resides with her four children. When her husband died, she turned to farming, a daily business activity she is very active in. Her business has won her fame, and everybody admires her daring bravery. Today, given the poor soil in her area, she is requesting a loan of $650 to buy fertilizer for improving the soil ahead of the next rainy season, already beginning. The loan will also increase her agricultural production. The realization of this dream will lead her to affect changes in growing techniques and to improve crop yields, as well as her living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame D. Fiodjidé est veuve depuis une dizaine d’année. Née en 1956, elle quitta ses parents pour son mari à Dévémé où elle réside actuellement avec ses quatre (04) enfants. A la mort de son époux, elle fait de l’agriculture, son activité quotidienne. Très active, son activité fait d’elle une femme connue de tous qui admirent sa bravoure. Aujourd’hui, compte tenu de la pauvreté des sols de sa localité, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour acheter des engrais afin de mieux enrichir son sol pour la prochaine saison des pluies qui s’annonce et augmenter sa production agricole. La réalisation de ce rêve pourra l’amener à changer de techniques culturales et à améliorer ses rendements et ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Doudou Madi

texts.en: K., married and father of one child, has been a vendor since 1998. He started his business with $100, selling electric items. K. works very hard and loves to see his business prosper. He has a plan with a loan of $500 to diversify his business by adding clothing. He operates an open-air shop in the local market. His long term plan is to move from an open-air shop to a shop indoors. K. has a dream that his business will one day become large and prosperous.

loans.use: To diversify his business by adding hardware supplies as well as various articles of clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Born in 1962, Kossi M. is married to a woman who is a farmer like he is. His wife only draws a meager income from her work. In his household are three people, including two children, all of whom are his responsibility. Educated through secondary school, he farms as his principal business activity, something he had formal training in. And it has done the trick for him financially. But the soil is poor, and it must be fertilized and otherwise treated. This requires money he does not have. And so he is requesting a loan of $950 to stock fertilizer for a successful harvest. The income will allow him to take better care of his children's health, nourishment, and schooling.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1962, Monsieur M. Kossi est un homme marié. Cultivatrice comme lui, sa femme n’a que le maigre revenu de son travail. Il est instruit de niveau secondaire. Monsieur M. compte à sa charge trois (3) personnes dont deux (2) enfants. Faisant de l’agriculture son activité principale, il a fait une formation en agriculture qui lui permet de tirer son épingle du jeu mais les sols étant pauvres, il est nécessaire de les fertiliser par des engrais et autres intrants. Ceci demande des moyens dont il ne dispose pas.. Il sollicite alors un crédit de $950 pour s’approvisionner en intrants afin d’enrichir le sol pour une bonne réussite des cultures. Les revenus de cette activité permettront à Monsieur M. de prendre mieux en charge ses enfants en matière de santé, de nourriture, de scolarité.

loans.use: To stock soil amendments for growing crops

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena has a restaurant in her home where she sells lunch and snacks. She started her business with the help of her sister, who helped her get the initial capital of $150. Like any microentrepreneur, she started small, selling only breakfast. With time she has been able to expand her business, and she now offers both breakfast and snacks during the day. She has also built a family cabana, which she rents out for social events. Lorena would use the loan to buy tables, chairs and a grill for the events. She has confidence that with the loan her business will grow.

Lorena is 20 years old. She is married with 2 children, one still in school. She supports her family with her business. Lorena is confident that this loan will give her economic security and allow her to make improvements to her home and save for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Lorena tiene un comedor donde vende almuerzos y meriendas en su domicilio. Lorena empezó su negocio con la ayuda de una hermana quien le facilitó un capital de $150 dólares. Como todo microempresario ella empezó con una operación pequeña solo vendiendo desayunos. Con el tiempo a podido ampliar su negocio y ahora ella ofrece este mismo servicio junto con meriendas. Además ha construido una cabaña familiar para alquilar en eventos sociales. Lorena usara el préstamo en la compra de mesas y sillas y una parrilla para los eventos. Ella tiene la seguridad que con préstamo su negocio crecerá.

Lorena tiene 20 años, esta unido tiene dos hijos uno de ellos estudia. Ella de su negocio apoya a su familia. Lorena tiene la confianza que este préstamo le dará seguridad económica a su familia y permitirle adecuar su vivienda y ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy tables, chairs and a grill

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en:
Alexandre A., age 35, lives in Agbanakin with his whole family. He was orphaned very early on, when his father died. To take over the responsibilities for his younger brothers, he started farming, especially sugar cane. Today, he has 10 years worth of experience in this domain and has reached a production level that proves his mastery of the business. He now plans on growing crops in the off-season to meet market demands in his area. Previous loans allowed him to grow his operation and to improve his crop yields through the use of herbicides. Presently, the procurement of selected cuttings and the purchase of a motorized irrigation pump are his concerns for which he is requesting a loan of $950. He can then increase his production. Accomplishing these goals will offer him a degree of financial stability that will allow his family to thrive and achieve its potential.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agé de 35 ans, Monsieur A. Alexandre est domicilié à Agbanakin avec toute sa famille. Devenu très tôt orphelin de père, et pour prendre en charge ses frères cadets, il s’est lancé dans l’agriculture et spécialement la culture de canne à sucre. Aujourd’hui, il a une expérience de 10 ans dans le domaine et a atteint un niveau de production dont il n’a plus la maîtrise. Il projette faire des cultures de contre saison afin de satisfaire toutes les demandes sur le marché de la localité. Les crédits précédents lui ont permis d’élargir son exploitation et d’améliorer le rendement par les traitements phytosanitaires. Aujourd’hui, l’approvisionnement en boutures sélectionnées et l’achat d’une motopompe sont ses préoccupations pour lesquelles il sollicite un montant de $950 en vue d'accroître sa production. La réalisation de ce projet lui offrira une stabilité financière qui permettra à sa famille de s’épanouir.

loans.use: Acquire selected cuttings and to buy a motorized pump for irrigation

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Kossi A. is a good and honest producer of the local liquor «sodabi» in his area. He is 35 years old, married, and the father of seven. His wife brings in no money, and so all family expenses fall upon his shoulders. In mastering his business, he has become a good manager. He has had to handle two consecutive loans, both of which he repaid without any problems. Presently, things are busy, and he needs sufficient funds to buy oil palms, from which sodabi is distilled. He is requesting financial support in the amount of $1,200 to buy several palm trees. His goal is to augment his production and furnish more of the drink to remote areas. This loan, once released, would really benefit him, since it will have a very positive impact on his production. And this will improve the socio-economic situation for him and his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Brave producteur de boisson locale « sodabi » dans sa localité, Monsieur A. Kossi est âgé de 55 ans, marié et père de sept (7) enfants. Sa femme n’a aucune activité de revenu ce qui fait que toutes les charges reposent sur Monsieur A.. Maîtrisant bien son activité, il en fait une bonne gestion. Il a eu à gérer deux fois de suite des crédits qu’il a remboursés sans difficulté. En cette période d’intenses activités, Mr A. a besoin suffisamment de fonds pour acheter des palmiers à huile. Il sollicite un appui financier de $1200 pour acheter beaucoup de palmiers à huile en vue d’augmenter sa production et fournir plus de boisson dans les zones reculées. Ce crédit ainsi débloqué lui serait très bénéfique puisqu’il aura un impact très positif sur son rendement ce qui améliorera sa situation socio-économique et celle de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy several oil palms to increase his production of a local drink

loans.name: Muka

texts.en: Muka started selling in 1988. He is married with two children. He sells purified water and women’s items, and provides bread to women for resale. His beginning business capital was $35. He began with a stock of 20 pairs of slippers. Muka got to know Hope’s programs through his church. In 2004, he decided to become a Hope member and began developing his plan of providing people in his community with purified water.  Muka has noticed that the demand for purified water in his neighbourhood has increased.  He also remarks that his purified water sales are contributing to the fight against diseases that are spread through contaminated water. With a loan of $725 Muka will meet the demand and people in his community will be healthier.

loans.use: He wants to buy a water purifying machine in order to expand his sales in purified water.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kimpo Elwa

texts.en: K., married with six children, has been in business since 1994. He started his business with the capital of $100. He increased his business capital to $600 by 1995. Attacked by armed thieves one day, they stole all of his merchandise and capital and his business closed. In 2001, K. resumed his general business with the capital of $150. He is planning with a loan of $700 to purchase children’s items such as clothing, shoes, school supplies, and baby clothing as there is a high demand for those goods.

loans.use: He wants to diversify his business by adding children’s items to his merchandise

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional hair-dressing equipment for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Mwamba

texts.en: M. sells food goods such as fish, eggs, tomatoes, milk, sugar, salt, canned foods, and other food items. He began selling in 1996 and signed a loan contract with Hope in 2004. M.’s clients have increased about three times since 2004. With a loan of $800, M. plans to increase his stock in food goods in order to meet the demand in his neighborhood. M. is married and has three children.

loans.use: He wants to triple his stock to meet the increasing demand for his food items.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has a shop in the market where he sells plasticware and a variety of other products. He began his business with merchandise his parents provided to help him get established in life. At first he just sold his plastic products door-to-door. But with a lot of effort David obtained a stall at the market where he sells plastic goods for the home. In addition, he sells school supplies and toys for kids. His business also includes a black-and-white photocopy service which he provides with an old machine that he bought second hand. David will use the loan to invest in wholesale school supplies since the new school year will start soon. He will continue to invest in other products to provide a diverse inventory for his customers. He is sure that with these new products his business will grow. David is 28 years old, single and has a son. He depends entirely on his business to support his family. David is sure that this loan will give his family financial security and will allow him to save for his son's education.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

David tiene un local en el mercado donde vende plásticos y todos tipos de articulos varios. El empezó su negocio con mercadería que le facilitaron sus padres para que el pueda salir adelante en su vida. Al principio solo vendía novedades en plásticos puerta a puerta. Pero con mucho esfuerzo David a puesto un local en el mercado local donde vende productos plásticos para el hogar. Ademas el vende materiales escolares y juguetes para niños. Su negocio también consiste de servicio de foto copias en blanco y negro que el ha podido realizar con una maquina vieja que compro de segunda mano. David usara el préstamo para invertir en materiales escolares al por mayor dado a que el año escolar nuevo empieza pronto. El seguirá invirtiendo en otros productos también para tener un diverso inventario para sus clientes. El tiene la seguridad que con estas nuevas variedades su negocio va ha tener un crecimiento. David tiene 28 años, esta soltero tiene un hijo. El depende completamente del negocio para apoyar a su familia. David tiene la confianza que este préstamo le dará seguridad económica a su familia y le permitirá ahorrar para la educación de su hijo.

loans.use: Invest in school supplies and other wholesale products

loans.name: Exito

texts.en:
Exito has a mechanics shop for auto body repair and paint jobs. Exito began his business after learning the trade by working in an auto shop with a friend for eight years. At first he just did auto repair. Now he also does auto body repair and auto painting. Exito will use the loan to invest in paints and tools. He's sure that with these new materials his business will grow. Exito is 42 years old, is married and has two children. He depends entirely on this business to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Éxito tiene un taller mecánico de enderezada y pintada de carros. Éxito empezó su negocio porque aprendió del oficio en un taller donde trabajo ocho años con un amigo. Al principio solo prestaba servicio de endererezada. Ahora el ofrece este mismo servicio junto con pintada de autos. Éxito usara el préstamo para invertir en pinturas y herramientas. El tiene la seguridad que con estos nuevos materiales su negocio va ha tener un crecimiento. Exito tiene 42 años, esta unido tiene dos hijos. El depende completamente del negocio para apoyar a su familia. Éxito tiene la confianza que este préstamo

loans.use: Invest in paint and tools

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny has a general store where she sells food staples, medicines and various items. Fanny started her business with the help of her husband, who motivated her to start the business with 200 dollars.

In the beginning she sold only pens, notebooks and soft drinks. Now she continues to offer those products, along with clothing, gifts and medicines. She would use the loan to buy a variety of merchandise at wholesale prices. Fanny has faith that her business will grow with the variety of items she will be able to offer her clients.

Fanny is 53 years old and married. She has four children. She is certain that her business will grow and allow her to move her family ahead. Fanny has hope that this loan will help her save to build a house and give her children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Fanny tiene una despensa donde vende viveres, medicinas y articulos varios. Fanny empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien la motivo para que emprendiera el negocio con 200 dólares.

Al principio solo vendían plumas, cuadernos, y colas. Ahora continúan ofreciendo este producto junto con ropa y regalos y medicinas. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar variedad de mercadería a precio de mayorista. Fanny tiene fe que su negocio crecerá con la variedad de articulos que ofrecerá a sus clientes.

Fanny tiene 52 años, unida, tiene cuatro hijos. Ella esta segura de que su negocio crecerá para salir adelante con su familia. Fanny tiene la esperanza de que este préstamo le ayudara ahorrar para construir su vivienda y darles educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy her products at wholesale prices

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Don Angel has borrowed from Kiva and Mifex previously. He has a stand in a local market in Bastion Popular where he sells yucca, plantains and avocadoes. He was able to use the first loan as planned; he invested in more of his products at wholesale prices. Angel was able to witness the immediate effects of the capital as his profits increased.

He and his wife have been steadily making improvements to their home and also saving up. They are now applying for a second Kiva loan in order to set up another point of sale. Their business is going so well they believe they can make additional profit from a new stand. This new stand will be run by Angel’s wife, who is his business partner and an integral part of their operation. They extend their gratitude to the community that helped them with their first loan, and hope they will continue to be benefactors of the Kiva system.

loans.use: Open a new stand where he'll sell his products

loans.name: Líder

texts.en:
Líder sells convenience products. He has 14 years of experience in this business. He started out working in a business and was able to save a small amount of capital. With his savings he left his job and was able to buy a plot of land where he could build his house and locate his business. From there he has grown his business. His wife and sons help him. He tends to the business from 6 AM unti 10 PM. His business is very well located and is the only store in the neighborhood. The growth of his business has allowed him to have his own house.

He needs the loan in order to buy more products: rice (wholesale), sugar, oil.

Lider was born in Manabí. He is 30 years old. He is married; his wife helps him in the business. They are very enterprising and reponsible people who from a very young age have worked to improve their quality of life. Thanks to their savings they have been able to buy their house, which was originally made of cane and wood and is now made of cement. Their business has also allowed them to give their children an education. Their dream is to continue running the store and grow the business, since it is a secure source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Líder se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad. Tiene 14 años de experiencia en ésta actividad. Comenzó trabajando en una empresa y pudo ahorrar un pequeño capital. Con sus ahorros dejó su trabajo y pudo adquirir un terreno para su casa y ubicar su negocio. Desde allí él ha crecido en el negocio. Su esposa y sus hijas le ayudan también. Él atiende de 6:00AM hasta 10:00PM. Su negocio esta muy bien ubicado y es el único en el sector. Su crecimiento en el negocio le ha permitido tener su casa.

Él necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos: arroz al por mayor, azúcar, aceite.

Líder nació en Manabí. Tiene 39 años. Con 3 hijos. Está casado y su esposa le ayuda en el negocio. Son personas muy emprendedoras, responsables, que desde muy joven han trabajado para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. Gracias a sus ahorros ellos han podido comprar su casa que antes era de caña y madera y ahora es de cemento. Su negocio también les ha permitido darles la educación a sus hijos. Su sueño es seguir manteniendo la tienda y crecer en el negocio ya que es una de las fuentes más segura.

loans.use: Buy rice (wholesale), sugar and oil.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda began selling perfumes and cosmetics two years ago for another person, who paid her a small percentage of the sales she made. She decided to apply for a loan to acquire credit for the purchase of products by Yanbel, a line of cosmetics and perfumes. She has been running her own business for a year as a microentrepreneur. The business has allowed her to generate more income for her family. Now she sells all types of cosmetics, fashion accessories and perfumes, particularly to the ladies of her neighborhood.

Glenda is applying for credit so that she'll be able to expand her business by buying products wholesale. She has noted an increase in demand and wants to be able to satisfy her clients by offering more products, and a greater variety of products.

Glenda is 48 years old. She is raising three children; only two are still in school. Her husband works as a mechanic and helps her in her business. With this investment, they hope to increase the profitability of the business, and as result, to further improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Glenda se inicio vendiendo perfumes y cosméticos desde hace 2 años para otra persona que le proporcionaba un mínimo porcentaje de utilidad. Ella decidió solicitar un préstamo para obtener crédito en productos de la línea Yanbal, que es una proveedora de cosméticos y perfumes. Ella ha manteniendo su negocio propio desde hace un año como microempresaria, el mismo que le ha permitido generar mayores ingresos para su familia. Ahora vende todos tipos de cosméticos, bisutería y perfumes, particularmente a sus vecinas de la comunidad.

Glenda solicita crédito para poder incrementar su negocio con compras al por mayor. Ella ha notado que su demanda ha aumentado y quiere poder satisfacer a sus clientes con más variedad y productos.

Glenda tiene 48 años y tiene 3 hijos que están a su cargo, pero solo 2 que estudian. Su esposo labora como mecánico y la apoya en su negocio. Espera con la inversión realizada mayor rentabilidad y así mejorar mas su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is married and has two children, one of whom is going to school. He has been at his business for the last two years, which he started with funds he got from selling his cow.

Given the loan, he wants to diversify his business by offering different clothing and materials to attract a wider clientele.

He hopes to use the profit to save for future business expansion and cater for his familys needs.

loans.use: Purchase of additional stock for his business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has been running her business since 1993, having dropped out of school due to a lack of school fees. She is married and has four children who are going to school. She started her business with $100 of capital. She has been trained in business management and loan use by Rafode. 

Given the funds, she wants to buy wholesale stock to reduce the cost, as buying them at retail leaves a small profit margin. This will enable her to also serve other surrounding markets, thereby increasing her income.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is married and has 9 children, four of them are still in school.  Her business involves selling a variety of foodstuffs such as porige, chapaties, and Nyoyo, which she serves to 
low-income people. She has been in this business since 1983 and has been able to sustain her family and provide for their daily needs.

Given the loan, she wants to buy foodstuffs in bulk to enable her to maintain serving lower class clients and reduce the cost of buying retail.  She also wants to buy utensils to replace old ones.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian has been in this business for the last four years.  She started the business with $120 of capital from her husband. She is married and has four childern who are in school. She is educated to level 12 and she takes care of her old parents.

Given the loan, she would like to increase her stock to enable her be able to serve her clients better. By buying the goods in bulk, she will benefit from reduced prices, which will translate into greater profit when selling the goods.

loans.use: purchase additional stock for her business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in the Vituka area in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She owns a shop selling different consumable items. She aims at increasing the stock of soft drinks.  Soft drinks have high turn-over in her shop. The demand of soft drinks in Dar es Salaam is high because of the weather -- it is hot throughout the year. The profit margin of soft drinks, mainly Coca-Cola, is high if a retailer buys more than 50 crates at a time. 

Amina had entrepreneurship and small business training from YOSEFO. She knows how to plan efficient stock levels.

The loan requested will enable Amina to purchase a profitable level of stock. She is asking for a loan of US$750.

loans.use: Add stock of cold drinks to her store.

payments.comment: Amina's business has of the recent grown so fast and has been able to pay back the loan within a short time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine for tailoring

loans.name: Deogratius

texts.en: Deogratius is 44 years old and married with  four children. He owns a hardware shop selling construction equipment and materials. Construction of houses in the area is on the rise. Deogratius is planning to add electrical items on the shop, because he learned that people usually like to find all the items they want under one roof. Deogratius needs USD 1,200 to purchase the new stock.

loans.use: Add stock to his hardware shop.

payments.comment: Deo's business has of the recent grown and has been able to pay the loan within  a short time than earlier agreed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate and expand her restaurant

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 34 years old and married with two children. Grace is an ambitious person. She started a grocery business selling cold drinks last year. The business is doing great, and she has built a good relationship with her customers.

Her plans for this year are to improve her store with a wider variety of products and increased sales. The increased sales will help her earn more income to sustain the family. She needs USD 750.

loans.use: Add stock of cold drinks

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 37 years old and married with three children. She lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. Irene sells kerosene retail using a hand-driven fuel pump which draws kerosene from a tank dug into the ground. She has been in this business for more than five years.

Most people in the area use kerosene as fuel for cooking and boiling drinking water. The area has no public water services, so people depend on water from shallow wells. Waterborne deseases are common, especially cholera and amoebic dysentery.

Irene plans to improve her business by adding another storage tank, which will act as a cushion against stockouts. Stockouts are not desirable in business, as they may chase away customers. Irene does not want to lose her customers as she has built a long-term relationship with them. She needs a capital boost of USD 1,200.

loans.use: Purchase an additional kerosene storage tank.

payments.comment: Irene's business has grown so fast that she is in need of another loan very soon

loans.name: Mponela

texts.en: Mponela lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. He is married with two children. He owns a retail shop near his residence. The shop sells different consumable items, especially food items and rice in particular. Rice is one of the staple foods in Tanzania. Mponela plans to increase his stock of rice. There is an expectation of a rice price rise due to poor harvest last year. Having enough stock now will help him make more money later. The strategy will help him increase income so he can sustain the family and pay for school fees for his children. The extra stock demands more funding. Through his savings he managed to contribute 12% of the required stock.  To implement his plan Mponela needs USD 550 as a working capital.

loans.use: To purchase stock of rice

loans.name: Lusekelo

texts.en: Lusekelo lives in the Vituka area in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She is married with six children. She owns a shop selling soft drinks both retail and wholesale. She has another business, which her sister is in charge of, selling fruit and vegetables. The soft drink business has higher turnover in her shop, mainly caused by the hot weather of Dar es Salaam. Demand for soft drinks is high, and Lusekelo can not meet this demand. She is in need of USD 1,200 as working capital to meet her expectations. She has a challenge meeting school expenses for her children.

loans.use: Add stock of cold drinks.

payments.comment: LUSEKELO is a hard working lady, her business has grown so fast of the recent, that she has been able to pay back the loan and needs another one very soon

loans.name: Despina

texts.en:
Despina lives in the Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children; two are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Despina keeps chickens -- both broilers and layers. She supplies chicken meat and eggs to different private secondary schools in the Temeke district of Dar es Salaam. She has been in this business seven years. 

Despina cannot meet the demand from her customers. She wants to increase her flock from 400 birds to 600 birds. The huts also need expansion and her stock of medications needs to be increased. The additional capital of USD 550 will help her do this. The expansion strategy will help her  increase her income, which will facilitate paying school fees. Next year her third-born will join secondary school.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is married with four children. She lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. Her two sons are in secondary school. Anna is self-employed and owns a shop near her residence. The shop sells different consumable items, mainly food, which have high demand. Anna is an opportunistic type of person, and she cannot let the opportunity go. She opened this shop six years ago after learning that people in her area had to travel a long way to market for food items. The shop provides her with an income to raise her children, as her husband's income alone cannot meet all family requirements. She would like to expand her business so that she can meet the costs of educating her children. The shop employs her and her sister. To expand her business Anna needs USD 550.

loans.use: Add stock of goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her crafts and recycable material collecting business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and pay for license

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: I am a 31-year-old father of one.  I take care of 3 other children. My life will improve because I will be able to pay the school fees for the 2 in secondary school. I want the loan to enable me to earn a profit of US $3 a day.

loans.use: Expand and pay for license

loans.name: Gerishom

texts.en: I am a 32-year-old father of 4.  I take care of 3 other children. My life will improve because I will be able to pay the school fees for my brother in secondary school.

loans.use: Expand my business

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: I am a 25-year-old father of one. I intend to diversify my business to include clothes.

loans.use: Expand my business

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: I am a 28-year-old father of 2.  I sell roasted corn. I do my business to meet the basic needs of food and shelter for my family. I want the loan to enable me to earn a profit of US $2 a day.

loans.use: Expand and improve my business

loans.name: Berly

texts.en: I am a 34-year-old mother of 2. I am a petty trader, dealing in small house goods.  I take care of 2 other children. My life will improve because I will be able to pay the school fees for the 2 in secondary school. I want the loan to enable me to earn a profit of US $3 a day.

loans.use: Expand my business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hairdressing equipment and renovate and expand her hair salon.

loans.name: Wilbad

texts.en: I am a single man. I am head of a 6 family household. I am a petty trader. I am the main bread earner. I dropped out of school to take care of my siblings after the death of our parents due too HIV/AIDs in 2005.

loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify business to include fruit vending.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose started her business in 1998 with $1600 from her husband. She is married and has nine children, five of whom are still in school. She has been trained by Rafode on loan management and business skills and she has managed this business since she started it.

Given the loan, she wants to buy more stock for her grocery store to meet the increasing demand from clients.

The profit she makes helps her to pay for school fees and medical care for her family.

loans.use: purchase of additional goods for her business

loans.name: Kezia

texts.en:
Kezia is married with two children, she started her business with capital of $1100 which she borrowed from the group in 2005. Since then she has expanded the business. She has been trained by Rafode in business management and loan utilization.

Given the loan she intends to purchase additional stock to enable her to serve a variety of clients.

loans.use: purchase of additional stocks for her business

loans.name: Wilbad

texts.en: I am a single man. I am the head of a 6-person household. I am a petty trader, and I am the main bread-earner. I dropped out of school to take care of my siblings after the death of our parents from HIV/AIDS in 2005.

loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business to include fruit vending.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina has been in the business of running a beauty shop since 1982. She started with $100 of capital. She has taken loans from different institutions and paid them off. This has helped her expand her business and meet her familys needs. She has six children in school and their fees are paid through the income from the business. 

Given the loan, she wants to expand her business to increase her income. This will enable her to have funds to pay for the childrens school fees and also for her family.

loans.use: purchase of additional stock

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: I am a 56-year-old grandmother of 15. I sell fruits. I take care of 9 grandchildren. Their parents passed on due to HIV/AIDS. I do this business to meet the basic needs of food and shelter for my grandchildren.

loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Dzombo

texts.en: I am a 27-year-old father of 2.  I sell second-hand clothes. I take care of 2 other children. My life will improve because I will be able to pay the school fees for my brother in secondary school.

loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.en:
Ayaba N. is 58 years old and lives in Agbanakin (Les Lacs prefecture), where she runs a business selling smoked fish. Having six people to look after, she lives day after day on a meager income from this business of hers. For 20 years, she has been utilizing a traditional business arrangement, in which she acquires fish on credit from fishermen and then pays them back after selling the smoked fish. This arrangement prevents her from doing well or from meeting family needs.

Her experience with the «tontine» system (which is a kind of group savings/investment system) and tontine loans has, little by little, given her a certain financial independence. However, her goal is to pay for the fish up front from now on, to increase her production of smoked fish, and to augment her income. To accomplish this, she is requesting a loan of $800 to construct the new ovens and grills necessary for her business to succeed. This financing will make a noticeable difference in reducing poverty in her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 58 ans, Madame N. Ayaba vit à Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs où elle mène son activité : la vente des poissons fumés. Avec six personnes en charge, elle vit au jour le jour avec les maigres recettes de son activité. C’est une activité qu’elle exerce depuis 20 ans avec un système traditionnel qui consiste à prendre le poisson à crédit chez les pêcheurs et payer ces derniers après la vente. Ce qui ne lui permet de faire une bonne affaire et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

L’expérience de tontine et de crédit qu’elle a entreprises lui donne peu à peu une autonomie financière et c’est dans le but de payer désormais comptant les poissons, multiplier sa production et augmenter ses recettes qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour fabriquer de nouveaux fours et grilles nécessaires à la réussite de ses activités. Le financement de ce projet contribue à réduire sensiblement l’état de misère de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fish and build new ovens and grills for smoking fish

loans.name: Akouanvi

texts.en:
Akouanvi D., age 35, has been a merchant for ten years. She currently lives in the village of Agbanakin (in Les Lacs prefecture) and is married and the mother of two. Concerned about providing for her family and to create a proper way to live, she became specialized in stocking grains. Although a worthwhile endeavor, it is under-financed. So she is requesting a loan of $850 to buy sacks and some other items and materials for safekeeping her inventory of grains. She can then stock sizeable quantities of corn and thus meet the current high demand for it. The loan will also serve as working capital that will secure her income, which should reach a substantial level.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame D. Akouanvi est commerçante depuis 10 ans et vit actuellement dans le village d’Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs. Agée de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Soucieuse de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de lui créer un cadre de vie décent, elle s’est spécialisée dans le stockage de céréales très rentable mais peu financé. Elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui lui permettra d’acheter des sacs et des produits de conservation afin de faire un stock important de maïs et répondre ainsi à la demande qui est très forte. Ce fond lui servira également de fond de roulement, ce qui va sécuriser son revenu qui deviendra dès lors consistant.

loans.use: To buy materials for keeping grain, and to buy and stock up on corn

loans.name: Yao

texts.en:
Born on January 31, 1975 in Aného in the Lakes region, Mr. Yao A. is a devoted, dynamic and very intelligent young man. Because of his parent's lack of means, he had to leave his studies to start a business in Lomé.

Today, he is married and a father of a child with another dependant, and his wife is a housewife. He is able to provide for his family's needs by selling poplin fabric. Although he has a very average level of edication, he has an entrepreneurial spirit and has been able to successfully manage and refund credits previously given to him. To this end, he is asking for a $900 loan to purchase supplies for his business. The benefits from this financing will be used to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 31 janvier 1975 à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs, Monsieur A. Yao est un jeune homme dévoué, dynamique et très intelligent. Par manque de moyens de la part de ses parents, il a dû abandonner ses études pour se lancer dans le commerce à Lomé. Aujourd’hui, père de famille avec un enfant et une autre personne à charge, sa femme est ménagère. Il subvient aux besoins de la famille par les bénéfices tirés de la vente de tissus popeline en détails. Avec un niveau d’étude très moyen, il a un esprit d’entreprenariat et une capacité de gérer un crédit et de le rembourser. A cet effet, il sollicite, un crédit de $900 pour s’approvisionner en gros. Les bénéfices qui découleront du financement de ses activités commerciales serviront à améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: Poplin fabric sales

loans.name: Razak

texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Lomé in the Gulf region, Mr. Razak C. is married and a father of a child. He stopped his secondary studies after failing the BEPC (a local examination) and started learning about tailoring. He is now a tailor and embroiderer and has a small workshop with a saleswoman in Hountigomé in Lomé.

With the aim to increase his profits, he would now like to open a small textile shop in his workshop. To this end, he is asking for a credit of $600 for the first time. With his tailoring experience and management capabilities, this credit will give him a second chance, economically, to improve his standard of living.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1977 à Lomé dans la préfecture du golfe, Monsieur C. Razak est marié et père d’un enfant. C’est un homme qui a arrêté ses études secondaires après un échec au BEPC pour rentrer dans l’apprentissage de la couture. Il est actuellement tailleur brodeur de formation et a un petit atelier avec une femme vendeuse de produits divers, tous vivant à Hountigomé à Lomé. Voulant augmenter le bénéfice qu’il tire de son métier, il désire ouvrir une petite mercerie dans son atelier. A cet effet, il sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit de $600 . Avec son expérience de couturier et la capacité de gestion qu’il a acquis, ce financement lui donnera un second souffle sur le plan économique, ceci pour améliorer son niveau de vie.

loans.use: Opening of a textile shop in his tailoring workshop

loans.name: Têko

texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Aklakou, Mrs. Têko N. lives in Agbanakin in the Lakes region. She is married and a mother of two children and takes care of four other people. Her main income comes from selling food staples. However, the profits are directly applied to cover her family's expenses and it is difficult for her to start her business.

To this end, she is asking for a loan of $650 with which she can set up her business and buy corn, wood and charcoal supplies. She believes that, if it is financed, the income from her business will help her provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1969 à Aklakou, Madame N. Têko est domicilié à Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants et en charge quatre autres personnes. La principale activité qui lui génère des revenus est la vente des denrés alimentaires. Les recettes qu’elle fait rentrent directement dans les dépenses familiales. Il lui est difficile alors de réunir un fond consistant pour se relancer. Elle sollicite pour l’occasion, une somme de $650 avec laquelle elle aura à aménager son cadre de travail et faire un stock important de maïs, de bois et de charbons de bois. Elle est confiante en ce qui concerne la rentabilité de son projet qui l’aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille si seulement s’il est financé.

loans.use: Setting up her business, storage of corn, wood and coal

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Born on June 31, 1978 in Mission Tové in the Zio region, Mr. Kossi A. is a married father of two (02) children. He is a motorcycle taxi driver and his wife is a saleswoman who helps with the household needs and education of their children.

However, this income is insufficient for their needs and he is requesting for the first time a credit of $800 for the end of this month, to buy at motorcycle taxi. His current motorcycle often breaks down and does not even belong to him. He works and gives the income to the owner who pays him in return. With his own motorcycle, he will work freely and for himself. The realization of this project will make it possible to improve the living conditions of all his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 31 juin 1978 à Mission Tové dans la préfecture de Zio, Monsieur A. Kossi est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Il est chauffeur de taxi moto avec une femme revendeuse qui l’aide dans les besoins du foyer et dans la scolarisation des enfants. Ces revenus étant insuffisants, il sollicite pour la première fois pour la fin de ce mois un crédit de $800 pour s’acheter un taxi moto, car la moto actuelle trop vieille tombe souvent en panne et ne lui appartient même pas. Il travaille et rend compte au propriétaire qui le paie en retour. Acec sa propre moto, il travaillera librement et pour lui-même. La réalisation de ce projet permettra d'améliorer les conditions de vie de toute sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Alougba

texts.en:
Mrs. Alougba K. is 56 years old and lives in the village of Agbanakin in the Lakes region. She has been a widow for five years, and is now the only one taking care of her six children, of which the oldest are unemployed. She specializes in the production and marketing of palm oil, commonly called "red oil" in the region. This is a business which she has undertaken for more than fifteen years; an activity which she has fully mastered.

She refunded all previously received loans, which have enabled her to have a more or less steady income. We the aim of securing and increasing her income to be able to provide to her family's needs, she is asking for a loan of $550 to buy palm nuts and wood in bulk for the production of oil.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 56 ans, Madame K. Alougba vit dans le village d’Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs. Veuve depuis cinq ans, elle est la seule à prendre en charge ses six enfants dont les plus âgés sont sans emploi. Elle est spécialisée dans la production et la commercialisation de l’huile de palme communément appelée « huile rouge ». C’est une activité qu’elle mène depuis plus de quinze ans ; ainsi dit, c’est une activité dont elle maîtrise tous les rouages. Les prêts précédemment reçus et remboursés lui ont permis d’avoir un revenu plus ou moins régulier. Dans le souci d’accroître et de sécuriser ce revenu afin de pouvoir subvenir totalement aux besoins de sa famille, elle demande un crédit de $550 pour acheter en quantité des noix de palme, des bois pour la production de l’huile en conséquence.

loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts and heating wood

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Born on December 27, 1984 in Lomé, Mr. Jean A. has a secondary school education and is specialized in rewinding (electronics repair). He lives with his cousin because of his lack of means. He is not married but has a child. It has been one year since he has completed his training, but he has not managed to provide for his family's needs because of their poor living conditions. He would like to have his own workshop and work to improve his standard of living.

To this end, he is asking for a credit of $600 for the first time in order to open his rewinding workshop and buy essential materials that would improve his working conditions. The realization of this project will help him nurture his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 27 décembre 1984 à Lomé, Monsieur Jean A. avec un niveau d’étude secondaire, est spécialisé dans le rebobinage. Il vit chez son cousin par manque de moyens. Il est célibataire avec un enfant. Sorti de l’apprentissage depuis un an, il n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins de la famille à cause de son niveau de vie très misérable. Il désire avoir son propre atelier et travailler pour améliorer ses conditions de vie. Pour cela, il sollicite pour la première fois un crédit de $600 afin d’ouvrir son atelier de rebobinage et de s’acheter des matériels indispensables à son travail pour justement l’amélioration de ses conditions de travail. Ce projet réalisé, permettra le plein épanouissement dans sa famille.

loans.use: Open a electronics repair workshop and purchase necessary materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his tailoring business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: I am a 29-year-old widower with two children. I am a vehicle mechanic.  I am HIV positive. I intend to use the loan to build skill and increase my income.

loans.use: I will use the loan to purchase vehicle repair tools.

loans.name: Poupouvi

texts.en:
Mrs. Poupouvi A. lives in Agbanakin where she has an aluminium products business. A mother of three children, she takes care of six other people and lives with her husband who has been without employment for two years. With nine years in this business, Mrs. Poupouvi A. has acquired a considerable amount of experience. She is well known in her region because of her mobility, since she sells from door to door and is often very tired.

Wanting to settle, she is asking for a loan of $700 to build a hangar where she will display her products. Moreover, this will provide her with the capital which will enable her to regularly buy supplies and to improve her income and precarious living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Poupouvi est domiciliée à Agbanakin où elle mène ses activités de commerce de produits en aluminium. Mère de trois enfants, elle a en charge six autres personnes et vit avec son mari qui est sans emploi depuis deux ans. Avec neuf ans d’ancienneté dans cette activité, Madame A. Poupouvi a acquis une expérience non négligeable en la matière. Reconnue dans toute la localité par sa mobilité, parce qu’elle vend de porte à porte et souvent très fatiguée. Voulant s’installer, elle sollicite un montant de $700 pour construire un hangar sous lequel elle fera son étalage. En plus, elle aura un fond de roulement qui lui permettra de s’approvisionner régulièrement et d’améliorer son revenu et ses conditions de vie précaires.

loans.use: Construction and supply of hangar

loans.name: Koévi

texts.en:
A sigle man without children, Mr. Koévi A. was born in 1984 in Kévé. He is an electronics repair person by training, however, he has had insufficient means to supply himself with working materials, and has thus chosen to buy and sell motorcycle spare parts.

He is asking for a credit of $900 with the aim of opening his own workshop where he will sell spare parts. The profits from this business will enable him to refund the credit in time and will improve his quality of life from the economic and financial point of view.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Célibataire sans enfant, Monsieur A. Koévi est né en 1984 à Kévé. Etant rebobineur de métier et par manque de moyen pour s’approvisionner en matériels de travail, il a alors opté pour l’achat et la vente des pièces détachées pour moto. Dans le souci d’ouvrir à présent son propre atelier auquel il associera la vente des pièces détachées, il sollicite un crédit de $900. Les bénéfices tirés des ces activités lui permettront de rembourser à temps et amélioreront sa qualité de vie sur le plan économique et financier.

loans.use: Opening of a electronics repair workshop and selling spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Lomé, Mrs. Marie A. is a mother of two (02) children. With an unemployed husband and without other means, she sells iced water at the market to be able to provide for the family. In order to build her business, she is asking for a fourth credit of $800 to buy a larger freezer. The purchase of this large freezer will enable her to have enough fresh water to satisfy all the customers in time because they often complain about the lack of fresh water. Once this is accomplished, the standard of living of the family will undoubtedly improve.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1972 à Lomé, Madame A. Marie est mère de deux (02) enfants. Avec un mari chômeur et sans moyens, elle vend de l’eau glacée au marché pour subvenir au besoin de la famille. En vue de développer son commerce, elle sollicite un quatrième crédit de $800 pour s’acheter un congélateur plus grand. L’acquisition de ce grand congélateur lui permettra d'avoir assez d'eau fraîche pour satisfaire tous les clients à temps car ces derniers se plaignent souvent du manque d’eau fraîche. Ceci réalisé, le niveau de vie de la famille sera amélioré à coup sûr.

loans.use: To buy a larger freezer for selling iced water

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Born in 1967 in Agbanakin in the Lakes region, Mrs. Christine A. is a married mother of four children, all of them still in school. In addition to her children, she also takes care of her parents. A very devoted woman, her main income comes from the sale of rice and doughnuts. It is a business she has been doing for nerly eleven years.

Having received several loans in the past, she has acquired new skills in managing credit and her business.
