Today, she is asking for a $700 credit which will enable her to rearrange her workplace by constructing a hangar under which she will sell her products and store a larger quantity of rice in this production period. All this will enable her to increase her income and therefore, improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1967 à Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs, Madame A. Christine est mariée et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus de ces enfants, elle prend en charge quatre personnes dont ses parents. Très dévouée, elle a comme activité génératrice de revenu, la vente du riz et de beignets. C’est une activité qu’elle mène depuis près de onze ans. Par les crédits successifs reçus, elle a acquis un certain nombre d’expériences en gestion de crédit et de son activité. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit à concurrence de $700 qui lui permettra de réaménager son lieu de travail avec la construction d’un hangar sous lequel elle va vendre ses produits et de stocker une grande quantité de riz en cette période d’abondance. Tout ceci lui permettra d’améliorer son revenu et partant, améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Building of a hangar for storing rice

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Lomé, Mrs. Ayaba T. is married to a teacher and is a mother of a child. The income of her husband, a substitute teacher, is too low to provide for the needs of the household; therefore, she started selling cloths in the Hédzranawoé market.

Today, in spite of her hard work, due to her limited means, her business has not taken off. In order to increase her buying capacity in department stores and contribute to her household needs with an increased profit, she is asking for a credit of $800 which will be used as capital for the purchase and sale of the fabrics. Thus her family will have a better standard of living.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1970 à Lomé, Madame T. Ayaba est mariée à un enseignant et est mère d’un enfant. Le revenu du mari, un enseignant vacataire, étant trop bas, pour suppléer le dans les besoins du ménage, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes au marché de Hédzranawoé. Aujourd’hui, malgré son dévouement et avec le peu de moyen dont elle dispose, son commerce n’arrive pas à décoller. En vue d’augmenter sa capacité d’achat dans les grands magasins et réaliser un profit maximal pour contribuer aux charges du ménage, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l'achat et la vente des tissus pagnes. Ainsi sa famille connaîtra un niveau de vie meilleur.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of textiles

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: I am a 33-year-old married man with 3 children.I have a food kiosk.  My business is located in the outskirts of Kisumu. With the loan, I intend diversify and improve my business.

loans.use: I will rebuild the kiosk and diversify food sales.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Born in 1968 in Lomé, Mrs. Rose B. is married to an unemployed accountant and has two (02) dependent children. In this difficult situation, she chose to go into business and began selling fabrics. She is the only one taking care of the household needs, since her husband is unemployed and cannot contribute financially.

In spite of Mrs. B.'s continued efforts, her family's financial situation keeps worsening, since her business is not profitable enough. She is asking for a loan of $800 for the first time, to increase her capacity of buying textiles in department stores at a reduced cost, which would result in a bigger profit margin that will in turn help her provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1968 à Lomé, Madame B. Rose est mariée à un comptable en chômage et a deux (02) enfants à charge. Dans cette situation difficile, elle opta pour le commerce et commença la vente des tissus pagnes. Elle s’occupe seule des besoins du ménage étant donné que son mari ne pouvait rien apporter financièrement car lui aussi est au chômage. Malgré les efforts permanents de madame B., la situation financière de la famille ne cesse de s’aggraver, puisque ses activités commerciales également ne sont pas trop rentables. Pour augmenter sa capacité d’achat des pagnes dans les grands magasins à un coût réduit afin de dégager une marge bénéficiaire importante et subvenir à tous les besoins de sa famille, elle sollicite pour la première fois un financement de $800 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce.

loans.use: Wholesale and resale of fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her beauty salon business

loans.name: Hélène

texts.en:
Born on September 19, 1977 in Lomé, Mrs. Hélène N. is married to an automechanic with whom she has three (03) children. Although she has a very average education, she has a business of selling cloths which helps her husband with the household needs, since his work is not very successful.

A courageous and dynamic woman, rigorous and a good manager of finances, she would like to increase her capital to purchase cloths in the department stores and increase her profit that will in turn help her with her family's needs. She is asking for a $500 loan, which will help her buy and sell high-quality loincloths.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 19 septembre 1977 à Lomé, Madame N. Hélène s’est mariée à un mécanicien de voiture avec qui elle a eu trois (03) enfants. Commerçante de pagnes avec un niveau d’étude très moyen, elle aide son mari dans les charges du foyer, les activités de ce dernier ne marchent pas tellement. Femme courageuse, dynamique, rigoureuse et dotée d’une capacité de gestion des finances, elle désire augmenter son fonds de commerce pour s’approvisionner en pagnes dans les grands magasins afin de réaliser un profit maximum pour mieux aider son mari dans les charges du foyer. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un financement de $500 qui lui permettra d'acheter et de vendre des pagnes de grande qualité.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of fabrics

loans.name: Honore

texts.en:
A father of three children, Mr. Honoré G. is a well known livestock breeder in the village of Agbanakin in the Lakes region. In addition to his children, he takes care of four other people including his parents. At 37 years of age, he already has seventeen years of experience in breeding pigs, which he started by modernizing.

The stocking of pig feed as well as veterinary care require important financial means. To modernize and make his activity profitable, Mr. G. is asking for a loan of $950 which will enable him to reinforce the fence of the pigs in the short run, to restock the feed and to buy new species of pigs. This will enable him to reach a level of business with a consistent and regular income that will help him provide for the needs for his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Père de trois enfants, Monsieur G. Honoré est un éleveur de renommé dans le village d’Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs. En plus de ses enfants, il prend en charge quatre autres personnes dont ses parents. A 37 ans, il a déjà une expérience de dix sept ans dans l’élevage qu’il a commencé par moderniser. La nutrition des porcs exige de lui de gros moyens financiers pour l’approvisionnement. Il en est de même pour les soins vétérinaires. Pour moderniser et rentabiliser son activité, Monsieur G. sollicite un prêt de $950 qui lui permettra à court terme de renforcer la clôture des porcs, de faire l’approvisionnement en provende et d’acheter de nouvelles espèces de porcs. Ceci lui permettra d’atteindre un niveau de professionnalisme avec un revenu consistant et régulier pour ainsi subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Reinforce fence and stock pig feed

loans.name: Yawolé

texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Kara in the Kozah region of north Togo, Mr. Yawolé A. is not married and has no children. Since he could not continue his secondary studies, he started small commercial activities. Devoted and dynamic, he specializes in manufacturing palm oil which he sells in the markets in Lomé. To increase his buying capacity during the production periods, and to maximize his profit, he is asking for a credit of $500 for the first time. He is a young entrepreneurial man who deserves support and a financial means to allow him to take care of himself.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1977 à Kara dans la préfecture de la Kozah au nord du Togo, Monsieur A. Yawolé est célibataire sans enfant. N’ayant pas eu la chance de continuer ses études secondaires, il s’est lancé dans de petites activités commerciales. Dévoué et dynamique, il est spécialisé dans la fabrication de l’huile de palme qu’il vend dans les marchés de Lomé. Pour augmenter sa capacité d’achat dans les zones de production, et réaliser un profit maximum, il sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit de $500 . C’est un jeune homme très entreprenant qui mérite un soutien et un appui financier pour lui permettre de se prendre en charge.

loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts for manufacture and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Fisher by profession for twenty years, Mr. Faustin D. was born in 1966 in Agbanakin, where he currently lives. Having five people in his care, his only job is fishing, which is his main income-generating activity. The loans he obtained previously allowed him to buy a pirogue (fishing boat), and now, he has a certain freedom compared to his peers. This pirogue does not work as it used to and needs to be replaced; this requires means which he does not have.

Conscious of the danger facing him and the need to buy another pirogue and new nets, he is asking for a loan of $950 to deal with this. The loan will also serve to construct a shed where women will come to buy his fish; this will make his business competitive, give him financial autonomy, and allow him to decently meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Pêcheur de profession depuis vingt ans, Monsieur D. Faustin est né en 1966 à Agbanakin où il vit actuellement. Ayant cinq personnes en charge, il ne pratique que la pêche qui constitue pour lui sa principale activité génératrice de revenu. Les crédits précédemment reçus lui ont permis d’acheter une pirogue et aujourd’hui, il a une certaine autonomie vis-à-vis de certains de ses pairs. Cette pirogue ne répond plus tellement et mérite d’être remplacé ; ceci nécessite des moyens dont il ne dispose pas.

Conscient du danger qui le menace et le besoin d’acheter une autre pirogue et des filets neufs, il sollicite un crédit de $950 pour y faire face. Le crédit servira également à construire un hangar sous lequel les femmes viendront acheter des poissons ; ce qui rendra compétitive son activité et va lui conférer une autonomie financière et subvenir de façon décente aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a new pirogue (fishing boat), nets and to build a shed

loans.name: Comlan

texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Cotonou, Mr. Comlan B. is married and has three (03) children. As a mechanic, his job barely supports him, and he meets the needs of his family through pain and suffering because of a lack of work.

So, to avoid staying inactive during times when he is not working, he has decided to begin an income-generating business to make ends meet.

For this reason, he is asking for a loan of $800 to buy a motorcycle taxi. The fares obtained will allow him to repay this loan and will also give him the means to better meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1969 à Cotonou, Monsieur Comlan B., est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Mécanicien de profession, une activité qui ne lui sourit guère, il arrive avec peine et souffrance à subvenir aux besoins elémentaires de sa famille par manque de travail.

Aussi, pour ne pas rester inactif pendant que son travail ne marche pas, il a décidé d’entreprendre une activité génératrice de revenu afin de pouvoir joindre les deux bouts.

C’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un financement de $800 pour s’acheter un taxi moto. Les recettes réalisées permettront de rembourser ce financement et aussi lui donneront les moyens de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase taioring equipment and expand her business

loans.name: Lokossi

texts.en:
At 64 years of age, Mrs. Lokossi M. is a widow with five (05) children in her care. She has lived in Agbanakin for twenty years with her family. The production and marketing of palm nut oil generates income for her, and is a business she engages in with passion and love. It is a tiresome job in that it requires removing the shells and sorting the nuts before using them. But often she does not produce a large quantity of oil due to a lack of means.

To make her work more profitable so as to feed herself and her family and to have financial autonomy, Mrs. M. is asking for a loan of $650 to buy a nutcracker which will allow her to shell the nuts. The rest of the amount will allow her to stock up on nuts and to buy cans for the packaging of her oil. She will then always have oil to sell and can increase her sales.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 64 ans, Madame M. Lokossi est veuve avec cinq enfants en charge. Elle vit à Agbanakin depuis vingt ans avec sa famille. La production et la commercialisation d’huile de noix palmiste constituent son activité génératrice de revenus qu’elle exerce avec passion et amour. C’est une activité très pénible dans la mesure où il faut enlever la coque, trier les noix avant d’en faire usage. Mais souvent elle n’en produit pas en grande quantité faute de moyens.

Pour rentabiliser cette activité afin de pouvoir se nourrir, nourrir sa famille et avoir une autonomie financière, Madame M. demande un crédit de $650 afin d’acheter une concasseuse qui lui permettra de concasser les noix. Le reste de la somme lui servira de stocker des noix et d’acheter des bidons pour le conditionnement de son huile. Elle pourra alors disposer à tout moment d’huile et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire.

loans.use: To buy a nutcracker, canner, and to stock up on palm nuts

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Born in 1982 in Benin, Mr. Eric G. is a master upholsterer in the Nukafu quarter in Lomé. His wife is a homemaker and they have two (02) children.

After stopping his studies in primary school, he began an apprenticeship as an upholsterer. He then opened a small workshop which does not run much, rendering his and his family's financial situation very difficult : he is unable to meet the needs of his family.

He thus had the idea to sell foam in his shop to increase his income.

To realize this dream, he is asking for a loan of $600 to buy and sell foam and mattresses. He is a hard-working young man who needs financial support to get his life off the ground.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1982 au Bénin, Monsieur Eric G. est maître tapissier au quartier Nukafu à Lomé. Marié à une femme ménagère et père de deux (02) enfants.

Après avoir arrêté ses études au cours primaire, il entra en apprentissage comme tapissier. Il ouvrit par la suite un petit atelier qui ne marche pas tellement rendant sa situation économique et celle de sa famille très difficile : il n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

Il eut donc l’idée de vendre lui-même des mousses dans son atelier pour augmenter son revenu.

Pour réaliser ce rêve, il sollicite un crédit de $600 pour l'achat et vente des mousses et matelas. C’est un garçon travailleur qui nécessite un appui financier pour décoller dans la vie.

loans.use: To buy and sell foam and mattresses

loans.name: Ahoissi

texts.en:
Mrs. Ahoissi L. is a homemaker in Agbanakin in the prefecture of Lacs with her family. Widowed as of three years ago, she takes care of seven people, of whom three are in school, two are apprentices, and two are unemployed. At 60 years old, she has as an income-generating activity the production and marketing of coconut oil. It is with the meagre revenue she collects from her business that she is able to meet the household expenses. The development of her business is such that she needs more significant means which she does not currently have.

Today, she needs a loan of $600 which will allow her to reinstall ovens, stock coconuts, and buy cans to package the oil. This reorganization will make her business much more competitive and will allow her to earn a more sizable income.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Ahoissi L. est domiciliée à Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs avec sa famille. Veuve depuis trois ans, elle prend en charge sept personnes dont trois scolarisés, deux apprentis et deux désoeuvrés. Avec ses 60 ans d’âge, elle a comme activité génératrice de revenu la production et la commercialisation de l’huile de coco. C’est avec les maigres recettes qu’elle réalise avec cette activité qu’elle supporte les charges de sa famille. L’évolution de son activité est telle qu’elle a besoin de moyens plus importants dont elle ne dispose pas.

Aujourd’hui, elle nécessite un crédit de $600 qui lui permettra de réinstaller les fours, de stocker des noix de coco et d’acheter des bidons pour conditionner l’huile. Cette réorganisation rendra son activité beaucoup plus compétitive et lui fera dégager de revenus importants.

loans.use: To install new ovens, to buy cans, and to stock coconuts

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Born on 24 August 1974 in Vogan in Southwest Togo, Mr. Kossi D. is married and has one (01) child. Not having had the chance to pursue his studies and not having a job, he turned himself into a motorcycle taxi driver, but it is difficult for him to meet the needs of the household because his wife does not run a business. Wanting to buy a new motorcycle, he is asking for $800 in financial support.

This dream, once realized, will allow Mr. D. and his family to enjoy an improved standard of living.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 24 août 1974 à Vogan au sud-est du Togo, Monsieur D. Kossi est marié et père d’un (01) enfant. N’ayant pas eu la chance de poursuivre ses études et sans aucun métier sous la main, il se transforma en conducteur de taxi moto mais c’est difficilement qu’il arrive à faire face aux besoins du ménage car sa femme n’exerce aucune activité. Voulant s’acheter une nouvelle moto, il sollicite un appui financier de $800.

Ce rêve, une fois réalisé, permettra à monsieur D. et à sa famille de connaître un niveau de vie plus amélioré.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice would like to buy dairy feed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Akoeba

texts.en:
Mrs. Akoeba D. is married and has six (06) children. The sale of wood is a business she has been involved in since a young age. But the poor state of the land being severe, her husband's output is always middling and she is left alone to support almost her entire family, which extends to her elders and siblings.

To alleviate the daily effort in her business, she is asking for a loan of $550 to stock up on firewood for resale and to buy a rickshaw to transport the wood. Thanks to the income from this project, Mrs. D. and her whole family will be able to improve their standard of living.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Akoeba est mariée et mère de six enfants. La vente de bois est une activité qu’elle a commencée depuis le bas âge. Mais l’état de pauvreté des terres étant très accentué, la production son mari est toujours médiocre et la femme est seule à supporter presque toute la famille qui va jusqu’aux ascendants et aux frères et sœurs.

Pour alléger ses peines quotidiennes dans cette activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $550 pour stocker des bois de chauffe à revendre et acheter un pousse-pousse pour le transport des bois. Grâce aux revenus de ce projet, Madame D. et toute sa famille pourront améliorer leur niveau de vie.

loans.use: To stock firewood and to buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en:
Born on 31 December 1975 in Sokodé, Mrs. Yvette S. is married and has one (01) child. She is a jewel merchant and owner of a telephone booth, and her husband is a part-time professor.

In order to increase her income and financial benefits to better help her unemployed husband in meeting the needs of the family, she would like to buy a photocopier which she will install in her telephone booth, which is close to a school.

Thus, she is asking for a loan of $900. She is a woman with lots of experience in this field and can easily make her business more profitable for the benefit of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 31 décembre 1975 à Sokodé, Madame S. Yvette est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Commerçante de bijoux et propriétaire d’une cabine téléphonique, son mari est professeur vacataire.

En vue d’accroître ses revenus et ses bénéfices commerciaux pour mieux aider son mari sans emploi dans les besoins de la famille, elle désire acheter une photocopieuse qu’elle installera dans sa cabine téléphonique qui est proche d’une école.

Aussi sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $900. C’est une femme qui a beaucoup d’expérience dans le domaine et peut facilement rentabiliser son activité pour le meilleur de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mercy would like to buy good-quality seeds and a watering can.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
A 62 year old woman, Mrs. Bernadette H. is married and has a family; today, she has six people in her care. Living in Agbanakin in the prefecture of Lacs, she has run for the past 18 years a general food store, which allows her to meet her expenses. Given that the income is used directly to pay the household expenses, she is unable to refurbish her display and satisfy market demand.

The tontine (investment) and credit system to which she subscribes keeps her better organized. Currently, she is asking for a sum of $600 to stock up on merchandise and increase her income. This will allow her to reasonably meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Femme de 62 ans, Mme H. Bernadette est mariée et mère de famille ; aujourd’hui, elle a en charge six personnes. Domiciliée à Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs, elle a installé depuis maintenant 18 ans une boutique d’alimentation générale qui lui permet de supporter ses charges. Etant donné que les recettes faites sont directement utilisés pour les dépenses familiales, elle n’arrive pas à ravitailler régulièrement son étalage et satisfaire les demandes du marché.

Le système de tontine et de crédit auquel elle a souscrit l’aide à mieux s’organiser. Actuellement, elle sollicite une somme de $600 pour s’approvisionner en marchandises et accroître ses revenus. Cela lui permettra de subvenir valablement aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock up on various goods

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Born in 1981 in Kpomé, Miss Massan A. is single and has no children. Very dynamic but not having learned a profession, she invested herself in the sale of yams, palm nuts, and fruits in the market in Nukafu in Lomé.

In order to increase her buying power, to go herself to the villages where production is abundant, and to realiize maximum profit, she is asking, for the first time, for a loan of $400. This young woman, who has no one to come to her aid, deserves to be supported financially in order to allow her to succeed in life.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1981 à Kpomé, Mademoiselle A. Massan est célibataire sans enfant. Très dynamique mais n’ayant appris aucun métier, elle s’est investie dans le commerce d’ignames, des noix de palme et des fruits au marché de Nukafu à Lomé.

En vue d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat, d’aller elle-même dans les villages où la production est abondante et réaliser un profit maximum, elle sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit de $400. Cette jeune femme qui n’a personne pour lui venir en aide mérite d’être appuyée financièrement pour lui permettre de se lancer dans la vie.

loans.use: To stock up on foodstuffs

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: "Uncle Steve", as he is called by his customers, lives in a community call Abokobi in Accra, Ghana, and operates a retail shop in his community. He sells general items in his shop. He wants to open another branch in a nearby community. He is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to enable him do so.

loans.use: Working capital to open a second shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mercy would like to buy the tailoring training materials.

loans.name: Messan

texts.en:
A 42 year old man, Mr. Messan K. lives in Agbanakin in the prefecture of Lacs and has in his care seven (07) people. Having had his arm amputated ten years ago following an accident, nature has forced him to live a different way. But far from resigning himself to his situation, he turned towards rearing animals, which he has been doing for 7 years. The loans he has previously received have allowed him to buy new types of goats.

Today, he is asking for a competitive loan of $850 to build an enclosure for the animals and to build a stockpile of feed. This will allow him to improve his yield. Thus, he will have a guaranteed income which will allow him to meet his and his family's needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 42 ans, M. K. Messan vit à Agbanakin dans la préfecture des lacs et a à charge sept personnes. Emputé d’une main il y a dix ans suite à un accident, la nature lui a imposé une autre façon de vivre. Mais loin de se résigner, il s’est orienté vers l’élevage qu’il exerce depuis 7 ans. Les crédits précédemment reçus lui ont permis d’acheter de nouvelles espèces de chèvres. Aujourd’hui, il sollicite un crédit à concurrence de $850 afin de construire une clôture pour les animaux, et de faire un approvisionnement provende. Cela lui permettra d’améliorer le rendement. Ainsi, il aura un revenu sûr qui lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille.

loans.use: To build an enclosure for animals and to stock up on feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to purchase high-quality seedlings and organic manure.

loans.name: Reine

texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Adidogomé in Lomé, Mrs. Reine D. is married to an unemployed taxi driver with whom she has two (02) children.

Very smart and dynamic, she sells rice which she obtained from her aunt in order to meet the needs of her family. Unfortunately, this business is not running very well.

In order to better survive, she is asking for a loan of $600 to build up a stock of rice and oil. The profit realized will serve to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1977 à Adidogomé à Lomé, Madame D. Reine est mariée à un chauffeur de taxi en chômage avec qui elle a eu deux (02) enfants.

Très habille et dynamique, elle vend du riz qu’elle a hérité de sa tante, pour supporter les besoins de sa famille. Malheureusement ce commerce ne marche pas à merveille.

Afin de mieux survivre ,elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour constituer un stock de riz et d'huile.Le profit realisé servira à subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To stock up on rice and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his refreshments business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics products to increase the variety of products she sells.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.en:
A young woman of 32 years, Mrs. Akouavi K. is married and has three (03) children. She lives with her family in the village of Agbanakin (Prefecture of Lacs). Her unemployed husband is unable to meet the household expenses, so she began to make and sell leaven in order to meet the family's needs.

Today, she is asking for a loan of $550, which will allow her to buy clean cloths for drying the leaven, manioc fields, and packaging. This will allow her to professionalize her business and to hire, if possible, a workhand.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Jeune dame de 32 ans, Madame K. Akouavi est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle vit avec sa famille dans le village d'Agbanakin (P/des Lacs). Son mari sans activité n'arrive pas à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille, elle s'est lancée dans la fabrication et la vente du levain afin de supporter les charges familliales.

Aujourd'hui, elle solicite une somme de $550 qui va lui permettre d'acheter des toiles propres pour le séchage du levain, d'acheter des champs de manioc et des emballages. Ce qui lui permettra de professionnaliser son activité et d'engager si possible une main d'oeuvrer.

loans.use: To buy cloth, packaging, and manioc fields

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: "Auntie Lizzy" lives in Amanfrom, Kasoah, Ghana, where she sells charcoal to her community. Since this is the main source of fuel in most homes, demand for her product is very high. She is seeking a loan of $950.00 from Kiva to enable her to buy more bags of charcoal in order to serve her customers. She has been trained by Kraban Support Foundation to adopt the TEACH Lending tool in keeping simple records of her financial and business operations.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jacinta would like to buy seedlings and organic manure.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Born in 1981 in Sokodé, Miss Chantal T. is single and has no children. Not having finished her secondary education due to a lack of means, she quickly launched herself into the sale of beauty products and baby outfits.

To increase her income in order to obtain maximum profits, she is asking for a loan of $400 to stock up her store.

She is a very dynamic young woman whose dedication and rigor need no demonstration. This loan will give her a second wind on the economic front.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1981 à Sokodé, Mademoiselle Chantal T. est célibataire sans enfant. N’ayant pas fini ses études secondaires faute de moyens, elle s’est vite lancée dans le commerce des produits de beauté et de trousseaux bébé.

Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce en vue d’un bénéfice maximum, elle sollicite pour cette fin un financement de $400 pour l'approvisionnement de sa boutique .

C’est une jeune femme très dynamique dont le dévouement et la rigueur ne sont plus à démontrer. Ce financement lui donnera un second souffle sur le plan économique.

loans.use: To stock up on beauty products and baby outfits

loans.name: Moise

texts.en:
Mr. Moise K. was born in 1979 in Lomé and is a married father of two children. He is trained as a moped and motorcycle mechanic but has had difficulty finding work. He has taken up motorcycle taxi driving but would still like to work as a mechanic. As his wife does not work, he is responsible for all of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan of $800 to trade in his motorcycle, which is very old. He is an enterprising young man who deserves to be supported in his endeavors.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1979 à Lomé, Monsieur K. Moïse est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Mécanicien à 2 roues de formation, il a fini par se consacrer à la conduite de taxi moto par manque de travail mais n’a pas abandonné la mécanique. Sa femme n’exerçant aucune activité, tous les besoins de la famille reviennent à lui. Voulant changer sa moto qui est très vieille, il sollicite un crédit de $800 . C’est un garçon très entreprenant qui mérite d’être soutenu.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Bethua would like to purchase foodstuffs such as sugar, cooking fat, maize flour and wheat flour for her shop.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Sister Comfort sells pineapples to processing companies and individuals for consumption. She buys by the truckload from the farm and later sells retail to her customers. She wants to provide more companies with pineapples. She is seeking for a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to enable her buy and supply to her customers.

loans.use: To buy pineapples by the truck

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Consolata would like to buy one high-breed dairy cow.

loans.name: Agbéhoédé

texts.en:
Ms. Agbéhoédé G. was born in 1969 in Klologalanvé. She is a married mother of four who has also been taking care of her older sister's two children since their mother's death. Her business is selling smoked fish, which earns her the income necessary to meet her family's needs. The quality of her work and her rigorous business management allow her to earn a decent living. As demand for her product is growing, she does not have the means to satisfy all of her customers.

She is thus requesting a loan of $750 to build a stock of smoked fish in order to meet the demand at the local market. The success of her business will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1969 à Klologalanvé, Madame G. Agbéhoédé est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants et à sa charge deux (2) enfants de sa sœur aînée décédée. Son activité principale est la vente de poissons fumés d’où elle tire le revenu nécessaire pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. La qualité de son travail et la gestion rigoureuse qu’elle en fait lui procure un revenu acceptable. Avec une demande de plus en plus croissante, elle n’a pas suffisamment de moyens pour satisfaire tous les clients.

Elle sollicite alors un concours financier d’un montant de $750 pour un stock de poissons fumés et satisfaire les demandes sur le marché. Le succès de cette activité lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock and sell smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ann would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Prospère

texts.en:
At 28, Mr. Prospère K. is an energetic and devoted young man. He is a married father of three who also takes care of his two younger brothers. When he could no longer afford to go to school, he began work as a cassava grater, working either at home or in cassava fields. Now he has totally paid off his equipment, but it is constantly breaking down, at the same time that demand is rising.

He is thus requesting a loan of $900 to buy a new, better quality grater in order to better satisfy his customers. This will allow him to increase his earnings and to meet his family's needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 28 ans, Monsieur K. Prospère est un jeune homme très dynamique et dévoué. Marié, il est père de trois (3) enfants. Outres ces derniers, il compte en charge deux (2) petits frères. Abandonnant les études pour faute de moyens, il a entama son activité qui consiste à râper le manioc. Il le fait ainsi à domicile ou dans les champs de manioc. Aujourd’hui, sa machine est totalement amortie et tombe constamment en panne alors que les demandes affluent.

Aussi, sollicite-t-il un crédit de $900 pour acheter une nouvelle râpeuse plus performante lui permettant de satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra de multiplier son chiffre d’affaires et d’atteindre l’épanouissement de sa famille

loans.use: To buy a cassava grater

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina lives in Pokuase, Accra, Ghana. She sells secondhand clothing from house to house. She wants to expand her sales by buying clothing in bulk, by the bale. She is asking for a loan of $800.00 from KIVA.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina operates a wholesale shop at Pokuase, Accra, Ghana. She sells provisions and soft drinks. She wants to buy more items for her shop. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva.

loans.use: To expand product line

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married and has two children. She is educated up to level 12. She has been in the food sale business for the last 4 years. She started as a retailer and now the business has grown to wholesale.

Emily takes care of her sisters two children and her elderly mother. Given the loan, she wants to increase her stock by purchasing more to supply to her clients. This will increase her income and  enable her to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: purchase additional stock for her business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina's dream is to open a modern boutique in her community. She lives in Pokuase, Accra, Ghana. She has a shop, but she has no money to buy clothing to sell in her shop. She is seeking a loan of $850.00 from Kiva to enable her to realize her dream. She has also been trained in the skills lending program of Kraban Support Foundation.

loans.use: To open a boutique

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has five children who are in school. She also takes care of her brothers child, who is also in school. She started her business with $150. She has managed the business for the last five years, making it grow from retail to wholesale.

Given the loan, she wants to expand her business to enable her to serve many markets which are within easy reach.

loans.use: Purchase of additional stockfor her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a 36-year-old woman who lives in Pokuase, Accra, Ghana. She is in agribusiness marketing. She sells foodstuffs including plantain, cassava and other leafy vegetables called 'nkontomire'. She is seeking a loan of $700.00 from Kiva to expand her venture by purchaing more agricultural produce for sale. She has been a distinguished client of Kraban and has participated in the TEACH lending program.

loans.use: To stock her produce shop

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is married and has four children who are going to school. Her husband is a casual labourer and therefore the profit from her business supplements the household income. She has been trained by Rafode in business management and loan use.

Given the loan, she has plans of expanding her business by operating in neighbourhood markets, thereby targeting clients whom she has not reached.

She intends to use the profit to educate her children and build a permanent house for the family.

loans.use: purchase of additional stock

loans.name: Oloo

texts.en: T. Oloo is a 43 year-old entrepreneur.  She lives in the Nyamasaria slums in Kisumu, Kenya with her husband and three children.  She started her business in 1995 and deals in assorted commodities such as grains and daily necessities like bread, flour, cooking oil, and soap. She also sells charcoal in small quantities. The picture was taken while T. was selling charcoal to her customers. She used the funds from her first two loans to set up a small kiosk adjacent to the local market. She plans to use the loan, if awarded, to move her business into a larger space and a more lucrative location.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her hair-dressing salon

loans.name: Oketch

texts.en:
S. Oketch is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and six school-aged children in one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya. She received her training from KMET for home-based HIV/AIDS care and TB ambassadorship in 2004.

She runs a community pharmacy as her main business and source of income while improving access to basic drugs in the community. She supplements this by rearing pigs, which she sells to nearby butcheries. She currently has a total 30 piglets.

Given her reputation and the location of her pharmacy within her community, her business has flourished. The most commonly purchased drugs in her pharmacy are those to treat malaria, diarrhea, and syrups for children. S. credits her success to hard work and the assistance she has received from KMET through two previous microfinance loans. She plans to use the $625 loan to expand both of her businesses.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael started her business in 1980 with $200 from her husband who encouraged her to do business. She is married and has 6 children, two of which are still in school. She has taken a loan from Krep which has enabled her to boost her business and was repaid succesfully. 

Given the loan, she intends to increase her stock to cater to the demand for garments from her clients. She also wants to diversify her business by introducing a new line of materials and clothes.

loans.use: purchase of additional stock

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia sells secondhand clothing and jewelry, both local and foreign-made. She would like to buy jewelry from manufacturers, but it is very costly and she is unable to buy it these days. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to enable her to expand her product line in this way.

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock for his retail business

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: "Mama Augustina" is a 45-year-old woman with 7 children. She sells secondhand clothing and other items like towels, bed spreads, curtains etc. in her own shed in the market. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to enable her buy more bales of clothing.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothing

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka Adhiabo is married and has two children, one of whom is going to school. She has been in the business of running a grocery store for the last three years. She has been trained in loan management and use by Rafode.

Given the loan, she wants to stock her business so that customers can get any commodity they need from the store. This will enable her to increase her profit.
She intends to use the profit to buy a plot and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra D. is the owner of Sandra's Beauty Salon. She has 4 apprentices, and many people patronize her salon. She has no hair dryers, which makes her work very slow. She is seeking a loan of $950.00 from Kiva to enable her buy dryers for her work.

loans.use: To buy hair dryers

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: "Auntie Adwoa" operates a store where she sells assorted drinks and provisions. She need a spacious store that can contain all her goods. She is seeking a loan of $1000.00 from Kiva to enable her to expand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia has a shop which sells tomato paste, cooking oils and other cooking ingredients. She gets stock directly from the manufacturers and later sells retail to her customers. She wants to purchase more stock, therefore she is seeking a loan of $1000.00 from Kiva to enable her expand.

loans.use: To expand her stock

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati has a small stand where she sells groundnuts, beans, wheat, rice (in tins of "olonka", as it is locally called), and other provisions. She wants to open her own shop. She is seeking for a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to enable her open her own shop.

loans.use: To open her own shop

loans.name: Kokoe Hortense

texts.en:
Ms. Kokoe Hortense M. was born January 10, 1975 in Lomé in the Golfe prefecture. She is married to a teacher, has one child and also takes care of another individual. She has an elementary-school level education and is a hairdresser by trade. She opened her first beauty salon in her neighborhood in Nukafu. Her husband does not earn much money and so is not able to meet the family's needs. He thus counts on Ms. Kokoe M. to take care of the household expenses. She is very energetic, kind and devoted and does everything she can to keep her family together. Thanks to her work experience, she has the ability to manage a loan and to repay it on time. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy hair dryers and hairpieces in order to better satisfy her customers and earn a maximum profit. This loan will help her to improve her family's economic and social conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 10 janvier 1975 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe, Madame M. Kokoe Hortense est mariée à un enseignant, et est mère d’un enfant. Elle a aussi une personne à charge. De niveau primaire, elle est coiffeuse de profession et a ouvert un salon dans son quartier à Nukafu. Le mari avec son salaire insignifiant, n’arrive pas à satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Il revient à Madame M. Kokoe de prendre en charge le foyer. Très dynamique, sympathique et dévouée, elle met tout en œuvre pour garder l’harmonie dans la famille. Par ses expériences dans le métier, elle a la capacité de gérer un crédit et à le rembourser au moment opportun. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour l’achat de séchoirs et mèches pour mieux satisfaire ses clients et réaliser un profit maximum. Ce crédit contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille, sur le plan économique et social.

loans.use: To buy two hair dryers and hairpieces to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Alotonsi

texts.en:
Ms. Alotonsi A. was born in 1963 in Lomé, in the Golfe prefecture. She is a married mother of five who also takes care of another individual. Her husband is an unemployed driver who can no longer meet the needs of his family. So Ms. Alotonsi A., who sells groceries and other items, takes care of her children by herself with the money she earns from her business. She is very energetic, always on the go and capable of managing a loan and repaying it on time. She is requesting a loan of $800 to rent a shop in order to open a proper general store.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1963 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe, Madame A. Alotonsi est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants avec une personne en charge. Son mari chauffeur de profession, est actuellement en chômage et n’arrive plus à répondre aux besoins de la famille. Donc Madame A. Alotonsi, commerçante des produits d’alimentation générale et divers s’occupe seule de ses enfants avec le bénéfice qu’elle réalise. Très dynamique et toujours active, elle est capable de gérer un crédit et de le rembourser à terme. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour la location d’une boutique afin de mettre en place un commerce d’alimentation générale proprement dit.

loans.use: To rent a shop in order to open a general store

loans.name: Akoua

texts.en:
Ms. Akoua S. was born August 16, 1962 in Akoumapé in the Vo prefecture. She is a married mother of two who also takes care of two other people. Her retired husband earns a very small pension and can no longer assume financial responsibility for his family. She is a seamstress by trade who fights to meet her family's needs with the little money she earns. Despite her miserable condition, she has never backed down from her responsibilities. To help continue doing so, she would like to buy a new sewing machine and begin selling traditional African cloth and other products in order to diversify her sources of income. As she does not have the means to buy these items, she is requesting a loan of $800. She needs help in achieving her goals in order to meet her family's needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Akoua est née le 16 août 1962 à Akoumapé dans la préfecture de VO. Mariée, elle est mère de deux (2) enfants avec deux personnes en charge. Son mari retraité qui perçoit difficilement ses pensions, n’arrive plus à assumer financièrement ses responsabilités. Couturière de profession, elle se bat pour satisfaire la famille avec le peu qu’elle gagne. Malgré cette condition de vie très misérable, elle n’a jamais reculé devant ses responsabilité. Ainsi, pour mieux accomplir cette mission, elle voudrait acheter une nouvelle machine pour renforcer sa couture et ajouter à ce métier la vente de tissus pagnes et autres produits dans le but de diversifier ses sources de revenu. N'ayant pas les moyens pour réaliser ce projet, elle vient solliciter un crédit de $800. Pour l’épanouissement de sa famille, elle a besoin de soutien pour atteindre son objectif.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and sell traditional cloth

loans.name: Afi Eva

texts.en:
Ms. Afi Eva Z. was born in 1949 in Lomé, in the Golfe prefecture. She is a married mother of five who also takes care of two other people. Her elderly husband can no longer meet the family's needs, so she must do so alone thanks to her years of experience in selling chickens. She has been in the business for 20 years and is very good at managing credit. As she does not have enough money to go to neighboring villages to buy chickens for resale in Lomé, she is requesting a loan of $600. Ms. Afi Eva Z. needs this loan in order to increase her income and take care of her children, who depend solely on her.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1949 à Lomé dans la préfecture du golfe, Madame Z. Afi Eva est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants avec deux personnes en charge. Son mari très vieux ne répond plus aux besoins de la famille. Grande commerçante de volaille très expérimentée, elle fait face toute seule aux besoins de la famille. Active depuis 20 ans, elle est très douée en gestion de crédit. Pour aller s’approvisionner en volailles dans les villages environnants et venir les revendre à Lomé, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 car ses fonds propres ne suffiront pas à le faire. Madame Z. Afi Eva a besoins de cet appui pour pouvoir améliorer son revenu et s’occuper de ses enfants laissés à sa charge.

loans.use: To buy chickens in neighboring villages and resell them in Lomé

loans.name: Ade Odile

texts.en:
Ms. Ade Odile D. was born December 13, 1960 in Lomé, in the Golfe prefecture. She is a married mother of two who also takes care of another individual. Ms. D. sells various products at the market in Nukafu. Her husband is a retired teacher, but due to his small pension, he is no longer able to take financial responsibility for his family. She thus has to use her income to help them, and this situation creates constant hardship for the family. As Ms. Odile D. would like to become a wholesaler, she needs to increase her capital. She does not have the money to do so, so she is requesting a loan of $800, which will allow her to buy and sell various products. This loan will allow her to earn a maximum profit, which will help her to better take responsibility for her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Ade Odile est née le 13 décembre 1960 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants avec une personne en charge. Son mari est un enseignant à la retraite. Madame D. est commerçante de produits divers au marché Nukafu. Son mari n’arrive plus à assumer financièrement ses responsabilités, à cause des pensions qui sont insignifiantes. Madame D. Odile est alors obligée de mettre son revenu à la disposition de la famille. Face à cette situation, la famille est toujours en difficulté. Voulant exercer maintenant un commerce de grossiste, elle est obligée d’augmenter son fond de commerce. Faute de moyen, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui lui permettra d'acheter et de vendre des produits divers. Ce crédit lui permettra de réaliser un profit maximum qui l’aidera à mieux assumer sa responsabilité vis-à-vis de la famille.

loans.use: Wholesale distribution of various food products

loans.name: Adiwa Charlotte

texts.en:
Ms. Adiwa Charlotte D. was born July 7, 1961 in Lomé in the Golfe prefecture. She is a married mother of two who also takes care of two other people. After leaving secondary school she went to learn the laundry business from her uncle's wife. She loves her job and does it with joy, and it earns her a decent income. Despite the fact that her husband is currently unemployed, her family is still happy because she enjoys her job, which she does with energy and attentiveness. She has a lot of management experience, so she has had no problem repaying her previous loans. She is currently requesting a loan of $800 to set up her shop and to buy new equipment. The financing of this project will allow her to increase her income and thus improve her family's living conditions, which is her top priority.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 07 juillet 1961 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe, Madame D. Adiwa Charlotte est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants avec deux autres personnes en charge. Avec un niveau d'instruction secondaire, elle est allée se faire initier au métier de blanchisserie par la femme de son oncle. Un métier qu’elle aime tant et exerce avec joie et qui lui procure beaucoup de bénéfice. Malgré la situation actuelle du mari qui est en chômage, la famille est toujours heureuse à cause du métier qu’elle exerce avec dynamisme et assiduité. Très expérimentée en gestion, elle n'a eu aucun problème dans le remboursement de ses crédits antérieurs. Pour aménager sa boutique et acheter de nouveaux matériels, elle sollicite un crédit de $800. Le financement de ce projet lui permettra d'améliorer ses revenus et par conséquent améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille car c’est la première de ses soucis.

loans.use: To set up her shop and buy new equipment

loans.name: Ayao

texts.en:
Mr. Ayao G. was born August 15, 1963 in Lomé in the Golfe prefecture. He is a married father of three children. After he left primary school, he soon began to train as a mechanic. He is now a master mechanic, and his wife stays at home. His job does not earn him much money, so he would like to open a small business selling car parts, which would allow him to at least bring home something to his family every day. As he does not have the means to do so, he is requesting a loan of $900, which will allow him to open a car parts shop in his automotive garage. The financing of this project will allow him to better assume his responsibility as head of his family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 15 août 1963 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe, Monsieur G. Ayao est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Abandonnant les études au cours primaire, il s’est lancé très tôt dans l’apprentissage de la mécanique. Aujourd’hui maître mécanicien, il a une femme ménagère. Ce métier n’étant pas assez rentable pour lui, il veut entreprendre un petit commerce de pièces détachées qui lui permettra au moins de réaliser un bénéfice journalier pour les besoins de la famille. Faute de moyens, il sollicite un crédit de $900 qui servira à ouvrir sa boutique de vente de pièces détachées dans son atelier. Le financement de ce projet lui permettra de mieux assimer sa responsabilité de père de famille.

loans.use: To open a car parts shop in his automotive garage

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a business student who is also owns a stand in a local market. She and her mother run the business and sell everything from plastics to perfumes. Diana is applying for her second loan with Kiva and Mifex. With the first loan, she was able to purchase larger amounts of perfumes at much better prices, which has made Diana one of the better known perfume sellers in the market because the affordability of her products. She and her mother are doing great in the business and they are very optimistic about the future.

Although it is difficult to balance the responsibilities from her job and school, Diana continues to work towards her business administration degree. Her mother is of great help to her and she is happy that she is being able to apply many of the concepts she is learning at school to her business. One valuable lesson that the real world has taught her is that capital is hard to come by, and for this reason she is particularly grateful to the Kiva and the lenders who have supported her and her business. She finds the Kiva lending process fascinating and she hopes she can continue to participate in the Mifex program. She hopes to use the second loan in the same way as she used the first, only she plans to explore the possibilities of selling new products such as school supplies.

loans.use: Buy perfumes and other products wholesale

loans.name: Acih

texts.en:
Acih is 35 years old. She makes and sells deep-fried-snacks and juices. She has just restarted her business after securing additional working capital of $50 from MBK. She previously halted her business to deliver her child. She also places her food-merchandise at small mini-marts in her neighborhood. She can book IDR 200.000 revenue with IDR 20.000 profit daily.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Acih berusia 35 tahun. Dia membuat dan menjual gorengan dan es jus. Dia baru memulai usahanya lagi setelah mendapat tambahan modal kerja dari MBK sebesar $50. Sebelumnya dia pernah berhenti berjualan karena anaknya melahirkan. Dia juga menitipkan dagangannya ke warung-warung di sekitar rumahnya. Setiap hari dia bisa mendapatkan penghasilan sebesar Rp. 200.000 dengan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 20.000.

loans.use: To make and sell deep-fried-snacks and juices

loans.name: Wenih

texts.en:
Wenih, 40 years old, has four children, age 20, 17, 9 and 6. She is smart enough, because beside being a farmer, with her husband, she also runs her business selling scraps and raise ducks. She would spend some of the $ 50 loan to buy 9 (nine) ducks. She expects to elevate her earnings since she could only afford to send all of her children to primary school.

Translated from Bahasa by Chairuddin, Kiva Volunteer.

Wenih 40 tahun mempunyai 4 orang anak, berusia 20, 17, 9 dan 6. Dia sangat pintar, karena selain menjadi petani, dia juga mempunyai usaha lainnya yaitu menjual barang-barang bekas yang dikelola oleh suaminya Mulyadi dan juga berternak bebek. Dari pinjaman yang diterimanya sebesar $50 sebagian digunakan untuk membeli 9 ekor bebek. Dia berharap dapat memperoleh pendapatan yang lebih besar lagi karena semua anaknya hanya bersekolah sampai tingkat sekolah dasar saja.

loans.use:
Selling scraps and Herbal Medicine

Jual Rongsokan dan Obat-obatan

loans.name: Nur

texts.en:
Nur A. is 25 years old and has seven-year- old-twins, "Siti Amaliyah and Siti Alawiyah". She sells snacks, beverages, kerosene, and even cosmetics in her store. All $50 loan obtained from MBK will be used to purchase merchandise for her store. Her daily revenue is IDR 300.000 with IDR 40.000 profit. She feels supported becoming an MBK member since the loan payment is affordable and the term is sufficiently long.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise items for her store

loans.name: Juenah

texts.en:
The 35 year old Juenah has four children ages 15, 12, 10 dan 5. The $50 additional working capital from MBK will be partly used to purchase merchandise items for her store while the rest will be used to buy fertilizer and other chemicals for farming. From her store she typically earns 115,000 IDR with a profit of 15,000 IDR

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise items for her store

loans.name: Sunayah

texts.en:
Sunayah, 30 years old, is a mother of 3 children, aged at 11, 5 and 2.

She makes cookies and sells them by carrying them around her village. In addition of selling cookies, she is also a farmer.

The expected $50 loan will be used partially for purchasing of fertilizer for farming activities.

Her daily average revenue is Rp 70,000 (around US$ 7), which provides her a profit of Rp 10,000 (US$ 1).

She is hoping to get bigger loan to enable her to produce and sell more cookies.

Translated from Indonesian by Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Selling cookies (Jualan Kue)

loans.name: Denga

texts.en:
E. Denga is a 51 year-old widow who supports four children in her household. She has two school-aged children still living at home and is also raising two of her orphaned grandchildren.

E. spent two years learning the art of dressmaking and has been offering her tailoring services within her community in Kisumu, Kenya since 1986. She specializes in women’s dresses and men’s shirts. Despite the stiff competition in her area, E. has always been able to keep old customers and attract new ones. She constantly updates her materials to keep up with the current fashions, offers a wide selection of patterns, and maintains a good stock to meet her customers’ demands.

She plans to supplement her income with small sales of beans and rice from her tailor shop. The profit from the sale of these staple foods, which require very little care, will help pay for school fees and other household expenses, especially during the slow season when orders are low.

loans.use: To expand her business and the variety of products she sells

loans.name: Lumumba

texts.en:
P. Lumumba is a nursing officer managing his own private facility in Muumandu, Machakos District, in Kenya's Eastern Province. He is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two children, aged 12 and 1 year.

He has run his facility for the last seven years since graduating from college in this remotest part of Kenya. He focused his efforts on building a larger out-patient facility at this location. Besides general curative services and an observation ward, his facility offers a pharmacy, a laboratory, and maternal and child health services. He also offers mobile outreach clinics to the community.

P. attributes his success to hard work, winning the community's confidence, the active involvement of the community, and assistance from KMET. He has been able to expand his facility, increase the number of services he offers and improve the quality of care he provides. He plans to further expand his facility and has applied for a loan of Kshs 200,000 (approximately US $2857).

loans.use: To expand the space and services at his medical clinc

loans.name: Owola

texts.en:
Dr. Owola is an obstetrics/gynecology practitioner managing his own private facility in Bungoma, Western Province, Kenya. He is 50 years old and lives with his wife and eight children. His wife is employed as a nurse in a government facility. After his training he was employed by the government and posted to Nyanza provincial Hospital in Kisumu, where he worked for three years. He then resigned from government and started his own private facility.

He has applied for a loan of Us $1,200 to renovate his facility, purchase additional furniture, increase the number of beds primarily for admissions, and to purchase a stock of drugs in bulk.

loans.use: To renovate his facility

loans.name: Aluoch

texts.en: G. Aluoch is 40 year-old entrepreneur who lives with her husband and six children in Rongo, Kenya. She has also trained as a community health worker to provide home-based care to people living with HIV/AIDS in her area. G., called mama mdogo by her co-wives children, runs a fish selling business at a market in Rongo town. She is the sole income earner in her household and depends on her business to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. Her hard work, determination, and excellent people skills have led to her success.  She manages her stall during the day and provides home based care services to people living with HIV/AIDS in the evenings.  Her profits pay the household expenses as well as secondary school fees for three of her children.  G. plans to use the funds from her  loan of Kshs 40,000 (approximately US $575) to incorporate the sale of cereal into her business.

loans.use: To increase stock for dry fish and other basic commodities

loans.name: Obongo

texts.en:
J. Obongo is a 38 year-old trained nurse. He is married and lives with his family in Kitale, Kenya.

J. who has been in private practice since completing his training and he depends entirely on his clinic for his livelihood. His clinic is located in one of the remote parts of Kenya where a good percentage of the population lives below the poverty line. The community appreciates the quality of services provided at his facility. J. has applied for a loan of approximately US $ 1,200 to further expand his clinic.

loans.use: Clinic and services expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The money will be used to buy electrical appliances.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Rusni

texts.en:
Rusni, 39 years old, is a mother of 5 children. She has already opened her small kiosk before she joined as one of MBK member. Her lack of capital to support and to expand her small kiosk was her main reason to join MBK. She is hoping to get a chance to get more capital from MBK which has a light repayment plan.

With a working capital of $50 she can sell more items in her small kiosk such as cigarette, flour, shampoo and also vegetables.

Rusni's husband, Ahab, is a farmer. Therefore some part of the loan will be given to her husband to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

Translated from Indonesian by Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To support the capital for her kiosk.

loans.name: Murdiah

texts.en:
Murdiah, 26 years old, is a mother of 2 children of 5 and 3 years old. Murdiah runs her small kiosk business together with her husband, Sayadi.

As a new member of MBK, she will get a maximum of $50 loan which she will spend to add more items to be sold in her small kiosk. With this loan she expects her revenue to increase.

Translated from Indonesian by Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: to support her kiosk to grow

loans.name: Hamna

texts.en:
Hanna started her kiosk before she joined MBK as a member. Most of her loan $50 loan from MBK will be used to stock up her inventory for her kiosk, while the remainder from the loan will be used to buy fertilizers for agriculture. If she successfully upgrades her kiosk, her daily income will increase from $5 to $7.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard , Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To help her buy goods for her kiosk

loans.name: Asaroh

texts.en:
Asaroh is 25 years old. She buys and sells kerosene. She runs her business to earn additional income to support her husband Pendi. All of the $50 working capital she has requested from MBK will be used to purchase kerosene and six units of container. She wants to get a larger working capital so she can sell more kerosene.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene (for cooking fuel) and containers

loans.name: Marsunah

texts.en:
Marsunah is 45 this year, she has 4 sons. She sells "nasi uduk" (a local Indonesian dish of steamed rice with coconut milk) in her village. Her quest for extra capital has led her to become a member of MBK. The extra loan of $50 will be used to buy cooking materials for "nasi uduk", cooking pan, and a cooking stove which are worn out. And the remainder of the loan will be given to her husband Mr Madsani, to help up in his job as used item collector. Marsunah sell "nasi uduk" in the morning, while in the afternoon she sells fried delicacies. Her daily income is around $5.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Bernard , Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To increase her coconut rice production

loans.name: Anih

texts.en:
Anih age 25, is a farmer. The recent flood has caused her to lose all her capital. After being a member of MBK she has requested a loan of $50, to help her get back on her feet, to be able to buy fertilizers, and employ a grass cutter. She expects to be able to harvest up to 5 sacks of rice.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard , Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To increase the rice production

loans.name: Marpi

texts.en:
Marpi is 38 years old and has 5 kids. With $50 loan that she requested from MBK, Marpi will be able to sell vegetable and food every morning by walking around her village. In one day she expects to receive income of $20 with a profit of $5. She hopes to get the loan from MBK because to get the loan she doesn't need a guarantee and she can make loan payment on a long-term basis (one year).

Translated by C. Patriawan, Kiva volunteer

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her food sales

loans.name: Rusiah

texts.en:
Rusiah is 35 years old. She runs a business selling gasoline and various snacks on the side of the road from a stall that is made of bamboo. Because of the strategic location, there are many different people who buy from there. The loan that she asked from MBK for $50 will be used entirely to buy what might be needed for the stall. Daily income can reach $10.

Translated from Indonesian by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her kiosk

loans.name: Aswanah

texts.en:
Aswanah is 25 years old and has 2 children. The endeavor is to sell gado-gado (vegetable dishes) and different kinds of snacks from the warung (little shop). Her husband Jamaludian works as a laborer for a chicken breeder. The loan that was requested from MBK is for $50, and will be used entirely to buy what might be needed for the small shop. In a day Aswanah can earn $11 with profits of $3. Once every 2 days she goes shopping at the market for the shop's needs in order to buy material for making the gado-gado that she makes every day.

Translated from Indonesian by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her kiosk

loans.name: Unah

texts.en:
Unah is 30 years old. Unah has been selling gada-gado (vegetable dishes) for a living but would also like to sell mambo ices (popsicles), kitchen spices and also various fried foods. The loan that she requested from MBK for $50, will be used entirely to buy the materials for making ices and the different kinds of vegetables needed to make gado-gado. Now Unah can raise her income.

Translated from Indonesian by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To help buy her food ingredients

loans.name: Eli

texts.en:
Eli is 23 year old. She has been working on her bamboo hat weaving business for a long time. However, in the past she had to borrow money to buy raw materials. With a loan from MBK, she could purchase more bamboo using cash than she can now. From MBK, she has requested $50 working capital, part of which was will be used for her hat weaving business. She will use the rest as a farming fund to plant cassava. She sells her finished products once a week to a collector that comes to her home.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: to buy more bamboos

loans.name: Atik

texts.en:
Atik is 40 year old, and she makes "lontong" and "bacang," local delicacies made of rice wrapped in banana leaves, to be sold in her small kiosk that is constructed out of bamboo. Atik has been selling only "lontong," but she would like to broaden her offerings by selling instant noodle, sugar, sweet ketchup and other snacks. From MBK, Atik requested a $50 loan, to be partly used to make bamboo hats that she sells once a week to a collector that comes to her house. She expects to sell 15 hats in a week (Rp. 1000 / about 10 US cents each), and for the kiosk to net her about $5 profit a day.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy more bamboos

loans.name: Piroh

texts.en:
Piroh is a 21 year old girl. Lack of capital funds was one reason she joined MBK. She owns a kiosk that sells snacks and "mambo" ice. She was happy to become an MBK member, because of the lighter and longer loan term they offer. Piroh has only requested a $50 loan because she is still a new member.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her kiosk

loans.name: Piah

texts.en:
Piah, 40 year old, is a farm laborer. She works on land owned by other people with 3:1 revenue sharing system, where Piah gets 75% and the landlord gets 25% of the product revenue. She requested a $50 loan to buy farming supplies. But she hopes to obtain a larger loan to enable her to work on larger land area. She hopes to get her own land someday.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Nengsih

texts.en:
Nengsih is 29 years old. She has 4 children, age: 16, 13, 9 and 2. She is selling meatball skewers with her husband Asmawi. She sells by circling around her alleys street village. She has requested a loan of $50 from MBK, to add 2 employees, to increase her sales. In one day she could have a potential profit of about IDR 50,000 (about $ 5).

Translated from Indonesian by Ang, Gwan-Liong, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: To expand meatballs on skewers business

loans.name: Atik

texts.en:
Atik is 40 years old. She is a widow. She has sold bamboo straw covers for a long time, however she does not have enough bamboo, because of a shortage of capital. She has requested a $50 loan from MBK, to have more capital to buy more bamboo. The product sales are done weekly when collectors come to her house.

Translated from Indonesian by Ang, Gwan-Liong, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Expand straw hat sales business

loans.name: Entin

texts.en:
Entin, 34 years old, is in the business of retail selling of clothing and fabric. Her customers come from several villages and they purchase in credit terms and pay the goods in several installment payment arrangement (retail credit sales).

She collects the installment payment from her customers in weekly basis.

All of the loan to be provided by MBK in the amount of $50 is to be used to purchase of merchandise for her business. Her weekly revenue is Rp 300,000 (around $ 30) with profit of Rp 100,000 (around $10).

Translated from Indonesian by Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Selling of clothing (Dagang Kain)

loans.name: Enok

texts.en:
Enok is 43 years old. Enok has a Duck and Goat farming business. She only has 2 Goats and 2 Ducks, and has requested a loan of $50 from MBK to buy more goats and ducks. At this moment Enok is waiting for her farm animals to grow larger, so that they will be ready for sale.

Translated from Indonesian by Ang, Gwan-Liong, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Expand Duck Farming business

loans.name: Amriah

texts.en:
Amriah has been doing her rags-sewing business even before she secured a loan from MBK, but in the past she had to purchase the raw materials on credit. After obtaining working capital from MBK in the amount of $50, she was able to purchase more raw materials by cash and to produce more selling goods. Amriah has requested her second loan of $90. Some portion of the loan will be used for her sewing business while other portion will be used for her other business of collecting and selling scraps. Amriah is very happy because she will now be able to buy a motorcycle on credit.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Uyeh

texts.en:
Uyeh feel very happy to become a member of MBK. She has requested her second loan of $100 from MBK. The raised loan will be used for the small kiosk and to help her husband to buy fertilizers for his farm. In a day, Uyeh typically earns IDR 230,000 with a profit of IDR 30,000

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Frely Pakan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy more supplies for her kiosk

loans.name: Rumsani

texts.en:
Rumsani is an MBK member who has requested her second loan of $100. She started her bamboo basket business a long time ago. From a bamboo stick which she bought for IDR 10,000, she can produce 20 bamboo baskets that she could sell for IDR 5,000 each. The bamboo baskets are purchased by the distributor whose comes directly to her house every two weeks. For each transaction, Rumsani could sell 40 bamboo baskets. Half of the loan received from MBK will be used for her bamboo basket business while the other half will be used for her husband's business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Frely Pakan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Bamboo basket business and funding her husband business

loans.name: Limah

texts.en:
Limah is a member of MBK who has requested her second loan of $100. Half of the loan received from MBK will be used for her bamboo basket business while the other half used for her husband farm. From a bamboo stick which she bought for IDR 5,000, She could create 6 large baskets that she could sell for IDR 8,000. Twice a week, She could sell 20 large basket and 12 small basket. The small basket could be sold for IDR 3,500

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Frely Pakan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Bamboo basket business and her husband farm

loans.name: Omih

texts.en:
Omih is a member of MBK who has requested a second loan of $100. The loan from MBK will be partially used to fund weaving bamboo basket and the balance will be used for her husband’s iron trade. Fourteen large baskets can be woven from a stalk of bamboo costing IDR6,000. These baskets can be sold for IDR8,000. These 14 large baskets are sold twice a week.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Bamboo basket - Bakul Bambu

loans.name: Kulsum

texts.en:
Kulsum is a member of MBK who has requested a second loan of $100. The loan from MBK will be partially used to fund weaving bamboo basket and the balance for her husband’s fan and basket weaving trade. 5 large and 10 small baskets can be woven from a stalk of bamboo costing IDR7,000. These baskets can be sold for IDR6,000 and IDR3,500 for the large and small baskets, respectively.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Bamboo basket - Bakul Bambu

loans.name: Sulastri

texts.en:
Sulastri is an MBK member who has requested her second loan of $100. Half of the loan from MBK will be used to purchase merchandise for her store and the other half will be used to help her husband's business of selling scrap/discarded metal. Sulastri's store was once almost out of business due to lack of capital, fortunately she heard about MBK from her colleagues and eventually signed up for an MBK membership. In a day Sulastri typically earns IDR 340,000 with a profit of IDR 40,000

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her small store

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a retired civil servant. He is married with six children; four of them are in secondary school and two are in primary school. After retirement he decided to employ himself by purchasing a saw mill machine. The machine is the sole source of income for his family. He buys timber logs from nearby regions and produces timber of different sizes for his clients. His customers usually demand more than what he can produce. He is in need of USD 1,200 to increase his stock of logs.

loans.use: Purchase timber for his saw mill.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with three children. She lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. Mariam sells “khanga”, a type of cloth worn by women that is fitted around the waist. The cloth is very famous as casual wear in Tanzania. The cloth can be seen on Mariam in her photograph.
Mariam sells these khanga to her customers on credit and they repay on a monthly basis. This situation prompted her to get enough working capital to make her business continuous so she can add stock on time without waiting for the customers to repay their debts. Mariam is in need of USD 400 to facilitate her business.

loans.use: Increase her stock of khanga.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. He is married with two children. He owns a retail shop near his residence.
