The shop sells different consumable items, especially food. Juma knows how to search and utilize opportunities. He recently opened a shop on the next street after seeing the street has no shop. Through his savings he managed to pay rent for the premises. What he needs now is working capital to fill the shelves of the new shop. The new shop will add profit to his total income so he can sustain the family and pay school fees for his children. To implement his plans Juma needs USD 550.

loans.use: Stock for new shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jacinta would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a weighing machine

loans.name: Johari

texts.en:
Johari lives in the Vituka, Temeke District in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She is married with four children. The elder daughter is in secondary school. Johari runs
a tailoring  business in a verandah of her home. The business has not been good recently due to insufficient sewing materials and competition she faces from her neighbors.  She wants to improve her business by having enough sewing materials and renting a business premise. She is currently working on the verandah of her house which does not attract customers and does not provide her enough space. She also needs to add two sewing machines and one assistant. The plan requires USD 550.

loans.use: Working capital for tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en: Hadia lives in the Vituka area, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She is married with four children. She sells maize flour, beans, rice and other types of dry food to food vendors and several restaurants in the Temeke district of Dar es Salaam. She buys these food items from wholesalers and packs them in bags of 5-10 kilograms ready for resale. She is planning to increase stock for these food items as she usually faced with stockouts. Hadia is worried about these stockouts, as competitors may take this as an advantage and reduce her market share. To meet her plan she is need of USD 550.

loans.use: Increase stock of food goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Franscicah would like to set up a hotel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ntise Parpoika would like to buy three more steers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles M. is 34 years. He is married and has one child. He also takes care of two of her sister’s children, Millicent 18 years and Nelly 17 years, both in high school. He assists in paying their school fees. The sister succumbed to illness in the year 2004. She was not legally married.

Charles only managed to get education up to high school level. Due to the increased unemployment in Kenya and lack of fees for college, he only managed to get a casual job in the juakali sector. Through this he learned various skills, including the spraying of cars. He worked in the garage for seven years. All this time he had been saving a bit of the little money he got as wages. It is while working at the garage that he together with his colleagues came up with the idea of opening their own garage. With their little saving and their varied skills, they managed to buy simple basic tools to start up. It is then that they opened Walsam garage at a road reserve near Fort Jesus in Kibera slums. They have been operating there for the last three years.

Charles and his friends have had constraints in their tools at work. They have no spraying machine at the garage. They are forced to hire a machine at a cost of USD 7 for every vehicle they spray. Besides that, they have to book the machine a day in advance. Sometimes they do not get the machine, which forces the vehicles to stay longer at the garage, which often results in loss of business. A loan of USD 200 in kind, in form of a vehicle spraying machine will them to maintain more customers. He intends to train other boys within the Kibera slums on vehicle repair skills. This will reduce their chance of getting into crime and drugs as well as opening up for them employment opportunities. The loan is repayable within 12 – 18 months.

loans.use: Purchase of a spray painting machine for vehicles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Kipeen Maradu would like to buy more varieties of food and 15 more chairs for her hotel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Kabura would like to buy 20 bags of maize.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas has been in the business of chemistry for the last ten years. He is married and has three children who are going to school. He also has a brother who depends on him.

Given the loan, he wants to purchase additional stock so that he can cater to both humans and livestock. This will enable him to increase sales and income.

He plans to use the funds to educate his children and build a house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ndanine Monirei would like to buy eight more steers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Kanyi would like to buy eight more steers.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas Y. is 41 years old and is living with HIV within the Kibera slums. He is also a widower. He has three children and also takes care of three orphans who were left in his care by his brother who died due to HIV related complications.    

In the year 2004, Douglas was privileged to go through two days training on local manufacture of detergents and shampoo, which was conducted by the Methodist Church in Kibera. The training showed how and where to get the ingredients for detergent and shampoo making.  

Douglas got $5 grant in kind from a friend, which he used to buy the ingredients he needed. He was able to make 20 litres of the detergent. He packed and sold this in plastic containers of 250 and 500 grams that he had collected from a nearby bar within Kibera for $1.50. He also decided to give samples of the detergent he had made to the neighboring organizations, schools and churches in order to advertise his products. It is now two years since he started selling the detergents and shampoo at Fort Jesus, Kibera. He has a wider market, ranging from his neighbors, the schools and churches within Kibera.

Douglas uses a wooden stick and plastic containers (basins) to mix his ingredients. He produces 80 litres of the detergent and shampoo in a week and sells in small quantities. He packs in containers of 20, 10 and 5 litres which he sells to his clients in schools, churches and organizations. He also packs in containers of 100 – 500 grams that he sells at an affordable price ($1.50) to his neighbors. He usually stores the little amount that remains in the plastic containers that he uses to mix the ingredients because of the shortage of storage containers.  

Douglas sees that his business is expanding and has a wider market. Given the loan of $ 75, he plans to purchase 30 plastic containers of 20 litres each to enable him store and pack his detergents and shampoo. Douglas has recently been approached by a group of women and youth who have been sponsored by a health clinic within the Kibera slums, to teach them on the process of making the detergent and shampoo. Douglas sees this as a move that will not only increase his income but also positively impact his community, which is characterized by idleness especially among the youth. Douglas also plans to transfer this skill to his children.  The loan is repayable within 6 – 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase plastic containers for storage of detergent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Kaanu Kirisiet would like to set up a cereal business shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Racheal Wairimu would like to buy a blow dryer and hair dryer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Silau Kirisiet would like to buy three more steers.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina Antonio M., 42 years of age and a divorced mother of 3, lives with and assumes all responsibility for the health and education of her two grandchildren. Justina grew up with her parents and attended school; however, she found her studies interrupted by her early marriage. She worked for an automotive parts dealer, but her income was unable to sustain her obligations. Hence, she abandoned her job to take care of her own business in 2003. Today, she assumes full administration of a commercial business. Through her friends she came to know Hluvuku-Adsema (Field Partner) toward the end of 2006. With the loan, Justina intends to reinforce the volume of her business, responding to an ever-increasing demand. Her future goals are to grow and construct new strategies of survival. Justina hopes to increase her revenue, allowing her to reimburse the loan, make small savings and improve the conditions of her job. Justina hopes to be a successful businesswoman in the near future.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Justina António M., de 42 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 3 filhos vive também com os seus 2 netos assumindo toda responsabilidade de saúde e educação. Cresceu com os pais, ingressou na escola mas viu os seus estudos interrompidos para casar cedo. Trabalhou num agente de peças de automóveis e diz que com os rendimentos não conseguia satisfazer as suas necessidades tendo depois abandonado o emprego para cuidar do seu negócio em 2003. Hoje em dia, assume na integra a gestão da actividade comercial e através das amigas tomou o conhecimento da existência da hluvuku nos finais de 2006. Com o empréstimo de 40.500,00mt pretende reforçar o volume do negócio assim como responder uma demanda cada vez mais crescente, o que lhe cria mais expectativa de crescimento e desenho de novas estratégias de sobrevivência. Espera incrementar os seus rendimentos, o que vai lhe permitir reembolsar o crédito e fazer pequenas poupanças, assim como melhorar as condições do seu empregado. Assume-se como uma mulher quer ser empresária bem sucedida no futuro mais próximo.

loans.use: To increase stock of materials in her shop

payments.comment: She antecipeted to have another loan

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Jose Ernesto Z., 45 years of age and married, is a native of Homoine, Inhambane province. Due to an early marriage, he never attended school beyond the 7th grade. Once he discontinued his studies, he began to work for a civil construction company to help confront the great challenge of being a father at the young age of 16. Months later, once his contract ended, he started an unsuccessful firewood cutting business. He started selling cow’s milk and raising chickens, an activity he continues to this day. Through conversations with friends he learned of Hluvuku-Adsema (Field Partner), who he became acquainted with and solicited a loan for the purchase of egg-laying hens. His income helps him support familial expenses, and his children’s educational and health expenses, as well as invest in the construction of his house. With this loan he intends to buy hens to supply the market of Boane with fresh eggs, as well as sell chickens and milk. His business’ impact on the community is a positive one because beyond providing employment for himself, his wife, and children, he also plays an important part in the supply of animal protein, calcium and other vitamins derived from cow’s milk, thus contributing to the essential nourishment of the community. His future goals include expanding his business and diversifying his products.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

José Ernesto Z., de 45 anos de idade, casado, natural de Homoine, provincial de Inhambane. Devido ao casamento precoce não estudou para alem da 7ª classe, logo deixou de estudar e começou a trabalhar numa empresa de construção civil, para conseguir enfrentar o grande desafio de ser pai com idade menor de 16 anos. Meses depois, findo o contrato de trabalho, pensou e fez numa actividade de corte de lenha e, segundo conta, não teve sucesso. Começou a vender leite de vaca e a criar frangos de corte, actividaes que exerce ate hoje . Através de conversas com amigos soube da existência da Hluvuku- Adsema , aproximou-se e solicitou um empréstimo para compra de galinha poedeiras de ovos. Com os rendimentos suporta as despensas familiares, investe na ampliação da sua casa, despesas de Saúde, Educação para os filhos. Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar poedeiras para poder abastecer o mercado de boane com ovos frescos, para além da venda frangos e leite que já exerce actualmente. A actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego para ele próprio mais a sua esposa e filhos, desempenha um papel importante no fornecimento de proteína animal, cálcio e outras vitaminas provenientes de leite de vaca contribuindo para a segurança alimentar e Nutrição da comunidade. Tem como perspectiva, fazer crescer o negócio cada vez mais, diversificando os produtos.

loans.use: Farming

loans.name: Albino

texts.en:
Albino Arone L., 46 years of age and a native of Matola, is a father of 4 children and grew up under the care of his parents and 11 siblings. The family’s financial situation afforded him little opportunity to attend school. Since childhood he has assumed the full administration of his personal business, a foundry in the town of Boane near the local market. Through curiosity and interest he came to know of Hluvuku-Adsema (Field Partner), who he approached and solicited a loan to expand his business. His business is well placed in the community, providing employment to three workers. With the business’ revenue he supports familial expenses, educational expenses, and the health of his children and of his grandson. With the loan of 1,000 dollars he intends to increase the volume of his merchandise, to diversify the various types of construction materials to avoid the quick decline of iron stock. He also intends to maintain a competitive edge with his competitors. His business’ impact on the community is great because beyond providing employment for himself and 3 other people, he also makes the construction material available easily available to the residents of the village of Boane. He works in an establishment well adapted to the production of ironwork and his future expectations are to expand the business and own a vehicle for the acquisition and distribution of domestic materials.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Albino Arone L., de 46 anos de idade, natural da cidade da Matola , pai de 4 filhos, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos pais numa família alargada de 11 irmaos. A situação financeira da família lhe criou poucas oportunidades para estudar. Desde jovem assume na integra a gestão de um negocio pessoal e possui uma ferragem em pleno funcionamento na vila de boane, próximo do mercado local. Por curiosidade e interesse soube da existência da Hluvuku, aproximou-se e solicitou um empréstimo para ampliação do seu negocio. A sua actividade está bem inserida na comunidade, providencia emprego a três trabalhadores. Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares, as despesas escolares e de saúde dos seus filhos e cuida do seu neto. Com o empréstimo de 25.000.00mt pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria, diversificar os vários tipos de materiais de construção de forma a evitar ruptura de stock na sua ferragem. E pretende concorrer em pé de igualdade de oportunidades com os concorrentes. A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade porque alem de providenciar emprego para ele próprio mais outras 3 pessoas, coloca o material de construção mais próximo dos residentes da vila de Boane. Funciona num estabelecimento bem adaptado para o exercício da actividade e tem como perspectiva fazer crescer o negócio e ter uma viatura própria para aquisição e entrega de materiais ao domicílio.

loans.use: To increase stock of building materials in his shop

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando A., 32 years of age and a native of Nampula, did not attend school beyond the 5th grade because of the war. He arrived in the province of Maputo in the company of his oldest sibling in 1995 and encountered the necessity of starting a small business in an ambulatory regime. Later, he acknowledged this endeavor as a good idea now that the conditions of starting a business had already materialized in a fixed location, also because he had married and needed to better organize his life. Today he is a father of 2 children. Through his neighbors he obtained information about the services provided by Hluvuku-Adsema (Field Partner), who he approached and solicited an initial low-cost loan. He was able to open a bank account and start a small savings in case of an emergency. Right now, he employs 4 people and supports the basic familial expenses. With this loan he intends to expand his business by diversifying the products he sells. His business’ impact on the community is a positive one: he provides employment for himself, his wife and his sister-in-law; he places the product as close as possible to the consumers of his village. His future plans include expanding the business and offering employment to more people in the community.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Armando A. de 32 anos de idade, natural de Nampula por causa de guerra não conseguiu estudar para alem da 5 classe. Chegou na província de Maputo na companhia do seu irmão mais velho em 1995 e viu a necessidade de iniciar um pequeno negócio em regime ambulatório mais tarde achou por bem e já criada as condições de fazer o negócio no local fixo também porque já tinha se casado e precisava organizar-se melhor. Hoje é pai de 2 filhos e conta que através dos vizinhos obteve a informação sobre os serviços que a HLUVUKU ADSEMA presta à população de Boane, tendo aproximado e solicitado o primeiro empréstimo num valor bastante reduzido tendo em conta as capacidades de financiamento da instituição. Conseguiu abrir uma conta bancária e começou a fazer pequenas poupanças para os momentos de crise. Actualmente emprega quatro pessoas, suporta as despesas básicas da sua família. Com o este valor pretende ampliar o negócio diversificar os produtos de venda. A sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na sua comunidade, providencia emprego para ele próprio, esposa e cunhada. Coloca o produto, mais próximo do consumidor do seu bairro. Tem como planos de fazer crescer o negócio e dar emprego mais pessoas da comunidade.

loans.use: To increase the stock of clothes in his shop

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta Julieta Joao M., 25 years of age and a native of Maputo, is a single mother of 3 children. She grew up under the care of her single mother, and due to an early pregnancy she could not continue her studies beyond the 7th grade. Since her youth she has assumed the full administration of a business, which helps her support her children and 6 siblings who have never lived with their parents. Since 2006, through the suggestion of a friend, she has come to know Hluvuku-Adsema (Field Partner), who she approached and requested information for 2007. She owns a small commercial establishment within the local market whose principal business is the sale of everyday products. With the business’ revenue she supports familial responsibilities and her first child’s educational expenses; her other children are not yet of age to attend school. Her youngest child has suffered from hydrocephalus for over a year and necessitates special medical attention; hence, family medical expenses are extremely high. With the loan of 1,000 dollars she intends to increase the volume of merchandise at both her stands so that customers can avoid daily excursions to the city to purchase essential goods. The loan will also allow her to diversify the products so as to attract more customers to her stands and actively respond to their demands. Marta’s business’ impact on the community is great because she serves as a young role model, someone who is self-employed alongside her husband.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Marta julieta João M., de 25 anos de idade, mãe de três filhos, solteira, natural de Maputo. Cresceu sob responsabilidade de uma mãe solteira e devido a gravidez precoce não pode estudar para alem da 7ª classe. Desde a adolescência assume na integra um negocio como, forma de sustentar os seus filhos e ajudar os seus 6 irmãos, atendendo que nunca viveram com os seus pais. Desde o ano de 2006 por indicação da amiga soube da existência da HLUVUKU, tendo aproximado para pedido de informações já em 2007. dispõe de um pequeno estabelecimento comercial dentro do mercado local, cujo principal negócio é venda de produtos de primeira necessidade. Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares, as despesas escolares do seu 1º filho, pois os outros dois ainda não atingiram a idade escolar. O filho mais novo padece hidrocefalia a mais de 1 ano e, este precisa de atenção médica especial, dai que as despesas de saúde na família são extremamente altas. Com o empréstimo de 25.000.00mt, pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria nas suas duas bancas, de forma a evitar viagens diárias a cidade para efectuar compras e vai permitir diversificar os produtos assim como atrair mais clientes para as suas bancas, respondendo positivamente as exigências dos mesmos. A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade porque ela é um exemplo de jovens que conseguem criar o seu auto – emprego e trabalha junto com o actual marido.

loans.use: To increase the stock of food in her shop

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda Jose N., 47 years of age and a native of the Gaza province, is married and a mother of 2 children. She grew up under her mother’s care, her father having died when she was only 12 years old. The family’s financial situation never afforded her the best opportunities for attending school. She has resided in the rural district of Boane since 1980 where she has come to assume the full administration of the family’s business; she also owns commercial space near the Boane market. Since 2006, through business friends’ and neighbors’ suggestions she met Hluvuku-Adsema (Field Partner), who she approached and solicited a loan to expand her businesses. Part of the business’ revenue helps her support her children’s educational expenses and another part goes toward the construction of a conventional house. With the loan of 400 dollars she intends to increase the volume of merchandise. Her business’ impact on the community is great because it provides more than a job for her and her husband, the business brings products, like china and other consumer goods (beds and plastic tables), closer to the customers, especially to the population of Boane. She also anticipates expanding her business more and more.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Gilda José N., de 47 os de idade, natural da província de Gaza, casada e mãe de 2 filhos. Cresceu sobre a responsabilidade da mãe, pois o seu pai morreu quando ela tinha apenas 12 anos de idade. A situação financeira da família não lhe proporcionou boas oportunidades para estudar. Desde 1980 que vive no Distrito rural de Boane, onde vem assumindo na integra a gestão de negocio da família e possui um espaço para pratica de actividade comercial ao lado do Mercado de Boane. A partir do ano de 2006, por indicações de amigas e vizinhas que, também são comerciantes teve conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku- Adsema, Aproximou se e solicitou o primeiro empréstimo para ampliação dos seus negócios. Neste momento, a sua actividade conheceu uma nova dinâmica. Com os rendimentos do negocio, suporta as despesas escolares de 2 filhos, e uma parte para construção de uma casa de material convencional. Com empréstimo de 10.000MT, pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego para ela própria mas o seu marido, coloca os produtos perto dos clientes, com particular destaque para toda população de Boane na compra de loiça e e outros bens de consumo (camas e mesas plásticas). E, tem como perspectivas ampliar cada vez mais o seu negócio.

loans.use: To increase the stock of products in her shop

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina Moises Sitoe A., 37 years of age, married and a mother of 3, grew up with her parents. Her studies were interrupted at 8th grade due to the early pregnancy of her first child. Her husband is in the military and has always been away from the family. With the transfer of her husband to the northern most province of the country, Gina was obligated to start a business in order to sustain her 3 children. In conversation with her neighbors, she found out about Hluvuku-Adsema (Field Partner) and met and solicited a loan. Today, Gina’s business has expanded, having two counters and the fortune of employing one worker (a single mother). With the business’ revenue Gina supports the family’s expenses and her children’s education, as well as the family’s health in case of sickness. Currently, with both establishments, capital funds are fundamental to responding to the challenges of better serving the customer. It is in this context that Gina approached Hluvuku-Adsema to solicit a loan of 425 dollars. With this loan Gina intends to increase the volume of merchandise in order to respond to customer’s demands. Her business’ impact on the community is great; she supplies clothes at an extremely reasonable price and has created two jobs for herself and another woman.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Gina Moisés Sitoe A. de 37 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos pais viu os seus estudos interrompidos na 8ª classe devido a gravidez precoce do seu primeiro filho. O Marido é um militar e tem estado sempre fora da família. Com transferência do seu marido para província mais a Norte do Pais, viu-se obrigada a abrir um negocio de forma a sustentar os seus 3 filhos. Em conversa com vizinhos, soube da existência da Hhuvuku, aproximou-se e solicitou um empréstimo. Hoje em dia, o seu negocio conhece uma outra dinâmica, já conta com duas bancas e providencia emprego a 1 trabalhador ( uma mãe solteira). Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta as despesas familiares, escolares dos seus filhos, assim como de saúde da família em caso de doença. Actualmente com os dois estabelecimentos, o capital de trabalho é fundamental para responder os desafios de servir melhor o cliente é neste contexto que aproximou a Hluvuku e seus parceiros para solicitar um empréstimo de 10.400,00mt. Com este empréstimo pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria de forma a responder positivamente com as exigências dos clientes. A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade, pois fornece roupas a um preço bastante acessível e criou dois postos de trabalho para ela própria mais uma senhora viúva.

loans.use: To increase the stock of clothes in her shop

loans.name: Mursinah

texts.en:
Mursinah is a member of MBK who has requested a second loan of $100. She had been a farmer for sometime. The loan from MBK will partially be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her plantation and rice fields and the balance for weaving bamboo basket. She grows corn, cassava, and peanuts in her plantation. Her produce is contracted to wholesalers.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Farming - Petani

loans.name: Esih

texts.en:
Esih is a member of MBK who has requested her third loan of $125. Before she met MBK, Esih had borrowed the money from the local bank before, but she felt it was hard because the interest rate was very high and the loan repayment had to be made on a daily basis.

After becoming member of MBK, Esih felt relieved because the loan that she received can be used to buy food or inventory for Esih and Esih's child's general store.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by C. Patriawan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: General Store

loans.name: Enung

texts.en:
Enung is a member of MBK who will receive a third loan of $150. Enung and her husband had long been in the business of collecting used/recyclable materials like copper, aluminum, and pan. She also collect cardboard, shoes, and pail. The copper, aluminum, and pan are sold weekly generating revenue of IDR800,000 while cardboard, pail, and shoes are sold daily generating revenue of IDR50,000. Enung buys the recyclable at the following price – for 1 kilogram of cardboard the price is IDR700, 1 kilogram of pail at IDR1,600, and 1 kilogram of shoes at IDR500.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Collecting used/recyclable materials - Penampungan Barang Bekas

loans.name: Murdiah

texts.en:
Murdiah is a member of MBK who has requested a loan of $150. Murdiah had long been in the business of collecting used/recyclable materials. These are then sold every fortnight by delivery to larger collection/recycle centers. From revenue of IDR700,000, Murdiah derive an income of IDR300,000.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use:
Collecting used/recyclable materials -
Penampungan Barang Bekas

loans.name: Mursi

texts.en:
Mursi is a member of MBK who has requested a loan of $150. Mursi sells cut-up chicken in her village. The entire loan will be used to fund her cut-up chicken business. 1 cut-up chicken is sold at IDR2,500 and Mursi sells around 15 to 20 birds each day. Becoming a member of MBK and with its support she is able to acquire a refrigerator and motorcycle.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Selling cut-up chicken - Jual ayam potong

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Emin is a member of MBK requesting a loan of $125. From this loan, a portion will be used to purchase goods for her general store and the balance to fund her husband’s vegetable business in the market. Emin generates a daily revenue of IDR320,000 with an income of IDR20,000.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: General store - Warung

loans.name: Iyan

texts.en:
Iyan is an MBK member who has requested her third loan of $125. Iyan owns many businesses such as hawkering foods-noodles with meatball (bakso)-with her husband, sewing, as well as raising goats. Prior to becoming an MBK member, Iyan borrowed capital from relatives, but now after becoming a member, she is not only experiencing an increase in her income but also is able to pay for her childern's education. From selling bakso, Iyan generates revenue of IDR 300,000 daily, with an IDR 30,000 profit, while from her sewing business she sells the products on credit with biweekly payments. To make each piece of clothing that she later sells for IDR 60,000, Iyan requires an IDR 30,000 capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: for purchasing ingredients to sell bakso (noodle with meatball), materials for her sewing business, and for raising goats

loans.name: Ai

texts.en:
Ai is an MBK member who has requested her third loan of $150. Ai and her husband own a chicken farm and also do field farming. From her loan from MBK, some will be used to purchase chicken feeds and to buy additional chickens while the rest will be used to buy fertilizer and chemical for farming. The chickens were sold once a month, at a price of IDR 8,000 per kilogram.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feeds and to buy additional chickens

loans.name: Nuryanah

texts.en:
Enung is an MBK member who has requested her third loan in the amount of $75. Previously her store only sold daily essentials and vegetables, but after obtaining loans from MBK, now Enung also sells gasoline. She runs the business with her husband. In a day she earns IDR 100,000 of revenue with a profit of IDR 30,000

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase merchandises and gasoline to sell in her store

loans.name: Sapnah

texts.en:
Sapnah is an MBK member who requested her third loan of $100. She helps her husband by collecting second-hand or used goods. She sells the collected goods once a month. From Rp. 600,000 sales, she can get Rp. 300,000 profit.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Penampungan Barang Bekas (Collecting secondhand goods)

loans.name: Acih

texts.en:
Acih is an MBK member who requested a second loan of $100. Acih’s business is making button. The entire loan from MBK will be used to buy raw material for making buttons. From 1 roll of the raw material that costs Rp. 37,000, she can produce 22 dozens of buttons. 1 dozen of buttons is sold for Rp. 3,000. Now Acih also has an assistant who helps her making the buttons. The assistant’s salary is Rp.400 per 1 dozen of buttons.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Membuat Kancing (Making buttons)
